Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Power digital products with AI. Work with product teams to identify high-impact opportunities where AI can transform the user experience for millions—and then build the solutions to make them happen. Drive the process from possibility to production, delivering code that’s robust, reproducible, and built for scale.
Explore ways to push the boundaries of our AI capabilities. Stay at the bleeding edge of AI by investigating new models, techniques, and research. Learn fast across new domains, share findings with the team, and turn breakthrough ideas into production systems that deliver real-world impact.
Refine data foundations for exceptional results. Own the full data lifecycle—from acquisition and labeling to loading and management—to ensure our models are trained on clean, high-quality datasets that power top-performing systems.
Own your impact, end-to-end. Set smart priorities, manage execution, and consistently deliver high-quality results, even in ambiguous or fast-changing environments. Balance technical depth with strong ownership, growing your skills while delivering meaningful contributions.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Cosa ti proponiamo

All’interno della divisione ENG DIGITAL per la business line Eng AI&Data siamo alla ricerca di una figura di Data Scientist per progettualità legate all’AI, GenAI, Machine Learning e Data Science nella nostra unità di sviluppo di LLM proprietari.

Quali saranno le tue attività e responsabilità?

Sarai Responsabile Di Attività Di Analisi, Sviluppo e Implementazione Di Soluzioni Avanzate Basate Sul Machine Learning, AI e Generative AI Collaborando Con Un Team Di Data Scientist Ed AI Engineer. In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Delle Seguenti Attività

  • Progettare e sviluppare soluzioni di AI/ML robuste e scalabili;
  • Ottimizzare algoritmi e modelli di AI/ML;
  • Supportare la gestione dell'intero ciclo di vita di progetti di Data Science e Artificial Intelligence, dalla concezione al deployment;
  • Redigere e mantenere la documentazione tecniche relativa a Soluzioni e Modelli di AI.

Qualifiche e competenze richieste

Qualifiche Richieste

  • Un anno di esperienza nello sviluppo di soluzioni Python con le principali librerie per il Machine Learning (es. Scikit Learn) e per la visualizzazione (es. Matplotlib, Plotly, Bokeh, ecc.);
  • Esperienza nell’uso di framework di deep learning e NLP (es. PyTorch, Hugging Face, Langchain);
  • Esperienza nell’uso di sistemi di versionamento del codice (es. GIT);
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di valutazione delle performance di Algoritmi di AI;
  • Familiarità nello sviluppo di API, basate su architetture a microservizi;
  • Familiarità nell’uso di tecnologie cloud a supporto dello sviluppo dello sviluppo di soluzioni di AI, su almeno uno dei principali hyperscaler (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform);
  • Laurea in discipline informatiche, ingegneristiche o statistiche (Master o specializzazione in ambito Data Science vengono considerati un plus):
  • Buone capacità comunicative e di presentazione.

Competenze Aggiuntive Preferenziali

  • Conoscenze di base della teoria dei modelli generativi e LLM;
  • Conoscenza di framework e best practice per il serving LLM in Production (es. vLLM, LLMOps,
  • Pachyderm);
  • Esperienza nella creazione di soluzioni basate su container tramite l’uso di strumenti di virtualizzazione e scaling (es. Docker, Kubernetes);
  • Conoscenza delle piattaforme Cloudera e Databricks;
  • Conoscenza del framework Ray per il calcolo distribuito;
  • Esperienza nella redazione di documentazione tecnica.

Cosa cerchiamo nelle nostre persone?

  • Ambizione, nel perseguire grandi obiettivi e nell'investire sul miglioramento continuo;
  • Proattività, nell’anticipare e affrontare le sfide con iniziativa;
  • Trasparenza, nel comunicare apertamente e fornire feedback costruttivi;
  • Motivazione a migliorare e a crescere insieme agli altri, manifestando apertura al confronto per favorire la crescita collettiva e il raggiungimento degli obiettivi comuni.

Invia la tua candidatura e raccontaci come puoi fare la differenza. 

SEDE DI INSERIMENTO

Milano | Roma | Torino | Padova

L’annuncio è rivolto a tutti i candidati, senza distinzione di sesso, nel rispetto del Codice delle pari opportunità di cui al D.Lgs. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Per inviare la tua candidatura, accedi al nostro Job Center

Utente già registrato? Accedi >> Nuovo utente? Registrati >>

Unisciti a INAZ, il gruppo italiano leader nel settore HR Tech!

Siamo alla ricerca di colleghi e colleghe per la posizione di Data Scientist da inserire nel team di Ricerca e Sviluppo dedicato all’Ai.

Cosa facciamo?

Sviluppiamo soluzioni innovative per la gestione delle hr, utilizzando la tecnologia e l’AI per trasformare i dati in valore. Se sei un/una appassionato/a di analisi dei dati, machine learning e intelligenza artificiale, potresti essere la persona che stiamo cercando. Candidati oggi stesso e aiuta a plasmare il futuro dell’HR Tech con noi!

#Inazpeople

Ti offriamo:


Hybrid Work Program: flessibilità lavorativa per organizzarti tra ufficio e remoto.
Smart Working Pack: dotazione completa per lavorare efficacemente ovunque tu sia.
Piani di sviluppo carriera: formazione continua per crescere professionalmente e acquisire nuove competenze.
Diversità e Sostenibilità: promuoviamo un ambiente inclusivo e sostenibile, con un forte impegno per il work-life balance e la parità di genere.



Con chi lavorerai:

Entrerai a far parte del team dedicato all’intelligenza artificiale, collaborando con esperti/e in tecnologia, data engineer, analisti/e e sviluppatori/sviluppatrici per progettare e implementare modelli predittivi, algoritmi di machine learning e soluzioni data-driven. Lavorerai su dati reali e sfide complesse, contribuendo alla creazione di prodotti HR innovativi ed efficienti.

Desideriamo incontrare:

Professionisti/e con esperienza in Data Science, competenze in statistica, machine learning, Python e SQL. Se hai esperienza nell’analisi di grandi volumi di dati, sviluppo di modelli predittivi e desideri lavorare su progetti ad alto impatto nel campo dell’intelligenza artificiale, sei la persona che stiamo cercando!

Requisiti preferenziali:


Esperienza con strumenti di data visualization (es. Tableau, Power BI)
Conoscenza di tecnologie Big Data (es. Hadoop, Spark).
Familiarità con framework di deep learning (es. TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Capacità di lavorare in team multidisciplinari e con metodologie Agile



Sede di lavoro: Milano (modalità ibrida)

Per conoscerci meglio visita il nostro sito aziendale: www.inaz.it

La nostra organizzazione opera nel rispetto della parità di genere con l’impegno di sostenere l’inclusività e la diversity promuovendo una cultura inclusiva nel processo di selezione garantendo pari opportunità nello sviluppo personale e professionale nel rispetto del D. Lgs. n. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii. e D. Lgs. n. 215 e n. 216/2003 e ss. mm.ii.

Per maggiori dettagli sulla politica di Inaz relativamente alle pari opportunità consulta la nostra Carta per le pari opportunità e uguaglianza sul lavoro al seguente link: Carta pe4sZr le pariopportunità e l’uguaglianza sul lavoro. Inaz invita i candidati a prendere visione della informativa richiedenti impiego ai sensi della normativa privacy al link https://www.inaz.it/privacy/

LI-CA1

LI-Hybrid

Lgs. n. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii. e D. Lgs. n. 215 e n. 216/2003 e ss. mm.ii.

Per maggiori dettagli sulla politica di Inaz relativamente alle pari opportunità consulta la nostra Carta per le pari opportunità e uguaglianza sul lavoro al seguente link: Carta pe4sZr le pariopportunità e l’uguaglianza sul lavoro. Inaz invita i candidati a prendere visione della informativa richiedenti impiego ai sensi della normativa privacy al link https://www.inaz.it/privacy/

LI-CA1

LI-Hybrid

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🚀About Talentware

 

Talentware è una startup nata nel 2023 all’interno del Venture Studio di Bain & Company dall’idea di 3 Bain Alumni, con l'obiettivo di rivoluzionare l’approccio al talent management in azienda.

Talentware si propone infatti, tramite la propria piattaforma Software alimentata dall’Intelligenza Artificiale, di aiutare le aziende a coinvolgere, sviluppare e trattenere i propri talenti attraverso un approccio basato sulla mappatura e oggettivazione delle competenze. Ciò significa che grazie a Talentware le aziende hanno accesso a un radar sulle loro competenze interne, con una vista sempre aggiornata sui trend tecnologici e su quelli del proprio mercato. Analizzando infatti le preferenze lavorative, gli interessi, e le competenze di ciascun dipendente, Talentware crea automaticamente dei potenziali percorsi di carriera e identifica gli skill-gap di ciascun individuo al fine di suggerire opportunità di sviluppo personalizzate. In questo modo, le aziende possono finalmente allineare gli obiettivi di crescita dei propri dipendenti con quelli del proprio business.

 

👤Opportunità

 

In Talentware, stiamo rafforzando la nostra Skills intelligence al fine di supportare le aziende e i dipendenti con percorsi di carriera e sviluppo personalizzati. Grazie al potere dell'intelligenza artificiale, vogliamo garantire processi di upskilling e reskillng della forza lavoro adeguati e supportare l'azienda con una talent strategy efficace.

Far parte del team Data Science & Machine Learning sarà un'ottima opportunità per lavorare con complesse data pipelines e sistemi di machine learning avanzati, nonché partecipare allo sviluppo di nuove funzionalità AI-powered all’interno della piattaforma Talentware.

 

📝 Cosa farai

 

·        Sviluppare e mantenere la codebase AI di Talentware, garantendo alte prestazioni e manutenibilità del codice

·        Sviluppare e ottimizzare architetture cloud complesse per garantire scalabilità, affidabilità e performance elevate per l’elaborazione di grandi quantità di dati

·        Progettare e implementare pipeline CI/CD per automatizzare i processi di build, test e deployment continuo

·        Progettare e manutenere database relazionali, non relazionali e vettoriali complessi

·        Ottimizzare prompt e strategie di interazione con LLM al fine di ottimizzare stabilità, qualità e costo delle risposte

·        Sviluppare Agenti AI utilizzando i pattern state of the art e best practice per massimizzarne qualità, scalabilità e controllo

·        Fine-tuning di LLM open source per migliorare le performance rispetto a soluzioni generaliste

·        Gestire l’intero ciclo di vita dei modelli ML/LLM e delle pipeline ML/LLMOps, seguendo le attività di rilascio in produzione, monitoraggio, drift detection e retraining

           

🎯Cosa cerchiamo

 

·        Esperienza di 2-4 anni come Machine Learning Engineer o ruoli che richiedano competenze affini

·        System thinking: ogni sviluppo deve essere ragionato e valutato in base agli impatti che potrebbe avere su tutto l’ecosistema di Talentware

·        Utilizzo di modelli generativi di ultima generazione (es. ChatGPT, Claude) tramite API su larga scala

·        Conoscenza approfondita di prompt engineering per la progettazione di prompt efficaci, chain of thought e ragionamenti multi-step

·        Padronanza nell’utilizzo dello stack PyData (es. Pandas, Polars, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc) per la manipolazione, analisi e visualizzazione dei dati

·        Conoscenza avanzata dell’ecosistema AWS, in particolare per la costruzione di architetture serverless a microservizi per il processamento dati tramite AI (Bedrock, Batch, S3, Lambda, Step Functions, etc)

·        Utilizzo di linguaggi IAC (Infrastracture as Code) come Terraform o CloudFormation

·        Gestione efficace del codice con Git, conoscenza del git flow e del semantic versioning

 

Nice to have

·        Gestione ed utilizzo di database relazionali (es. Amazon RDS for Postgres), NoSQL (es. DynamoDB) e vettoriali (e.g. Qdrant).

·        Conoscenza di librerie come LangChain e LangGraph per sviluppare agenti conversazionali, workflow intelligenti e tool di automazione

·        Esperienza con framework di deep learning come TensorFlow e PyTorch per la costruzione e l’addestramento di reti neurali profonde

·        Conoscenza di sistemi linux based script Bash




🤝🏻Cosa ti offriamo

 

·        Stipendio competitivo (superiore alla media), da determinare in base all'esperienza e ai livelli di competenza del candidato

·        Opportunità di essere tra i primi dipendenti con un piano di stock options incentivante

·        Possibilità di lavorare a stretto contatto con i Founder e di partecipare alla costruzione della struttura di customer success di Talentware

·        Accesso ad attività ricorrenti di team-building e a ritiri aziendali

·        Formazione personalizzata e supporto tramite mentoring 

 

 

📌 Workplace: Principalmente Milano @WAO PL7 con modalità di lavoro ibrida. Sappi che la maggior parte dei Talentwarees vuole venire in ufficio perché apprendono più velocemente, performano meglio e soprattutto gli piace stare con le altre persone del team e sfruttare i vantaggi dello spazio di co-working.

Title: Sviluppatori Python – AI/LLM (Junior & Senior)
Description:
Il Ruolo

Herzum è alla ricerca di due sviluppatori che si uniscano al nostro team e forniscano supporto a uno dei nostri clienti in ambito finanziario: un Junior con un’esperienza minima di 2-3 anni e un Senior capace di occuparsi sia della parte operativa sia della supervisione e del coordinamento delle attività.

Requisiti:


Per entrambi i profili, proporzionate alla rispettiva seniority, sono richieste competenze in Python e esperienza nello sviluppo di modelli AI/LLM.
Capacità di comunicazione efficace e di lavoro in team.
Attitudine al problem-solving e gestione delle priorità.
Flessibilità e adattabilità in contesti dinamici.
Attenzione ai dettagli.



Principali strumenti utilizzati:


Piattaforma di orchestrazione: Windmill.
LLM principale: Mistral.
Linguaggio principale: Python.



Riportiamo come esempio due use case di attività che dovranno gestire, e che saranno replicati anche su altri progetti:

Use case 1:

Intelligent Document Processing integrato con processo AML(Anti-Money-Laundering)

Obiettivo: finalizzare un sistema IDP per (i) la tipizzazione dei documenti e (ii) l’estrazione di entità (entity extraction) da documenti relativi a richieste AML, integrando il sistema nel workflow AML (sia in fase “tattica” sia con possibilità di integrazione “target”).

Attività principali:


Training del modello LLM in Python, in modalità “Agile” insieme al Business e alle strutture competenti AML.
Integrazione nel workflow e supporto all’integrazione con fornitori e applicativi esterni.
Test di integrazione e funzionali.
Correzione degli errori e ottimizzazione dei prompt.
Possibile esperienza di coding su modelli AI/LLM.
Change management e supporto all’onboarding degli strumenti di AI.



Use case 2:

Estensione casi d’uso IDP – Data Quality/ Data Remediation/Onboarding

Obiettivo: sviluppare l’IDP, partendo da quanto elaborato nello use case 1, per automatizzare (i) la tipizzazione dei documenti e (ii) l’estrazione di entità (entity exctraction) da documenti di natura creditizia e legale, integrando queste informazioni nei processi di Data Quality, Data Remediation e New Cases Onboarding.

Attività principali:


Collaborazione con il Business e l’Organizzazione per la definizione dettagliata dei requisiti e la tipizzazione dei documenti.
Training del modello LLM in Python, in modalità “Agile”, insieme al Business e alle strutture competenti di Middle Office.
Integrazione nel workflow e supporto all’integrazione con fornitori e applicativi esterni.
Possibile esperienza di coding su modelli AI/LLM.
Correzione degli errori e ottimizzazione dei prompt.



Informazioni aggiuntive:


Modalità di lavoro: full remote.
Start date: settembre.



Unisciti a noi! Entra a far parte di un team che vive di innovazione, crede nel talento e punta all’eccellenza. Il tuo prossimo passo di carriera inizia qui.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto a entrambi i sessi (L. 903/77 e 125/91) e a persone di tutte le età e nazionalità (D.Lgs. 215/03 e 216/03).

Title: Digital & Media - Data Scientist Consultant
Description:
Descrizione azienda




JAKALA è un'azienda che lavora su dati, intelligenza artificiale e sviluppo di esperienze per generare un impatto significativo e duraturo a livello globale.




Presenti in oltre 30 città in 21 paesi, i nostri team uniscono competenze su strategia, tecnologia, creatività e operations per offrire esperienze personalizzate e soluzioni trasformative ai nostri clienti, grazie al supporto di dati e intelligenza artificiale. I Jakalers sono un gruppo eterogeneo di oltre 3.000 persone, animate da passione, ambizione e idee brillanti. Proprio questa combinazione unica di talenti è il fattore distintivo che ha ispirato il nostro purpose: Together to get there.




Creare un mondo migliore è il nostro obiettivo ultimo: la nostra ambizione è generare valore per tutti i nostri stakeholder in modo sostenibile, con particolare attenzione a etica, clima e qualità. Nel 2021, abbiamo scelto di diventare una Società Benefit, dimostrando il nostro impegno di lungo periodo e la volontà di proteggere i principi e i valori che ogni giorno guidano le nostre azioni.




Crediamo che la diversità sia la chiave del nostro successo e, per questo, siamo impegnati a creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, dove ciascuno possa sentirsi valorizzato per la propria unicità. Tutte le nostre opportunità di lavoro sono aperte ai candidati appartenenti alle categorie protette L.68/99.







Posizione

Per il potenziamento della Business Unit Digital & Media ricerchiamo un/a Digital Data Scientist con ottime capacità di lavoro in squadra, di apprendimento e di problem solving. Come Data Scientist verrai inserito/a nel Team Marketing Data Science, ti occuperai della progettazione, implementazione, gestione di processi big data e machine learning pipelines lavorando a stretto contatto con Data Engineers e Data Viz specialists.

Ecco un esempio delle attività che seguirai:

Applicazione di modelli di Marketing Mix Model per valutare l'impatto dei canali media sulle vendite;
Applicazione di modelli di Attribuzione per il marketing;
Analisi dei Big Data per i nostri clienti su Data warehouse in Cloud come Google BigQuery o similare;
Applicazione di modelli di segmentazione, clustering, churn della customer base;
Utilizzo di modelli di Generative AI (OpenAI, Google, Open Source) applicati ad use-cases di marketing come creazione e generazione di contenuti, traduzione, generazione di immagini, valorizzazione di know how aziendale;







Requisiti

Il/la candidato/a ideale possiede:

Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Ingegneria o altre discipline scientifiche
Almeno 1 o 2 anni di esperienza nella progettazione di soluzioni analitiche in ambito gestione e analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics e machine learning
Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione per la Data Science: Python, SQL, R.
Passione/Interesse per il digital marketing
Familiarità con le principali soluzioni cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) o precedenti esperienze nel digital marketing costituiranno elemento preferenziale.
Capacità di lavorare in team
Buona conoscenza lingua inglese scritta e orale







Nice to have:

Conoscenza di base del framework di elaborazione di Big Data Spark
Precedenti esperienze lavorative nel marketing digitale, inclusa esperienza di consulenza
Esperienza / progetti con librerie di Bayesian Modeling.







Se investi tempo nel nostro percorso di Recruiting, avrai tutto il nostro impegno. E oltre.

La tua candidatura verrà presa in carico da un Recruiter del nostro Team Talent Acquisition, che si prenderà cura di visionare il tuo CV e le informazioni fornite. Sarà poi il tuo Recruiter di riferimento a ricontattarti per condividere il nostro feedback per te, indipendentemente dall’esito. Riceverai in ogni caso suggerimenti di sviluppo legati all’ottimizzazione del tuo CV, spunti per consolidare il tuo percorso di carriera e insight sull’arena competitiva in cui sei inserit*. Niente AI: lo facciamo a mano, col cuore, per te.
Ogni ora che vorrai investire nel conoscere JAKALA te la restituiamo per conoscerti meglio: grazie all’iniziativa “Your Time Back” e la nostra partnership strategica con Unobravo, hai diritto ad un percorso di empowerment di sessioni equivalenti al numero di interviste che hai sostenuto e che potrai spendere come vorrai. Sappiamo che cercare lavoro può essere sfidante: insieme a Unobravo vogliamo esserti vicini, anche se ancora non ci conosciamo.
Show more

  • La tua candidatura verrà presa in carico da un Recruiter del nostro Team Talent Acquisition, che si prenderà cura di visionare il tuo CV e le informazioni fornite. Sarà poi il tuo Recruiter di riferimento a ricontattarti per condividere il nostro feedback per te, indipendentemente dall’esito. Riceverai in ogni caso suggerimenti di sviluppo legati all’ottimizzazione del tuo CV, spunti per consolidare il tuo percorso di carriera e insight sull’arena competitiva in cui sei inserit*. Niente AI: lo facciamo a mano, col cuore, per te.
  • Ogni ora che vorrai investire nel conoscere JAKALA te la restituiamo per conoscerti meglio: grazie all’iniziativa “Your Time Back” e la nostra partnership strategica con Unobravo, hai diritto ad un percorso di empowerment di sessioni equivalenti al numero di interviste che hai sostenuto e che potrai spendere come vorrai. Sappiamo che cercare lavoro può essere sfidante: insieme a Unobravo vogliamo esserti vicini, anche se ancora non ci conosciamo.

Title: Freelance AI Agent Assistant
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

If you're a professional who works with AI Data Annotation and friendly user of LLMs, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your editing, annotating, fact-checking and creative skills to an AI training project.

This is a freelance role for a project, and your typical tasks may include:


Conduct high-quality web searches to verify facts, gather supporting data, and cross-check AI responses.
Perform fact-checking and intent verification to ensure AI responses align with the user's goals.
Carefully review and flag any inaccuracies, inconsistencies, or irrelevant answers.
Provide structured feedback on AI-generated content to help improve model performance.
Work effectively with large language models (LLMs), understanding their capabilities and limitations, and applying best practices when interacting with them
Prompt generation with a purpose to receive the best quality result of LLMs


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher
You have professional and/or educational experience in data annotation, demonstrate a deeper-than-user-level interest in AI, and possess intellectual breadth and curiosity
You are skilled in web searching, fact-checking, intent-checking, able to work with LLMs and have great attention to detail
Your level of English is upper-intermediate (B2) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Stageur
Description:
The team applies advanced analytics—including machine learning, quantitative algorithms, and data mining techniques— to obtain business insights and solve problems. We are actively involved throughout the entire lifecycle, from initial design to final implementation. Our stakeholders span all areas of the bank, including business, risk, retail, and corporate banking.




Our scope of work includes:

Building and maintaining a robust codebase that supports the creation of ML models
Training, deploying, and monitoring machine learning models tailored to various business needs.
Conducting ad hoc data analyses
Developing dashboards and tools to enhance data accessibility and support a more data-driven organization.




The employee will focus on developing a deep learning model for the mortgage portfolio. Specifically, they will evaluate different approaches and compare them with the model currently in production.

For this purpose, we are looking for students interested in writing their thesis on this topic.




Experiences:

Practical experience (at least 2+ years) with programming language such as Python
Familiarity with machine learning libraries and frameworks (e.g. scikit-learn...)
Knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming and Git workflows




Nice to Have:

Personal public projects on GitHub/Azure or similar
Experience with Keras/TensorFlow for deep learning models.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices




Skills:

Demonstrated solid data handling skills.
Fluent written and spoken English
Strong verbal and written communication skills




Personal Characteristics:

Self-driven with the ability to figure out solutions by him or herself
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Must possess an energetic, self-motivated work ethic.
Effectively communicate with many levels.
Proven to perform under pressure.
High ethical standards, honesty, integrity.




About ING

ING offers many opportunities to build a diverse and rewarding career. You will be joining an international innovative digital bank, the first in Italy to adopt a fully flexible smart working model, and you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can grow both as an individual and as a professional. Our purpose - empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and in business - represents our belief in people’s potential. We don’t judge, coach or to tell people how to live their lives. We empower people and businesses to realize their own vision for a better future.

#doyourthing is our brand direction with us each and every day. It is how we articulate our purpose and our promise to make banking frictionless to the world.

‘do your thing’ is about people being free to live the life they want to live, knowing that they will make their world a little better for it.

Do you think you are "a step ahead"? Apply now!




The benefits of joining ING

In addition to being a part of a great team, working in a fun and innovative environment, we offer:

Super flexible smart working
Competitive base salaries and performance based bonuses
Diverse cultures & Innovative mindsets
International Environment
Commitment to sustainability
Lots of training development opportunities to help you grow
Lots of moments dedicated to physical and mental well-being
A special day off when it is your birthday: we call it #doyourbirthday!
And of course we can’t forget: free water & coffee at the office!




Our Commitment

Diversity is a fundamental element of our corporate culture, and we are fully committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment, based on mutual respect and the value of diversity, offering equal job opportunities to all qualified candidates.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
La divisione Technology ricerca, per importante Azienda Finale, SPA Italiana in forte espansione, con "anima" Tech, un profilo "AI Engineer" per crescita del Contesto.

Dettagli sul cliente

La Società Cliente è il principale polo di formazione professionale in Italia e uno dei maggiori player europei nel settore dell'education.

L'azienda si distingue per l'utilizzo di tecnologie avanzate, tra cui intelligenza artificiale e simulazioni immersive, per garantire esperienze di apprendimento efficaci e personalizzate.

Descrizione

A seguire il perimetro di attività del Ruolo:

Progettare e sviluppare architetture AI scalabili ed efficienti, integrandole nei nostri prodotti in collaborazione con il team infra e back-end.
Scrivere codice e prototipi, testare modelli ML/LLM e deployarli in produzione su AWS.
Disegnare tecnicamente le modalità di messa a terra delle idee raccolte dal team innovation e supportarlo condividendo nuove tecnologie
Configurare e ottimizzare ambienti cloud su AWS, sfruttando servizi come Sagemaker, Bedrock, Lambda, DynamoDB, ECR e altri.
Coordinarti e confrontarti con system integrator, fornitori e gli altri team di sviluppo interni, assicurando allineamento tecnico e qualità degli sviluppi.
Sperimentare nuove soluzioni, valutando framework, librerie e tool per accelerare la delivery e migliorare le performance dei modelli.
Contribuire alla definizione di pipeline MLOps e delle practice per il ciclo di vita dei modelli AI.
Progettare e sviluppare architetture AI scalabili ed efficienti, integrandole nei nostri prodotti in collaborazione con il team infra e back-end.
Scrivere codice e prototipi, testare modelli ML/LLM e deployarli in produzione su AWS.
Disegnare tecnicamente le modalità di messa a terra delle idee raccolte dal team innovation e supportarlo condividendo nuove tecnologie
Configurare e ottimizzare ambienti cloud su AWS, sfruttando servizi come Sagemaker, Bedrock, Lambda, DynamoDB, ECR e altri.
Coordinarti e confrontarti con system integrator, fornitori e gli altri team di sviluppo interni, assicurando allineamento tecnico e qualità degli sviluppi.
Sperimentare nuove soluzioni, valutando framework, librerie e tool per accelerare la delivery e migliorare le performance dei modelli.
Contribuire alla definizione di pipeline MLOps e delle practice per il ciclo di vita dei modelli AI.

Profilo del Candidato

Il candidato / a ideale è ha le seguenti caratteristiche:

- Esperienza pratica nello sviluppo di progetti AI/ML, inclusi modelli NLP o LLM (HuggingFace, LangChain, Pinecone o simili).

- Solide competenze di programmazione, principalmente in Python (conoscenze di Node, Go o Java sono un plus), con attenzione alla qualità del codice e alla scalabilità.

- Ottima conoscenza di AWS, dei suoi servizi gestiti e delle practice di security, performance e cost optimization.

- Capacità di interazione e coordinamento, sia con i team interni (infra, back-end, prodotto), sia con partner esterni e system integrator.

- Curiosità e proattività: ti aggiorni, sperimenti, porti idee e cerchi sempre soluzioni migliorative.

offerta di lavoro

La Società offre un ambiente di lavoro dinamico, stimolante e in forte crescita.

Title: Junior – AI & RPA Developer Data analytics
Description:
Junior - AI & RPA Developer Data analytics

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team Smart Solutions Lab di Deloitte Business Solution nella sedi di Milano e Roma che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Smart Solutions Lab si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti nella individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttività, efficienza, qualità dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie di AI, Robotics Process Automation e Data Visualization. All’interno del team ci si impegna a definire l'avanguardia delle soluzioni aziendali attraverso l'uso innovativo di concetti di intelligenza artificiale, Robotics Process Automation (RPA) e Optical Character Recognition (OCR). Oltre all'automazione dei processi, una parte delle attività produttive si concentra sulla creazione di dashboard avanzate in ambito analytics tramite l’utilizzo di strumenti come PowerBI o Qlik Sense. La Data Visualization è cruciale per rendere i dati comprensibili, utili e facilmente fruibili da parte dei clienti.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:


Raccogliere, sintetizzare e analizzare dati complessi utilizzando strumenti e tecnologie appropriati;
Utilizzare efficientemente le principali tecnologie nell'analisi e progettazione dei processi aziendali end-to-end, dall'identificazione delle inefficienze (utilizzando tecniche quantitative e qualitative) alla progettazione e all'implementazione dei processi aziendali TO-BE;


Winning Requirements


Laurea in materie tecnico/scientifiche: Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Statistica
Disponibilità a viaggiare in Italia e all'estero
Confidenza con strumenti di Data Visualization (PowerBI, Qlik Sense, QlikView o Tableau)
Conoscenza base di strumenti di automazione robotica quali UiPath e BluePrism
Conoscenza del linguaggio SQL e utilizzo di SQL Server
Conoscenza di linguaggi per lo sviluppo web (HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, ASP.NET, node.js)
Esperienza nello sviluppo di APP su ambiente iOS e/o Android


To Make An Impact That Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo.

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About CoreView




CoreView is the global leader in effortless Microsoft 365 (M365) security, governance, and administration. Trusted by Fortune 100 companies, we empower organizations to simplify complex M365 environments, strengthen security, and maximize ROI—with over 20 million users managed worldwide.




Our unified, cloud-native platform delivers powerful automation, rapid value, and end-to-end visibility across the entire M365 ecosystem. Backed by world-class support and a collaborative, innovative culture, CoreView is a place where your ideas matter and your work truly impact global enterprises.




Job Summary

CoreView is looking for an AI Engineer. As a member of the AI development team, you'll channel your AI expertise, build smarter features using GenAI technologies, and guide the creation of exceptional user-centric and automated AI workflows.




At CoreView, we build tools that transform both our internal company workflows and our customer-facing products.




You'll work with AI frameworks like Agno, but we are open-minded about everything that is top-notch in the field. Our stack includes Qdrant and Postgres for blazing-fast searches and persistent storage. If you have a passion for GenAI and artificial intelligence and the drive to explore uncharted territories, CoreView is your stage to perform.




Job responsibilities

Drive the software architecture for innovative GenAI-driven features, ensuring scalability, usability, and intelligence.
Develop core AI features leveraging GenAI frameworks for smart decision-making and personalized in-product experiences.
Build AI-powered tools to enhance internal development workflows and accelerate product innovation.
Optimize AI models and agent frameworks to respond faster and smarter.
Help internal engineers with AI topics, fostering an environment of growth, innovation, and AI excitement.
Enhance security and ethical AI practices within the product, ensuring compliance with industry guidelines.
Expand AI libraries, workflows, and tooling to boost engineering efficiency and maintainability.
Keep CoreView at the forefront of the GenAI and AI world by evaluating emerging technologies and integrating what’s relevant.




Job requirements

Enthusiastic about building intelligent and scalable solutions using cutting-edge GenAI technologies.
Strong understanding of GenAI’s role in distributed systems, conversational agents, and integration pipelines.
Proficient in Python, with experience in designing modular and agentic AI-driven tools and SDK.
Experience building autonomous systems with agentic frameworks like Agno, CrewAI, and LangChain.
Familiarity with vector databases like Qdrant and relational databases like PostgreSQL.
Dive deep into prompt engineering and optimization, focusing on high-quality AI-generated output.
Strong problem-solving skills with a passion for troubleshooting agentic frameworks and GenAI tooling.
Passion and curiosity for topics like fine-tuning, MLX, LLMStudio, and Ollama.
Experience with traditional machine learning techniques (e.g., supervised/unsupervised learning, feature engineering, model evaluation) and applying models such as regression, classification, and clustering to real-world data problems at scale.
Proficient in English—capable of collaborating across global teams.




Additional Notes:

CoreView is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that celebrates diversity and innovation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination based on gender, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or any other protected group status.

Show more
HTML:
About CoreView


CoreView is the global leader in effortless Microsoft 365 (M365) security, governance, and administration. Trusted by Fortune 100 companies, we empower organizations to simplify complex M365 environments, strengthen security, and maximize ROI—with over 20 million users managed worldwide.


Our unified, cloud-native platform delivers powerful automation, rapid value, and end-to-end visibility across the entire M365 ecosystem. Backed by world-class support and a collaborative, innovative culture, CoreView is a place where your ideas matter and your work truly impact global enterprises.


Job Summary

CoreView is looking for an AI Engineer. As a member of the AI development team, you'll channel your AI expertise, build smarter features using GenAI technologies, and guide the creation of exceptional user-centric and automated AI workflows.


At CoreView, we build tools that transform both our internal company workflows and our customer-facing products.


You'll work with AI frameworks like Agno, but we are open-minded about everything that is top-notch in the field. Our stack includes Qdrant and Postgres for blazing-fast searches and persistent storage. If you have a passion for GenAI and artificial intelligence and the drive to explore uncharted territories, CoreView is your stage to perform.


Job responsibilities

  • Drive the software architecture for innovative GenAI-driven features, ensuring scalability, usability, and intelligence.
  • Develop core AI features leveraging GenAI frameworks for smart decision-making and personalized in-product experiences.
  • Build AI-powered tools to enhance internal development workflows and accelerate product innovation.
  • Optimize AI models and agent frameworks to respond faster and smarter.
  • Help internal engineers with AI topics, fostering an environment of growth, innovation, and AI excitement.
  • Enhance security and ethical AI practices within the product, ensuring compliance with industry guidelines.
  • Expand AI libraries, workflows, and tooling to boost engineering efficiency and maintainability.
  • Keep CoreView at the forefront of the GenAI and AI world by evaluating emerging technologies and integrating what’s relevant.


Job requirements

  • Enthusiastic about building intelligent and scalable solutions using cutting-edge GenAI technologies.
  • Strong understanding of GenAI’s role in distributed systems, conversational agents, and integration pipelines.
  • Proficient in Python, with experience in designing modular and agentic AI-driven tools and SDK.
  • Experience building autonomous systems with agentic frameworks like Agno, CrewAI, and LangChain.
  • Familiarity with vector databases like Qdrant and relational databases like PostgreSQL.
  • Dive deep into prompt engineering and optimization, focusing on high-quality AI-generated output.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with a passion for troubleshooting agentic frameworks and GenAI tooling.
  • Passion and curiosity for topics like fine-tuning, MLX, LLMStudio, and Ollama.
  • Experience with traditional machine learning techniques (e.g., supervised/unsupervised learning, feature engineering, model evaluation) and applying models such as regression, classification, and clustering to real-world data problems at scale.
  • Proficient in English—capable of collaborating across global teams.


Additional Notes:

CoreView is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that celebrates diversity and innovation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination based on gender, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or any other protected group status.

Title: Experienced – Data Scientist GenAI
Description:
Stiamo cercando una figura Senior Consultant da inserire nel team Digital, AI Controls & Algorithms per le sedi di Roma e Milano che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il business Digital, AI Controls & Algorithms si occupa di fornire servizi di Digital Transformation, che hanno l’obiettivo di supportare la digitalizzazione dei processi interni di business, mettendo in atto attività che prevedono l’utilizzo di strumenti di Data Analytics, Machine Learning, IoT e AI sfruttando i principali servizi messi a disposizione dai più importanti player del settore Cloud.

Your Role

La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di:


Supervisionare, coordinare e gestire, come Team Leader, un team di sviluppo o consulenti junior;
Progettare ed analizzare soluzioni IT complesse sia di tipo applicativo che di integrazione;
Gestire autonomamente troubleshooting articolati e sotto pressione;
Lavorare in team numerosi dislocati anche su scala internazionale.


Winning Requirements


Laurea in materie STEM;
Esperienza nella gestione end-to-end di progetti di Data Science: raccolta requisiti, progettazione, sviluppo e test di soluzioni AI
Esperienza nello sviluppo di applicazioni di Generative AI (langchain, llamaindex, ecc.)
Ottima conoscenza di Python e delle librerie per manipolazione dati e sviluppo modelli (Pandas, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, ecc.);
Esperienza con strumenti di containerizzazione (e.g. docker)
Conoscenza di strumenti e linguaggi per la manipolazione dei dati: SQL, MongoDB, Neo4j, Spark, ecc.
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese;
Flessibilità, disponibilità a viaggiare.


To Make An Impact That Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo.

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che - in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti - hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

Title: Data Scientist - Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

FedEx Dataworks is an organization rooted in connecting the physical and digital sides of their network to meet today's needs and address tomorrow's challenges. The Data Scientist role involves leveraging AI and data science to optimize delivery experiences and contribute to data-driven solutions in logistics.




Responsibilities:

• Under full supervision, helps advance Dataworks’ broad capabilities to use and deploy cutting edge data science and machine learning tools and methods in Dataworks projects, platforms and products.

• Anchors current best practices by supporting the design and build of reusable data science assets.

• Simultaneously works to help keep Dataworks on the bleeding edge by researching and understanding the very latest and most sophisticated methods and tools for grappling with large scale and complex problems.

• Learns and helps apply descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, prescriptive and ensemble modeling, statistical techniques, and use of database tools and/or other approaches in quantitative analysis of complex business situations.

• Helps provide recommendations to issues through knowledge of data scientific methods and machine learning / data engineering practices.

• Works in tandem with data scientists in peer positions.

• The Data Scientist I plays a pivotal role, focused on supporting data science innovation within Dataworks, helping to define and build the Dataworks organization, and supporting more senior data scientists in the delivery of key business initiatives.

• S/he acts as a “universal translator” between IT, business, software engineers and data engineers, collaborating with these multi-disciplinary teams.

• The Data Scientist I will contribute to the adherence of technical standards for data science and machine learning, including the design and construction of reusable data assets.

• S/he will learn to work with large data sets and solve difficult analytical problems, often applying advanced methods.

• S/he will support the creation and implementation of solutions from concept to production, using current and emerging technologies to evaluate trends and develop actionable insights and recommendations.

• Day-to-day, s/he will be involved in code development and the support of small-scale deployments.

• Understanding at a high-level both the business and technical problems Dataworks aims to solve

• Exploring data and crafting models to answer core business problems that may not have a common blueprint

• Supporting the invention of new approaches and algorithms for tackling data intensive problems

• Helping the team scale up from “laptop-scale” to “cluster scale” problems by contributing to efforts to standardize and industrialize solutions

• Delivering tangible value rapidly, collaborating with diverse teams of varying backgrounds and disciplines

• Interacting with peer technologists from the broader enterprise and outside of FedEx (partner ecosystems and customers) to create synergies and identify opportunities for improvement

• Following best practices for future reuse in the form of accessible, reusable patterns, templates, and code bases




Qualifications:




-Required:

• Technical background in computer science, data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistics or other quantitative and computational science

• Experience or familiarity with designing and deploying large scale technical solutions, which deliver tangible, ongoing value

• Direct experience or familiarity with building and deploying production systems that implement modern, data scientific methods at scale

• Ability to context-switch, to provide support to dispersed teams which may need an 'expert hacker' to unblock an especially challenging technical obstacle, and to work through problems as they are still being defined

• Demonstrated ability to support technical projects within a team, often working under tight time constraints to deliver value

• An 'engineering' mindset, willing to make rapid, pragmatic decisions to improve performance, accelerate progress or magnify impact

• Comfort with working with distributed teams on code-based deliverables, using version control systems and code reviews

• Solid theoretical grounding in the mathematical core of the major ideas in data science

• Good understanding or familiarity with a class of modelling or analytical techniques, often supported by Masters-level research in the subject

• Familiarity with the mathematical 'primitives' and generalizations of data science – e.g., expertise in Linear Algebra, and Vector Calculus

• Use of agile and devops practices for project and software management including continuous integration and continuous delivery

• Strong knowledge in advanced data science and machine learning tools and methods, including the iterative development of analysis pipelines to provide insights at scale.

• Strong knowledge and experience in conducting end-to end analyses, including data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, and presentations.

• Experience as a member of multi-functional project teams.

• Strong oral and written communication skills.

• General knowledge or familiarity with some of the following common languages and tools: SKLearn, XGBoost, Tensorflow, Pytorch, MLlib and other core machine learning frameworks, Python, Scala, Java and other modern programming languages, MLFlow, Databricks, Spark, Kafka and other data tools and frameworks, CPLEX, Gurobi and other similar optimization modeling packages.

• Data Scientist I Minimum Qualifications: Minimum Education: Bachelor's Degree in computer science, operations research, statistics, applied mathematics or related quantitative discipline. A related advanced degree may offset the related experience requirements.

• Minimum Experience: One-year equivalent experience in computer science, operations research, statistics, applied mathematics or related quantitative discipline. A related advanced degree may offset the related experience requirements.

• Data Scientist II Minimum Qualifications: Minimum Education: Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Operations Research, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.

• Minimum Experience: At least two (2) years of professional experience applying data science (e.g., machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistical analysis), operations research (e.g., optimization, algorithms, mathematical modeling), and data analytics to reduce costs, enhance profitability, and improve customer experience. An advanced degree in a related field may be considered in lieu of some experience.

• Data Scientist III Minimum Qualifications: Minimum Education: Master’s Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Operations Research, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or related quantitative discipline. Directly related PhD preferred.

• Minimum Experience: At least three-four (3-4) years of professional experience applying data science (e.g., machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistical analysis), operations research (e.g., optimization, algorithms, mathematical modeling), and data analytics to reduce costs, enhance profitability, and improve customer experience. An advanced degree in a related field may be considered in lieu of some experience.




-Preferred:

• Building and managing data pipelines: You'll be skilled in setting up and maintaining automated processes (like ETL) to get data from different sources into a usable format, using tools like Airflow.

• Optimizing data for analysis: You'll know how to store and access data efficiently in various databases (SQL) and data warehouses (like Snowflake or BigQuery) so it's ready for model building.

• Ensuring data quality: You'll be able to create systems that check, clean, and track data to make sure it's reliable and accurate for machine learning models.




Company:

Please follow the official FedEx LinkedIn Company Page for updates, product and service information, operating company news and regular content: https://www.linkedin.com/company/fedex/. FedEx Dataworks has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description


Spait Infotech is a leading software development and staffing company with a strong global presence in India, USA, Canada, UK, and Australia. We specialize in delivering cutting-edge software solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of businesses worldwide. Our team of skilled developers and IT professionals ensure high-quality services in software development, including web applications, mobile apps, and enterprise solutions. Additionally, we provide comprehensive staffing solutions to support organizational growth, offering temporary staffing, contract-to-hire, and direct hire placements.


Role Description


This is a contract role for a Data Scientist based on-site in Wilmington, DE. The Data Scientist will be responsible for analyzing large datasets, performing statistical analyses, and creating data visualizations. Other tasks include developing predictive models, conducting data analysis, and identifying trends and patterns in data to support business decisions. The role requires collaboration with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions.


Qualifications

\n

Data Science and Statistics skills
\n

Proficiency in Data Analytics, including processing and analyzing large datasets
\n

Competence in Data Visualization tools and techniques
\n

Strong Data Analysis skills
\n

Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills
\n

Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team setting
\n

Experience in programming languages such as Python or R
\n

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field
\n

Experience in the software development industry is a plus
\n

\n

Title: Spontaneous Application
Description:
About Pathway

Pathway is building live AI systems that think and learn in real time as humans do. Our mission is to deeply understand how and why LLMs work, fundamentally changing the way models think.

The team is made up of AI luminaries. Pathway's CTO, Jan Chorowski, co-authored papers with Geoff Hinton and Yoshua Bengio and was one of the first people to apply attention to speech. Our CSO, Adrian Kosowski, received his PhD in Theoretical Computer Science at the age of 20 and made significant contributions across numerous scientific fields, including AI and quantum information. He also served as a professor and a coach for competitive programmers at Ecole Polytechnique. The team also includes numerous world's top scientists and competitive programmers, alongside seasoned Silicon Valley executives.

Pathway has strong investor backing. To date, we have raised over $15M; our latest reported round was our seed. Our offices are located in Palo Alto, CA, as well as Paris, France, and Wroclaw, Poland.

Requirements

You are:


Willing to learn and grow in the job
Respectful of others
Fluent in English


Why You Should Apply


Opportunity to work on the ground floor of the ever-expanding AI industry close to some of the most groundbreaking innovations
Work closely with the Team and gain hands-on experience scaling a disruptive AI company
High visibility and impact roles
Diverse, multicultural environment


Benefits


Type of contract: permanent employment contract
Benefits: Employee Stock Option Plan
Location: Remote work. Possibility to work or meet with other team members in one of our offices: Palo Alto, CA; Paris, France or Wroclaw, Poland
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

Coinbase is on a mission to increase economic freedom in the world and is seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to help optimize operations using ML and GenAI. This role involves developing and operating machine learning models at scale, contributing to innovative solutions at the intersection of blockchain and AI.




Responsibilities:

• Hands-on develop, productionize, and operate Machine Learning models and pipelines at scale

• Contribute to our ML models and work at the intersection of Blockchain and AI technologies

• Work with our senior engineers and collaborate with our product partners to identify and solve new use cases for ML on blockchain




Qualifications:




-Required:

• 2+ yrs of industry experience as a Machine Learning Engineer

• M.S in ML/CS/EE or BS with equivalent ML experience

• Solid software engineering skills

• Solid foundation in modern ML techniques (e.g., DNNs, transformers, LLMs, classification)

• Experience with coding on ML platforms (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch)

• Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and challenges




-Preferred:

• Knowledge of crypto/blockchain technology




Company:

Coinbase is a crypto exchange and wallet platform that allows merchants and consumers to buy, sell, and store digital currencies. Coinbase has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Show more

Coinbase is a crypto exchange and wallet platform that allows merchants and consumers to buy, sell, and store digital currencies. Coinbase has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer (RL/VLM) – Robotics Startup

New York, NY | $300–400k + Equity

Overview

We are looking for best-in-class ML Engineers who are experts in Reinforcement Learning (RL) & Visual Language Models (VLM) for a robotics start-up based in New York.

This startup is developing highly flexible, general-purpose robotic systems powered by cutting-edge AI. Their systems are already deployed with real customers, generating both revenue and valuable data. Rather than building humanoids or speculative prototypes, this company focuses on practical, AI-enabled robots that can be installed in hours and rapidly trained to perform real-world tasks.

Backed by a strong founding team and early-stage investment, the company is now scaling up deployments and expanding its technical team. This is an opportunity to work across the entire robotics stack and help shape the future of real-world automation.

Key Responsibilities

The successful candidate will play a hands-on role in the research, development, and deployment of advanced machine learning models for robotic control. Responsibilities include:


Designing and implementing Reinforcement Learning algorithms for robotic manipulation and task execution.
Developing and integrating Vision-Language Models to enable robots to understand and act upon high-level natural language commands and visual inputs.
Working with large-scale datasets for training and fine-tuning ML models, including data collection and augmentation strategies.
Collaborating with robotics software engineers to integrate ML models into the real-time control stack.
Optimizing and deploying ML models to ensure low-latency performance on robotic hardware.
Conducting experiments and evaluations to benchmark model performance and identify areas for improvement.
Staying up-to-date with the latest research in RL, VLM, and embodied AI.


Key Requirements


Strong machine learning fundamentals with a proven track record of delivering production-quality ML models.
Expertise in Reinforcement Learning (RL), including experience with various RL algorithms (e.g., PPO, SAC, DDPG) and frameworks (e.g., Stable Baselines, Ray RLlib).
Experience working with Vision-Language Models (VLM), including familiarity with models like CLIP, DALL-E, or similar, and their application to robotic perception and control.
Proficiency with Python and deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Experience with large-scale data processing and training for deep learning models.
Familiarity with robotics concepts and an understanding of how ML models interact with physical systems.
Strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative approach to research and development.


Bonus Experience


Experience with robot simulation tools (e.g., MuJoCo, Isaac Gym) for training and evaluating RL agents.
Background in computer vision or natural language processing.
Familiarity with robot operating systems (ROS/ROS2).
Publications in top-tier ML or robotics conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CoRL, RSS).
Experience deploying ML models to edge devices or embedded systems.


Why This Opportunity?

This is not a research lab in isolation. The company is already shipping robots and scaling fast. Engineers here work on systems that are used daily by real customers, generating value and shaping the roadmap for physical AI. The role offers strong compensation, early-stage equity, and the chance to help build something genuinely impactful from the ground up.

For ML Engineers who thrive on seeing their models come to life in the real world and have owned outcomes from concept to deployment, this is a unique opportunity to do it again - on a bigger stage, at the forefront of physical AI.

Interested?

I’m currently representing the team and would be happy to share more details confidentially. Please reach out to arrange a conversation.

Title: Entry Level Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job_Summary:

Woven by Toyota is enabling Toyota’s transformation into a mobility company, focusing on human-centric innovation. They are seeking a skilled Machine Learning Engineer to design and implement innovative machine learning models for autonomous driving, influencing millions of Toyota production vehicles.




Responsibilities:

• Support the design and the development of advanced machine learning models in the behavior space specifically tailored for autonomous vehicles utilizing deep learning and large-scale data analysis.

• Drive projects through the execution phase, requiring minimal guidance by a senior engineer.

• Deploy scalable and efficient ML models on our autonomous vehicle platform.

• Integrate modern technologies with rigorous safety standards while maintaining cost efficiency.

• Significantly help developing needed components for end-to-end ML training and deployment, from data strategy to optimization and validation.

• Write high-quality code while being rigorous with Machine Learning experimentation.

• Work in a high-velocity environment and employ agile development practices.

• Collaborate closely with teams such as Perception, Simulation, Infrastructure, Data and Tooling to drive unified solutions.




Qualifications:




-Required:

• B.S, M.S in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Robotics or related quantitative fields, or equivalent industry experience.

• 2+ years of strong experience with Python, any major deep learning framework, and software engineering best practices

• Comfortable in writing C++ code to help integrate with our autonomous vehicle platform.

• 2+ years of experience with deep learning approaches such as supervised/unsupervised learning, transfer learning, multi-task learning, and/or deep reinforcement learning.

• Solid experience with learning-based planning approaches like imitation learning, reinforcement learning and state-of-the-art techniques for sequential modeling like Transformer architectures

• 2+ years of experience covering machine learning workflows, data sampling and curation, pre-processing, model training, ablation studies, evaluation, deployment, and inference optimization.

• Passionate about self driving car technology and its potential for humanity.

• Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate concepts clearly and precisely.




-Preferred:

• Hands-on experience with autonomous driving systems

• Experience with model deployment with NVIDIA stack (e.g. ONNX graphs, TensorRT, profiling)

• Familiarity with recent breakthroughs in ML (e.g. foundation models, pre-training and efficient fine-tuning, multimodal Transformer architectures)

• Knowledge of autonomous driving large scale data curation pipelines




Company:

Woven by Toyota improve the vehicle intelligence software and operation and accelerate the Toyota Mobility Concept. Woven by Toyota has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and strategic Lead Data Scientist to join our growing team. This role will drive the development of data science solutions that solve critical business problems, unlock insights, and shape strategic decision-making. You will lead a team of data scientists and analysts, oversee end-to-end model development, and work cross-functionally with engineering, product, and business stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities:

Leadership & Strategy
Lead, mentor, and grow a high-performing data science team.
Define and implement the data science strategy in alignment with business objectives.
Drive innovation in predictive analytics, machine learning, and data-driven decision-making.
Project Execution
Own and manage the lifecycle of data science projects from ideation to production.
Develop robust statistical and machine learning models for business use cases.
Ensure model performance, interpretability, scalability, and compliance.
Collaboration & Communication
Partner with product, engineering, operations, and executive teams to identify and prioritize impactful use cases.
Translate complex data science concepts into actionable business insights.
Communicate findings, methodology, and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels.
Technical Expertise
Conduct exploratory data analysis and feature engineering.
Evaluate data sources and ensure data quality and integrity.
Stay up to date with the latest trends in data science and emerging technologies.




Qualifications:

Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
6+ years of experience in data science, with at least 2 years in a leadership or team lead role.
Proven experience with machine learning, statistical modeling, and data mining techniques.
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and common data science libraries (e.g., pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop), and model deployment tools.
Excellent communication and leadership skills.
Experience working in cross-functional environments, preferably in fast-paced or startup settings.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in [industry, e.g., healthcare, fintech, e-commerce].
Familiarity with data governance, model monitoring, and MLOps practices.
Demonstrated success in delivering business impact through data-driven initiatives.

Title: Machine Learning and Algorithm Developer (New Grad)
Description:
Belvedere Trading is a financial services company specializing in equity index and commodity derivative services. They are seeking a Machine Learning and Algorithm Developer to integrate and validate data, create visualization tools, and propose machine learning models to enhance trading operations.




Responsibilities

Integrate data from multiple sources and validate data quality on BigQuery to ensure stable analytical capabilities.
Create and maintain visualization tools using SQL, jupyter notebooks, and Grafana dashboards to draw insights to inform trading decisions.
Propose and train machine learning models catered to market making operations using python and jupyter notebooks, obtain data from curated data sets with SQL and integrate models into real-time algorithms to build scalable and intelligent trading system.
Work closely with Software Engineers, Quantitative Analysts and Researchers to understand trading concepts, generate ideas to solve complex problems and implement solutions that will be used to drive future decision making.
Work closely with senior industry leaders as part of a small and focused team based in the Boulder office.




Qualification




Required

Master’s degree in Computer Science
1-month internship or other occupation utilizing machine learning frameworks and requiring use of Python

Title: AI Engineer, Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

FinThrive is advancing the healthcare economy. The role involves building a Data Science & Machine Learning platform to provide insights into healthcare business operations while collaborating with various teams to deliver AI-based solutions.




Responsibilities:

• Be a key member of a growing team (data scientists, data engineers, DevOps engineers) that designs and implements artificial intelligence solutions in a production environment, leveraging a variety of AI tools and machine learning algorithms

• Design, build, maintain and deploy the infrastructure for AI-based solutions

• Integrate solutions with existing systems and application. Responsible for MLOps and DevOps to ensure scalability, reliability, and security of these systems

• Implement automation tools and processes for NLP, GenAI, model training, testing, and deployment

• Build tools and capabilities for model management and model performance monitoring

• Collaborate effectively with the team and across cross-functional stakeholders

• Model a high-performance culture with critical thinking, problem-solving, learning, collaboration, and experimentation within the team




Qualifications:




-Required:

• Bachelor's degree completed in Computer Science or a related field

• 1-3 years of experience with AI, software engineering, MLOps, DevOps, or data engineering, in a professional role

• Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and project management tools such as Jira.




-Preferred:

• Experience with Azure DevOps, CI/CD, Terraform, Python and other scripting languages

• Experience with integrating DevSecOps practices and principles throughout the project life cycle

• Experience with Big Data technologies, cloud-based analytics, non-relational datastores, data visualization tools, and open-source tools for data processing

• Experience with Databricks and Azure cloud platform, machine learning services, and best practices

• Experience in open-source AI/ML tools, frameworks technologies (for example, TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Apache MXnet, Spark MLlib, etc.)

• Experience with predictive analytics in Healthcare, Insurance or Consumer Credit industry




Company:

FinThrive is a revenue management company that provides medical billing and coding services. FinThrive has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Analytics Engineer (Entry Level) (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

iHeartMedia is a leading mass media company in America, known for its extensive reach in audio advertising and marketing. The Analytics Engineer role involves deriving insights from large data sets, collaborating with team members to solve complex problems, and improving reporting solutions to drive organizational impact.




Responsibilities:

• Derive impactful insights from data to drive intelligence for Unified and its clients

• Work with your fellow team members to define and scope solutions to solve complex problems

• Help build, improve, and test robust reporting and statistics solutions that will drive impact throughout the organization




Qualifications:




-Required:

• 1-3+ years advanced programming skills in Python

• Proficiency in SQL and knowledge of RDBMs like Postgres and Redshift

• Experience with ETL processing and data wrangling including fetching, munging, cleaning, pivoting, analyzing, aggregating, distributing, and visualizing

• Basic knowledge of statistics, algorithms, data structures, and machine learning




-Preferred:

• Experience with digital advertising technology

• Experience with AWS

• Experience with Spark and the big data ecosystem

• Experience using Git and the Unix command-line

• Familiarity with Airflow and Docker

• Familiarity calling RESTful web services, specifically social APIs (Facebook, X, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc.)

• Familiarity with BI tools (Tableau, Sisense)

• Bachelor’s or higher in a quantitative field




Company:

iHeartMedia is a mass media company that provides a range of multiplatform advertising and marketing opportunities.
