Title: Early Career Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
EvenUp is one of the fastest-growing generative AI startups in history, on a mission to level the playing field for personal injury victims. The role involves developing and deploying models for Piai™, focusing on machine learning, natural language processing, and generative AI, while collaborating with a diverse team to improve justice outcomes for clients.




Responsibilities

Model research & prototyping – Explore, implement, and benchmark ML/NLP/generative-AI methods (e.g., LLM fine-tuning, retrieval-augmented generation, document understanding).
Data preparation & feature engineering – Clean, annotate, and transform structured and unstructured case data; build reusable datasets and data loaders.
Experimentation workflow – Design experiments, run A/B tests, analyze results, and communicate findings to the wider product and engineering teams.
Productionization – Help integrate models into our microservices architecture; collaborate with MLOps engineers on packaging, testing, monitoring, and scaling.
Cross-functional collaboration – Pair with product managers, legal analysts, and software engineers to translate pain points into ML solutions and measurable product improvements.
Continuous learning – Stay current with research in LLMs, representation learning, and prompt engineering; share insights through internal talks and docs.




Qualification




Required

Ph.D. or M.S. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Statistics, Computational Linguistics, or a closely related field
Solid grounding in machine-learning fundamentals (supervised & unsupervised learning, evaluation metrics, overfitting/regularization)
Hands-on experience with NLP or generative-AI techniques (e.g., transformers, embeddings, sequence-to-sequence models, LLMs)
Proficiency in Python and ML/NLP libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face, spaCy, or similar
Familiarity with SQL and basic data-engineering concepts (ETL, versioned datasets, notebooks)
Eagerness to learn from senior teammates and iterate quickly in a fast-moving startup
Clear, concise communication—both written and verbal
Strong analytical thinking and a bias toward shipping pragmatic, high-impact solutions




Preferred

exposure to cloud platforms (AWS/GCP)
experiment-tracking tools (Weights & Biases, MLflow)
containerized deployment (Docker/Kubernetes)

Title: Entry Level Engineer
Description:
Description

Since 1995, Nova Consulting provides professional Civil / Environmental engineering services through every stage of public infrastructure improvement including planning, design, and construction phase, as well as Program / Construction Management (PM/CM) services. Nova proudly serves federal, state, and local government agencies on award-winning, multi-million-dollar infrastructure projects for water/wastewater, environmental, resilience / SLR, airports, seaports, transit, roadway, and non-motorized transport.

Nova’s team of skilled engineers, scientists, geologists, construction managers / inspectors focus on innovative solutions with a client-centric approach to promote sustainable infrastructure for the betterment of our communities, our environment and our world.

We are seeking a highly motivated Entry Level Engineer to assist in various public infrastructure improvement projects. This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to grow their technical skills in a dynamic and supportive environment.

Responsibilities Include.


Supporting projects relating to planning, design, and construction of engineering infrastructure for public agencies
Utilize basic scientific principles, theories, practices, and existing technologies to develop solutions for technical problems with limited scope
Prepare basic data, technical work plans, reports, and scientific documents
Conduct field visits to project sites to investigate, record, and photograph local conditions
Interprets and records data, conducts analysis, and compares findings to relevant studies and local, state, and federal regulations to ensure compliance
Apply knowledge of natural sciences (chemistry, physics, biology, hydrology, and mathematics) to engineering problems
Leveraging CAD and GIS software and other specialized software packages to develop planning and design documents
Preparing basic studies, construction documents, drawings, maps, reports, and supporting documentation and calculations
Coordinate with technicians to ensure timely and accurate document or drawing preparation
Coordination with task and project managers; working with on-site subcontractors and field staff; and supporting sampling, data collection, and field documentation
Assist with document preparation for regulatory agencies to obtain required permits
Review analytical data for general indicators of quality based on well-defined guidelines
Provide technical expertise support


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in civil or mechanical engineering
1-3 years experience in civil engineering or related field
Knowledge of engineering and construction principles.
Previous exposure to GIS, AutoCAD, and Civil3D is preferred
Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite
Well-organized, detail-oriented, with the ability to multi-task and prioritize work
Candidate will have good communication skills, both written, oral, and listening, and good interpersonal skills as well as the ability to work and interface well in a collaborative project team environment
Review, evaluate, and verify accuracy, and viability of designs, data, reports, and other documents before submitting them to the next review level.
Ability to adhere to the company’s standards and procedures as well as project budgets and schedules.
Candidate will interact positively and effectively with people at all levels of organizations


Company Benefits


Medical Insurance (health, dental, and vision)
Health Savings account
Flexible Spending Account
Company paid basic life insurance, AD&D, STD & LTD
Employee Assistance Program
401(k)
Wellness program
Tuition Assistance
Adoption Reimbursement

HTML:
Description

Since 1995, Nova Consulting provides professional Civil / Environmental engineering services through every stage of public infrastructure improvement including planning, design, and construction phase, as well as Program / Construction Management (PM/CM) services. Nova proudly serves federal, state, and local government agencies on award-winning, multi-million-dollar infrastructure projects for water/wastewater, environmental, resilience / SLR, airports, seaports, transit, roadway, and non-motorized transport.

Nova’s team of skilled engineers, scientists, geologists, construction managers / inspectors focus on innovative solutions with a client-centric approach to promote sustainable infrastructure for the betterment of our communities, our environment and our world.

We are seeking a highly motivated Entry Level Engineer to assist in various public infrastructure improvement projects. This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to grow their technical skills in a dynamic and supportive environment.

Responsibilities Include.

  • Supporting projects relating to planning, design, and construction of engineering infrastructure for public agencies
  • Utilize basic scientific principles, theories, practices, and existing technologies to develop solutions for technical problems with limited scope
  • Prepare basic data, technical work plans, reports, and scientific documents
  • Conduct field visits to project sites to investigate, record, and photograph local conditions
  • Interprets and records data, conducts analysis, and compares findings to relevant studies and local, state, and federal regulations to ensure compliance
  • Apply knowledge of natural sciences (chemistry, physics, biology, hydrology, and mathematics) to engineering problems
  • Leveraging CAD and GIS software and other specialized software packages to develop planning and design documents
  • Preparing basic studies, construction documents, drawings, maps, reports, and supporting documentation and calculations
  • Coordinate with technicians to ensure timely and accurate document or drawing preparation
  • Coordination with task and project managers; working with on-site subcontractors and field staff; and supporting sampling, data collection, and field documentation
  • Assist with document preparation for regulatory agencies to obtain required permits
  • Review analytical data for general indicators of quality based on well-defined guidelines
  • Provide technical expertise support

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in civil or mechanical engineering
  • 1-3 years experience in civil engineering or related field
  • Knowledge of engineering and construction principles.
  • Previous exposure to GIS, AutoCAD, and Civil3D is preferred
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite
  • Well-organized, detail-oriented, with the ability to multi-task and prioritize work
  • Candidate will have good communication skills, both written, oral, and listening, and good interpersonal skills as well as the ability to work and interface well in a collaborative project team environment
  • Review, evaluate, and verify accuracy, and viability of designs, data, reports, and other documents before submitting them to the next review level.
  • Ability to adhere to the company’s standards and procedures as well as project budgets and schedules.
  • Candidate will interact positively and effectively with people at all levels of organizations

Company Benefits

  • Medical Insurance (health, dental, and vision)
  • Health Savings account
  • Flexible Spending Account
  • Company paid basic life insurance, AD&D, STD & LTD
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • 401(k)
  • Wellness program
  • Tuition Assistance
  • Adoption Reimbursement

Title: U.S. Associate - 2026
Description:
Location

Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Houston, Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco

Job Description

U.S. ASSOCIATE

Company Description

 

L.E.K. Consulting is one of the premier strategy consulting firms worldwide. At L.E.K., we are passionate about helping our clients succeed with breakthrough insights that drive real impact. Our clients view us as trusted partners that help address their most pressing challenges and biggest opportunities. 

We bring together the rigor of data-driven analysis with the creativity and curiosity of a collaborative team. By hiring exceptional people and fostering a culture of ownership, inclusion, and continuous learning, we develop leaders who thrive on challenge and bring energy, optimism, and drive to every engagement. Founded in 1983, L.E.K. employs more than 2,200 professionals across five continents, and is consistently recognized as one of the industry’s best firms to work for. For more information, visit .

Job Description

If you are a bright, motivated undergraduate looking to tackle some of the toughest and most interesting business problems, consider joining L.E.K. as an Associate. This position will start in August or October 2026.

 

Associates are at the heart of our client work. You’ll quickly take on meaningful responsibility and play a crucial role on each case team. From day one, you will lead research efforts, analyze data, generate insights, and help shape recommendations that make a real impact. We look for candidates who are curious, proactive problem-solvers and excited to collaborate in a fast-paced environment. A growth mindset, positive outlook and a drive to learn and lead are key to success in this role.

 

While casework varies every day, Associates’ primary responsibilities typically include:

 


Conducting primary and secondary research on clients’ markets, customers, and competitors


 


Performing rigorous analysis to drive insights and actionable recommendations


 


Collaborating with team members to communicate key findings to the client in written presentations and verbal interactions that deliver maximum impact


L.E.K. offers associates the broadest range of fast-paced, high-impact, and diverse cases for maximum learning. We are also committed to investing in your training and development and fostering excellent analytical and leadership skills to prepare you for your progression in tenure, as well as for potential future opportunities in top graduate schools or roles in industry, non-profits, start-ups, or investment firms.

 

In addition to very competitive compensation and benefits, we promote Associates to Consultant and beyond, based on demonstrated performance.

 

 

 

WHY L.E.K.?

 

The Associate role at L.E.K. is differentiated from other firms in several key ways:

 


Immediate workstream responsibility: L.E.K. Associates are expected to be integral members of the team from day 1, immediately driving mission-critical work to help solve critical challenges for our clients.


 


Breadth of experiences: While our projects span most industries and services, our focus is strategy and M&A. Associates typically work on ~6-10 projects a year, providing greater exposure across clients and strategic issues, as well as faster development of business acumen.


 


Fun, collaborative, stimulating work environment: L.E.K. teams spend substantially more time in their home office relative to teams at peer firms, and we pride ourselves on a vibrant social culture, including case team events, office parties, non-profit involvement, and much more.
International exposure: Approximately 65% of Associates gain international exposure within their first 3 years, either through projects staffed across global offices, travel to international client locations, or, if they choose, by relocating to an international office on either a temporary or a full-time basis. .


 


Upward mobility: L.E.K. is a meritocracy with an entrepreneurial culture and frequent feedback. We rapidly progress responsibility to accelerate our team’s development.


Qualifications And Experience Needed


A bachelor’s degree from a renowned school with outstanding academic achievement
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated leadership, initiative and ability to thrive in a team-oriented environment
Enthusiasm, resilience, and a desire to continuously learn and grow


Note: Sector specialization is assessed during the interview process and determined at the time of hire for candidates who both meet the qualifications and express a strong interest in dedicating to a specific sector. If you are particularly interested in Organization & Performance (O&P), Life Sciences (LS), or Financial Services (FS), please clearly indicate this in your cover letter.

L.E.K. Consulting offers a competitive salary and benefits package commensurate with experience. The base salary is $95,000 (USD); L.E.K. also offers a performance bonus, profit sharing, and other benefits.

Applicants for this position must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis without the need for employer sponsorship. Unfortunately, we are unable to consider candidates requiring sponsorship for visas, including but not limited to TN, H1-B, F-1, STEM OPT/CPT, or any other work authorization.

L.E.K Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Senior AI Engineer, R&D
Description:
Own the frontier. Re‑architect how humanity powers itself.

🚀 About Everstar is a venture‑backed deep‑tech startup building the first AI‑native platform to unlock commercially viable nuclear technologies and democratize a multi‑trillion‑dollar energy sector. Together we’re fusing frontier artificial intelligence with atomic engineering to bend the cost, safety, and speed curves of clean power.

The Mission

We need a Senior AI Engineer who already lives at the bleeding edge and has scar‑tissue from shipping enterprise‑scale AI into production.

You will own the R&D roadmap and lead a small, elite engineering pod to push the boundaries of:


Foundation‑model development (physics‑informed LLMs & diffusion models)
Novel algorithm design for data‑scarce, safety‑critical domains
Autonomous control agents for safety verification, manufacturing robotics, reactor operations


You will report directly to our CEO, Kevin Kong, and have the mandate—and the resources—to set Everstar’s technical direction during a once‑in‑a‑generation market inflection.

Core Requirements


10+ years total engineering experience, 5+ years architecting or leading production AI/ML systems at Fortune‑500 or hyperscale‑startup level.
Proven enterprise impact: you’ve shipped at least one mission‑critical AI product (e.g., billion‑parameter model servicing millions of daily requests, or revenue‑integral decision engine).
Deep mastery of PyTorch (or JAX/Flax), CUDA, distributed training (DDP/FSDP) and heterogeneous hardware scaling (H100s, ASICs).
Demonstrated tech‑lead/EM chops: you’ve hired, mentored, and driven roadmap execution for ≥3 engineers.
Systems thinker—able to redesign kernels or data pipelines for 10× throughput & 99.99 % uptime.
U.S. citizenship (required) and full‑time on‑site presence in NYC (no remote/relocation assistance provided).
Passion for nuclear, energy, or other safety‑critical verticals; you master domain constraints quickly.
Exceptional communicator—can brief C‑suite, investors, regulators, and junior ICs with equal clarity.


Bonus Points


Lead author on ≥2 NeurIPS/ICML/ICLR papers or prior stint at a frontier AI lab.
Track record of open‑sourcing production‑ready AI/ML infra (Triton kernels, inference compilers, Ray Serve, etc.).
Experience coupling AI/ML with finite‑element, Monte‑Carlo, or multi‑physics simulators.
Familiarity with DOE/NRC compliance or other safety‑critical software certification.


Compensation & Perks


$170K-230K base salary + competitive equity (with potential refreshers post‑Series A).
Full medical, dental, vision, pre‑tax commuter benefits.
Annual conference budget (NeurIPS, ICML, APS, ANS) + generous R&D stipend.
Empowered, mission‑driven culture where excellence is the floor, not the ceiling.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Apsida Life Science have partnered with a leading global Clinical Research Company to present the following role




Job Title: Data Scientist Associate

Location: EU – remote based (100% full time)

Duration: 8 months




Company Overview:




Apsida Life Science is currently partnering with a leading global clinical research organization (CRO) that provides comprehensive drug development and regulatory consulting services to the biopharmaceutical industry. With a strong focus on clinical trials, regulatory affairs, and real-world evidence, this company supports pharmaceutical and biotech companies in bringing innovative therapies to market efficiently and in compliance with international standards.




Responsibilities:

Managing overall data structure within the Data Dictionary system and supporting the project lead with the addition, modification and potential removal of objects, fields, picklists and attributes.
Managing definitions/metadata:
Supporting the definition of new metadata elements required in the Data Dictionary by collaborating with the data/process owners to obtain input.
Manage system activity within the Data Dictionary to ensure updates are progressed appropriately.
Strong Regulatory Business understanding: Knowledge of Regulatory CMC, Labelling and Reg Operations data domains
Ensure ongoing system compliance
Communication, training and documentation:
As required, define modifications made to the data dictionary in appropriate documentation.
Communicate with key stakeholders of key updates, risks, and decisions as appropriate.
Train data dictionary users on process and best practice as deemed necessary by the project lead.
Data quality checks: Execute data quality checks as defined by the maintenance process and ensure appropriate remediation/follow-up activity is performed.
Review the data types of fields to ensure they remain appropriate and up to date with the RIM system configuration.
Support the production of a data quality improvement report to close sub-workstream including assumptions, strategies addressed, decisions etc.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science; Computer Science or equivalent
Veeva Vault RIM and associated objects
Power BI
Tableau
Data management, regulatory metadata, knowledge of databases, understanding of data regulation
Data governance
The development and implementation of a data dictionary to provide data definitions, business rules, RACI, data dictionary consistency and report usage.




If you are interested in learning more, please reach out to Mufaro Mpofu at Apsida Life Science:




mufaro.mpofu@apsida.com




www.apsida.co.uK




Apsida Life Science is a specialist recruitment business based in London (UK), Redhill (UK), Boston (USA) & Pretoria (South Africa) that is dedicated to delivering the best talent to the Life Science industry. We believe there is a gap in the market for a cost effective, high quality and trusted recruitment service that puts the candidate journey at the heart of the recruitment process

Title: AI / ML Engineer
Description:
Bij Tensr vertalen we complexe data naar grensverleggende business oplossingen. Als onze nieuwe Data Consultant stap je in een dynamisch team en help je bedrijven voorop lopen in de wereld van AI. Ben jij de proactieve expert die onze klanten begeleidt in hun transitie naar een datagedreven toekomst? Dan zoeken wij jou!


Je wordt onderdeel van een dynamisch team van data-experts en helpt bedrijven pionieren in de snel veranderende wereld van AI.
Je speelt een cruciale rol in het ontwikkelen en implementeren van innovatieve dataoplossingen, van concept tot realisatie.
Je communiceert met klanten om hun noden te begrijpen en begeleidt hen in hun transitie naar een AI- en datagedreven organisatie.
Je gaat hands-on aan de slag met code, voornamelijk in Python, om robuuste dataoplossingen te ontwerpen en implementeren op het Google Cloud Platform.
Je presenteert jouw oplossingen en inzichten aan zowel een technisch als niet-technisch publiek en toont zo de meerwaarde van AI en data.
Je werkt samen met je team om schaalbare oplossingen te ontwerpen en uit te rollen op GCP.
Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een rol als data expert, bijvoorbeeld als data scientist, data engineer of ML engineer.
Je bent bedreven in Python.
Je hebt een sterke kennis van (of bent bereid te leren over) het Google Cloud Platform, specifiek Vertex AI en BigQuery.
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatie- en presentatievaardigheden.
Je bent vloeiend in het Engels en Nederlands (zowel gesproken als geschreven).
Je bent zelfstandig, proactief en voelt je thuis in een omgeving met veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid.
Ervaring met computer vision-projecten is een grote plus.


Wij zijn een jong bedrijf waar een geweldige sfeer en persoonlijke ontwikkeling centraal staan. We bieden een ondersteunende en inspirerende werkomgeving waarin je écht kan pionieren in de wereld van AI.


Een competitief salaris, aangevuld met een uitgebreid pakket aan extralegale voordelen.
Pionieren met de beste tech: De kans om te werken met de nieuwste en beste technologieën in de AI- en datawereld, met een focus op het Google Cloud Platform.
Uniek persoonlijk groeipad: Stippel mee je groeipad uit; wij bieden de begeleiding en ondersteuning om jouw doelen te bereiken.
Een bruisende cultuur: Geniet van een leuke bedrijfscultuur met regelmatige teamactiviteiten, veel vrijheid en een team van gemotiveerde collega's.


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Mid/Senior Data Scientist




Location: Remote

Contract Type: 12-Month Contract (Extendable)

Type: Full-time, Contract




The Role

Our client is looking for a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist / ML Engineer to lead the development and deployment of advanced machine learning models.




This is a 100% remote position on a 12-month extendable contract, offering flexibility and the opportunity to work with a global team.




Key Responsibilities

Design and implement AI agent-based architectures for intelligent automation in financial services.
Develop, train, and fine-tune LLMs and other ML models for production-grade performance.
Apply advanced statistical and mathematical modeling to improve predictive accuracy and financial decision-making.
Leverage market and behavioral data to drive innovation in ML applications.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate ML solutions into the platform.
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines for structured and unstructured data.
Ensure ML systems are efficient, interpretable, and aligned with ethical and regulatory standards.




Requirements

Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
3–5 years of hands-on experience in data science or ML engineering, preferably in fintech or financial services.
Proven experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT, LLaMA) and their deployment in production environments.
Familiarity with AI agents and autonomous systems is a strong plus.
Solid foundation in statistics, optimization, and numerical methods.
Proficiency in Python and ML libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, and Scikit-Learn.
Knowledge of financial modeling and portfolio optimization is a bonus.
Excellent communication skills in English (Arabic is a plus).




Why Join Us?

Work with cutting-edge AI/ML technologies in a high-impact role.
100% remote work with flexible hours.
Competitive compensation on a contract basis.
Opportunity for contract extension and long-term collaboration.

HTML:
Mid/Senior Data Scientist


Location: Remote

Contract Type: 12-Month Contract (Extendable)

Type: Full-time, Contract


The Role

Our client is looking for a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist / ML Engineer to lead the development and deployment of advanced machine learning models.


This is a 100% remote position on a 12-month extendable contract, offering flexibility and the opportunity to work with a global team.


Key Responsibilities

  • Design and implement AI agent-based architectures for intelligent automation in financial services.
  • Develop, train, and fine-tune LLMs and other ML models for production-grade performance.
  • Apply advanced statistical and mathematical modeling to improve predictive accuracy and financial decision-making.
  • Leverage market and behavioral data to drive innovation in ML applications.
  • Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate ML solutions into the platform.
  • Build and maintain scalable data pipelines for structured and unstructured data.
  • Ensure ML systems are efficient, interpretable, and aligned with ethical and regulatory standards.


Requirements

  • Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
  • 3–5 years of hands-on experience in data science or ML engineering, preferably in fintech or financial services.
  • Proven experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT, LLaMA) and their deployment in production environments.
  • Familiarity with AI agents and autonomous systems is a strong plus.
  • Solid foundation in statistics, optimization, and numerical methods.
  • Proficiency in Python and ML libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, and Scikit-Learn.
  • Knowledge of financial modeling and portfolio optimization is a bonus.
  • Excellent communication skills in English (Arabic is a plus).


Why Join Us?

  • Work with cutting-edge AI/ML technologies in a high-impact role.
  • 100% remote work with flexible hours.
  • Competitive compensation on a contract basis.
  • Opportunity for contract extension and long-term collaboration.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ABOUT US




Konecta is a leading innovative global service provider in customer management business process and digital outsourcing, with 120,000 passionate employees working in 30 languages across 4 continents and 26 countries. Focusing on the unique needs and opportunities of each industry, Konecta offers a full range of end-to-end customer management solutions – including acquisition, retention, customer service, technical support, and collection – all based on a sustainable business model. These services are built on a portfolio of world-class expertise covering customer experience and process management, digital solutions and cutting-edge technologies. Headquartered in Madrid, Konecta delivers global revenues of €2 billion with more than 500 clients, covering some of the biggest names in telecoms, energy, banking, mobility, retail, and e-commerce.




MISSION OF THE ROLE




The Data Scientist in Advisory & Professional Services plays a key role in designing and implementing generative AI solutions that solve real business problems. Working closely with senior data scientists, consultants, and engineers, this role supports the development of prototypes, PoVs, and client-facing solutions using state-of-the-art AI models, agentic frameworks and techniques. The ideal candidate combines hands-on technical ability with curiosity and the drive to create business value through data.




RESPONSIBILITIES




Technical Delivery:

Assist in designing and building Gen AI prototypes using LLMs, embeddings, RAG pipelines, and fine-tuning techniques.
Develop and test agentic workflows using frameworks like LangChain Agents, CrewAI, AutoGen, or Databricks Mosaic AI
Support feature engineering, evaluation, and testing of models in collaboration with architects and engineers.
Create clean, reusable code and Jupyter notebooks that align with internal quality and documentation standards.




Client Collaboration:

Participate in client workshops, discovery sessions, and technical validation phases.
Translate client needs into tractable data science tasks and communicate results clearly.
Collaborate with squads to continuously refine agent behavior, planning strategies, and tool integrations
Support the presentation of prototypes and findings in pre-sales and advisory engagements.




Reusability & Innovation:

Contribute to internal libraries, prompt collections, evaluation frameworks, and demo environments.
Help maintain Gen AI accelerator kits and continuously refine based on project experience.




Governance & Compliance:

Apply responsible AI principles including explainability, fairness, and auditability in project work.
Ensure alignment with the AI governance framework, especially regarding EU AI Act and data protection.




REQUIREMENTS

3–5 years of experience in data science or applied machine learning, preferably in a consulting or client-facing environment.
Hands-on experience with LLM APIs, embeddings, vector databases, and prompt engineering.
Skilled in Python and ML libraries such as LangChain, Hugging Face, scikit-learn, Pandas, and Jupyter.
Familiarity with MLOps concepts and tools like MLflow, DVC, or cloud-based model deployment (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Able to communicate clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Comfortable working with REST APIs, event-driven architectures, and integrating external tools into agent workflows
A team player with an appetite for learning, co-creation, and working in multidisciplinary squads.
Awareness of ethical AI, responsible AI practices, and data privacy guidelines.
Fluent English
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

About Remobi:

We are Remobi - We empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-quality technical solutions delivered by high performing, high quality, REMOTE nearshore technology teams.




Join our Remobi community to have access to meaningful, innovative freelance projects and play a key role in shaping how companies operate!







Position Overview:

Location: Fully Remote

Role Type: Freelance/B2B/Contract

Duration: End of September 2025 (Possibility of a 1-year extension)







Position Summary:

We’re hiring a results-driven Data Scientist to build and deploy high-performance ML models across NLP, computer vision, and predictive analytics. You’ll work with modern cloud and data tools (AWS SageMaker, Snowflake, Aurora) to deliver real-time solutions, collaborating with technical teams while operating with autonomy and precision. This role suits someone highly analytical, technically sharp, and fluent in English.




Responsibilities:

Design, build, and refine machine learning models for real-world applications.
Analyse large datasets to extract patterns, trends, and actionable insights.
Collaborate with engineers and analysts to deploy scalable ML solutions.
Automate ML workflows using Snowflake and AWS SageMaker.
Present findings through clear reporting and data visualizations.
Stay current with evolving machine learning tools and techniques.







Qualifications:

Strong knowledge of ML algorithms (regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.).
Hands-on experience with AWS SageMaker and Snowflake.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and associated ML/data libraries.
Skilled in data visualization (preferably with Tableau).
Fluent English communicator (clear, technical, and to the point).
Background in real-time prediction systems, ideally using Aurora (Desirable)







If you are interested in this role or do have anybody in mind for this position, feel free to apply or get in touch

Title: Data Science and AI Expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we’re looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it’s designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you’ll help clients unlock value from data.

We’re looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we’d love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM’s or optimization.
You’ve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You’re comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe’s leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Scientist - Gen AI / QA
Description:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of Zyte. We are currently looking for a Data Scientist - Gen AI / QA in Argentina, Brazil, Uruguay, Poland, Spain, Portugal, UK, Ireland, Croatia, Hungary, Slovenia.

As a Data Scientist specializing in Generative AI and QA, you'll play a key role in advancing data quality validation processes for large-scale web-extracted data. This is a highly technical, detail-oriented position where you will apply Python, AI, and data visualization techniques to detect and resolve data inconsistencies, automate quality checks, and deliver trusted results. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams in a fully remote, global environment, supporting enterprise-grade customers. If you're passionate about leveraging AI to solve data problems at scale, this is a high-impact opportunity in a fast-evolving space.

Accountabilities


Design and implement AI-powered data quality validation techniques based on customer-specific web scraping requirements
Analyze and summarize large datasets through descriptive statistics, summaries, and visualizations to uncover quality issues
Extend manual QA processes with automated, AI-driven verification tools
Communicate findings and insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including QA engineers, developers, PMs, and clients
Collaborate with the engineering team to identify root causes of data issues and propose technical solutions
Write robust, reusable code following best practices in Python and version control systems such as GitHub or BitBucket



Requirements


At least 3 years of hands-on experience with Python and the PyData stack (Pandas, NumPy, etc.)
Solid understanding of Generative AI, especially in the context of web scraping, parsing, and data quality automation
Comfortable with prompt engineering and optimization techniques (token/cost control)
Familiarity with frameworks like MCP, Marvin, Langchain, and experience with OpenAI, Google, or Anthropic APIs
Skilled in analyzing and visualizing large-scale datasets (millions of records), with strong attention to detail
Working knowledge of QA methodologies and tools for validating structured and unstructured data
BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to explain technical concepts to varied audiences



Preferred:


Prior experience in a Data QA role focused on data integrity rather than application testing
Familiarity with Jupyter/JupyterLab, Spark, BigQuery, and dashboard creation
Experience in fully remote, globally distributed teams



Benefits


Join a diverse, self-motivated team across 28+ countries
Enjoy full flexibility to work remotely from where you perform best
Collaborate on cutting-edge data technologies and open-source tools
Attend global conferences and regular team events
Thrive in a culture that values ownership, innovation, and continuous learning



Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly.

🔍 Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience, and achievements.

📊 It compares your profile to the job's core requirements and past success factors to determine your match score.

🎯 Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the 3 candidates with the highest match to the role.

🧠 When necessary, our human team may perform an additional manual review to ensure no strong profile is missed.

The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias — focusing solely on your fit for the role.

Once the shortlist is completed, we share it directly with the company that owns the job opening. The final decision and next steps (such as interviews or additional assessments) are then made by their internal hiring team.

Thank you for your interest!


Show more

  • Thrive in a culture that values ownership, innovation, and continuous learning


Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly.

🔍 Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience, and achievements.

📊 It compares your profile to the job's core requirements and past success factors to determine your match score.

🎯 Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the 3 candidates with the highest match to the role.

🧠 When necessary, our human team may perform an additional manual review to ensure no strong profile is missed.

The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias — focusing solely on your fit for the role.

Once the shortlist is completed, we share it directly with the company that owns the job opening. The final decision and next steps (such as interviews or additional assessments) are then made by their internal hiring team.

Thank you for your interest!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
📊 Data Scientist – Flexibility & Grid Analytics (Energy Sector | Brussels | Hybrid)




For one of our key clients in the energy sector, we're looking for a Data Scientist with strong analytical and Python skills to help shape the future of the electricity market.

You’ll be part of a multidisciplinary product team that supports system balancing and flexibility mechanisms (think price-based consumption, EVs, and real-time forecasting).




📌 What you’ll work on:

Analyze system imbalances and flexibility trends
Model consumer response to price signals (installed vs available vs activated flexibility)
Support internal data science initiatives to optimize electricity market mechanisms
Collaborate with business and energy market teams




🎯 What we’re looking for:

3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist
5+ years of Python (data modeling, large datasets, ML/statistics)
Energy sector experience or strong interest
Fluent in English – French or Dutch is a plus




📍 Location: Brussels (2 days/week onsite)

📅 Duration: Until end of 2025

🔧 Sector: Energy




Interested in working on data that directly has impact in the energy market?

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Junior Data Scientist



Are you passionate about data and ready to turn insights into real business impact? In this role, you'll apply your analytical skills and creativity to develop smart models that enhance decision-making, improve customer experiences, and boost operational efficiency.



What will you do?



As a Junior Data Scientist, you'll be part of a dynamic Data & Analytics team. Your responsibilities include:

Building intelligent models: From predictive algorithms to AI-powered solutions - you'll create data products that directly support business goals.

Turning data into insight: You'll gather and analyze internal and external data and transform it into actionable insights for various departments.

Innovating continuously: You're always looking for new data sources, technologies, and methodologies to push boundaries and add value.

Bridging tech and business: You explain complex models in a clear, accessible way to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and confidently defend your approach.

Managing projects: You translate business or technical questions into structured data solutions, with well-defined deliverables and measurable KPIs.



Who are we looking for?



You're curious, analytical, and ready to launch (or boost) your career in data science. You have:

A master's degree in a relevant field (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, AI, Computer Science, Psychology, Physics…)

Up to 2 years of experience in data science or artificial intelligence

A critical and solution-oriented mindset

A proactive, hands-on attitude

Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complexity



What's in it for you?



We offer you a challenging role in a forward-thinking organization that values innovation and personal growth. You'll benefit from:

A competitive salary tailored to your experience

Company car with fuel/charging card (via mobility budget)

Smartphone with subscription

Monthly net allowance and annual bonus

Meal vouchers

Comprehensive group insurance and optional hospitalization coverage

Staff discounts

Flexible hours and hybrid working options

Ongoing learning opportunities via training and coaching

Clear growth paths within a data-driven environment

Show more

AI Analist

Leuven (hybrid)

AI Analist

We’re looking for an AI analist to join our team in Leuven—someone who gets energized by turning strategic questions and business needs into actionable AI projects that deliver real value. You’re the translator between business dreams and technical reality: from first intake to delivery, you guide the client and our team towards meaningful impact with artificial intelligence.

As part of our AI strategy team, you’ll take ownership of your own projects, translating business goals into sharp analyses and use cases. Think engaging workshops where you help people discover what they really need, mapping out their biggest challenges, and collaborating with our engineers and designers to bring smart solutions to life. You don’t need to be an AI expert from day one—what matters is your curiosity and drive to learn.

In short: you’re someone who thrives on variety, loves connecting dots between business and tech, and is ready to deliver real AI solutions that drive meaningful results.

In This Role, You Will:


Work directly with clients to understand their business context and identify AI opportunities
Craft detailed analyses and roadmaps that align AI possibilities with client needs
Run ideation workshops and brainstorms with clients and internal stakeholders
Team up with our engineers and designers to nail down requirements and guide smooth execution
Be end responsible for the AI strategy in your projects — from scoping to delivery
Jump in on the sales team with business cases and proposals where needed


Is this you?


Analysis, strategy, and AI aren't just your thing — they're your playground
You’re proactive, structured, and confident when working with clients
You feel at home leading workshops and presenting your ideas clearly
You toggle effortlessly between big-picture vision and nitty-gritty execution
You have a background in business management, engineering, computer science, or similar
You’re genuinely curious about AI and eager to keep learning in this field
You’re fluent in Dutch and English


In return for your experience, enthusiasm, and motivation, we offer you:


A dynamic and entrepreneurial environment with a strong team of data scientists, full-stack developers and AI engineers
A great company culture in a start-up environment with fun team events
Various exciting AI projects for which you can make a direct impact
A workplace where initiative, humor, and curiosity are highly appreciated
An interesting salary package and everything you need to do an amazing job (Macbook Pro/Dell laptop, company car, insurances, meal compensation, mobile phone subscription, internet subscription…)
Flexible (remote) working hours
20 days of leave + 12 ADV days


‍

Join our team

Send your motivation and resume to apply@raccoons.be.

Who we are

Raccoons is defined by talented people who can grow, think, dream, build and create.

Culture eats strategy for breakfast. Sharing a proper culture is the most important thing in any organization. It can be an amazing accelerator or a blocker. We think it's extremely important to improve our culture, and we are all dedicated to working toward the same goal. It's hard to put our culture into words, but we tried. Check out our culture book and maybe, you'll get the vibe straight away.

Download culture book

Ask us anything

Got a question?

How does your hiring process work?


>


Everything starts with your application, of course! If you see an open position that seems like a match made in heaven, send us your resume. We'll review it and reach out to you to plan a introductory meeting if it seems like a match (on paper). If that first meeting goes well, we'll plan a technical test (if necessary) and an interview with some people on the team. This way, we'll know for sure if you'll fit in. If all goes well, we'll give you an offer you hopefully can't refuse.

Are you remote-friendly?


>


Yes! We value a hybrid work environment, which means you can work at home, at our offices, or in your favorite coffee shop. You decide where you want to work, but we do love it when our team comes together on our weekly "team days" (two times per week). We promise, you'll love it too.

What are your values?


>


Curiosity, entrepreneurship, collaboration, and inclusivity are the things we value most at Raccoons. We get energized when exploring new technologies, when people get behind the wheel and take action, and when the whole team works together to get the best results possible.

Is it all work at Raccoons, or also play?


>


All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy, and "being dull" is the last thing we want to be. So, of course, we make time to have fun and strengthen our team atmosphere in teambuilding and afterwork activities. Each month, we have a drink 'n sync where our team comes together for some drinks and to catch up; we regularly have diverse teambuildings; and each year, we go on an amazing teamweekend (video proof above!).

Tell us your digital needs

We’d love to hear about your challenges, dreams, vision. Let’s have a conversation and look at what’s next.

Contact us

Title: Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities

Design, implement, and optimize deep learning models (CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, etc.) to address project-specific challenges.
Work with large-scale datasets, including data cleaning, preprocessing, augmentation, and feature engineering.
Develop end-to-end pipelines from data ingestion through model training, validation, and deployment.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to integrate AI solutions.
Conduct experiments, analyze results, and iterate to improve model performance.
Ensure code quality with version control, documentation, and testing best practices.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research and tools in deep learning and AI.
Support model deployment on cloud platforms or edge devices as required.

Required Skills & Experience

Proven experience in building and deploying deep learning models for real-world applications.
Proficiency in Python and deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Strong understanding of neural network architectures (CNNs, RNNs, LSTMs, Transformers).
Experience with data preprocessing techniques and working with unstructured data (images, text, audio).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.
Solid knowledge of machine learning fundamentals and optimization techniques.
Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and communicate clearly with stakeholders.
Fluency in English; knowledge of French or Dutch is an advantage.

Preferred Qualifications

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience with MLOps tools and workflows.
Knowledge of NLP, computer vision, or reinforcement learning is a bonus.
Previous freelance or consulting experience is a plus.

What We Offer

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
afarax is looking for a freelance Data scientist. We need you!




The project:

Our client in the utilities sector is looking for a Data scientist tojoin their team.




Main tasks:

Gathering information on available flexibility through various channels (desktop research, interviews, data analysis, estimation methods) ;
Developing and conducting data analyses to determine the relationship between renewable energy forecasts, price information, market player behavior and system imbalances;
Connecting the various elements to get a total view of the installed (related to the hardware, e.g. electric cars), available (able to react on price), and the effectively activated flexibility in the system (observed modification of the injection/consumption profile following a price);
Connecting possible applications for different departments and disseminating the results internally.




Is this you?

At least 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist with min. 5 years’ experience in Python programming
A strong, analytical mind and able to master and understand complex processes.
Able to translate a question into a quantitative analysis or approach. You are strongly driven by facts and figures and you are able to support your reasoning in a clear way using quantitative results.
Sufficient knowledge and experience regarding statistical methods (e.g. machine learning) to perform analysis on large data sets ;
Understand the global workings of the energy market and preferably have several years of experience in the electricity market.
Can combine different types of tasks (from operational to conceptual) and organize yourself autonomously around different tasks. You can distinguish priorities well.
Quick learner, with a proactive and positive attitude. focus on details without losing sight of the overall picture and deliver flawless work.
Take steering action within a project, also with a view to concrete implementation.
Fluently in English orally and in writing. Preferably fluent in Dutch and/or French
Like teamwork, results-oriented and able to solve problems. A fluent communication style.




How afarax supports you?

You benefit from our extensive network
You will have access to projects that fit your expertise
We help and support you throughout your project
We offer the possibility to build a valuable and lasting partnership

Check out more projects on: https://afarax.be/jobs/type/freelance/

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Build the Future of AI




Are you ready to push the boundaries of what's possible?

Join us as a Machine Learning Engineer and dive into cutting-edge projects that transform industries. From fine-tuning generative models to creating robust MLOps pipelines, you’ll work on real-world AI systems that matter.




This isn’t just another ML role—it’s your chance to work with global leaders on impactful, boundary-pushing AI projects. Collaborate with experts, innovate in production, and make a real-world difference.




What You'll Be Doing:

Architect and deploy machine learning models into production
Develop MLOps pipelines (CI/CD, versioning, monitoring)
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to turn prototypes into scalable solutions
Optimize model performance, reliability, and latency
Stay ahead of the curve by experimenting with new ML frameworks and libraries




What You'll Bring:

Expertise in Python and ML frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow
Hands-on experience with MLOps tooling (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow)
Proven track record deploying ML models on cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Strong foundations in data structures, algorithms, and model optimization
Excellent communication skills—you can translate complex tech to business value




It Would Be Great If You Had:

Experience with Generative AI, NLP, computer vision, or reinforcement learning
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes)
Background scaling infrastructure for high-traffic, AI-powered applications




Why Join Us?




The demand for ML talent has exploded—this is your moment.

If you're ready to shape the future, apply now or tag someone who should be on our radar!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?




Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimise rebates, and drive better value.




As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.




We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimising simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.




At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.




Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such LangChain, LangGraph.
Backend development experience with frameworks like FastAPI, Django, or Flask.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with databases, API design, and microservices architecture.
Understanding of MLOps practices, model versioning, and CI/CD for ML systems.




What we offer:

Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.

Show more
HTML:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?


Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimise rebates, and drive better value.


As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.


We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimising simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.


At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.


Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.


Your main responsibilities:

  • Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
  • Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
  • Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
  • Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
  • Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.


Who you are:

  • Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
  • Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
  • Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such LangChain, LangGraph.
  • Backend development experience with frameworks like FastAPI, Django, or Flask.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Experience with databases, API design, and microservices architecture.
  • Understanding of MLOps practices, model versioning, and CI/CD for ML systems.


What we offer:

  • Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
  • Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
  • The possibility to work flexibly.
  • Become part of a team of international high performers.
  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
  • Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
Purpose

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.







Reporting Line

The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.







Responsibilities

Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR…)
Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and “lunch and learn” sessions.
Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.
Provide training sessions as trainer in our data & AI Academy.




Skills and Requirements

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlo
w).Experience with cloud technologies (Azure or AW
S).Proficiency in MLOps/DevOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and monitoring too
ls.Ability to manage AI and analytics projects with clear deliverables and KP
Is.Experience in AGILE development and cross-department collaborati
on.Excellent communication skills to present AI insights to diverse stakeholde
rs.Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and tools like Mendix for integrating AI products into customer-facing applicatio
ns.Knowledge of financial regulations affecting AI, including the EU AI Act, GDPR and other data protection laws.




Preferred attitude

Curiosity, humility and critical thinking
Problem-solving mindset and willingness to adapt to new challenges
Proactive, ethical, pragmatic and customer-focussed
Result-oriented with a strong focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for assigned tasks




Education and Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fi

eld.2–6 years of experience in AI or data science roles, preferably within the banking or financial industry.




Our Offer

A 100 % Belgian contract in Brussels.
Keytrade Bank is a young and dynamic organization with a lean structure, that evolves in an Agile ecosystem. The tempo and the atmosphere are upbeat and no day goes by without an element of fun!
The company works in an agile setup with a lot of flexibility regarding remote work. This means that you will be guaranteed at least 50% homework with a high degree of flexibility.
Offices are in Watermael-Boitsfort in a peaceful, green surrounding.
A competitive salary with extra-legal advantages such as meal vouchers, group insurance, health insurance and many other.
Continued education and access to trainings.
Stepping stone for a continued career within Keytrade Bank.
Open, inclusive culture and dynamic working environment.
Show more

Title: Manager Data Scientist
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities


A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.




#technology

Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Knowledge of dutch is a big plus


We offer

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions
Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…
Show more
