Title: Junior Full Stack Engineer
HTML:
Runtime Revolution is a product development team. We build web and mobile applications and have been around since 2006. Today, we work with clients from all over the world. Based in Lisbon, we put great care and solid engineering into everything we do.


We believe successful products are built by small, focused teams — not through big hierarchies. Our structure is pretty flat, and we believe everyone has the ability to make an impact.


We’re now looking for Junior Full Stack Developers who are eager to learn and grow in a hands-on environment. If you’re just starting out — recently graduated or with up to one year of experience — this is the perfect place to kickstart your career.


We work with technologies like Ruby on Rails, Python, and Node.js on the backend, and React on the frontend.


You don’t need to have experience with these — we’ll teach you. What matters is that you have solid fundamentals, curiosity, and a drive to grow as a developer.


What we’re looking for:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Engineering or similar;
  • Up to 1 year of professional experience;
  • Strong motivation to learn new technologies and practices;
  • Interest in working on a highly technical team;
  • Fluency in both English and Portuguese;
  • Currently living in Portugal;
  • Availability to work on-site at our Lisbon office (Alvalade).


What we offer:

  • Competitive compensation for a junior profile;
  • Annual conference/training budget;
  • Work on real products with international clients;
  • A great office in Alvalade, Lisbon (no dress code, great music and coffee included);
  • A strong learning culture and collaborative environment;
  • A focus on doing great work in 8 hours a day — no need for overtime;
  • We're not outsourcing.


If it seems good to you, send us your application so we can meet and talk about our common goals!

Title: Junior Cloud Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Junior AWS Engineer (**Immediate Hiring**)

Location: [Anywhere in USA]

Experience: 1–3 years

Employment Type: Full-Time




**NO SPONSPORSHIP**




Are you excited about taking your technical career to new heights with a full-time, W-2 role as a consultant in a dynamic and rapidly growing company? If you are, let's get in touch – your interest is the first step to starting the conversation.




Core Skills and Requirements

1. Basic Linux Knowledge

Comfortable working in a Linux terminal (CLI) environment.
Able to perform basic file operations (create, copy, move, delete files/folders).
Understand and manage file and directory permissions, ownership, and basic user management.
Use of common Linux utilities like grep, top, df, ps, and chmod.




2. Basic Networking Fundamentals

Understanding of IP addressing, subnetting, and what private/public IPs mean.
Knowledge of DNS (Domain Name System) and how name resolution works.
Familiarity with HTTP/HTTPS protocols, what ports are, and what firewalls do at a high level.




3. Scripting Basics

Ability to read and write basic shell scripts (Bash) to automate repetitive tasks.
Some hands-on experience or learning in Python for simple scripting or tool use.




4. Git Version Control

Comfortable using Git for source code management.
Understand how to clone repositories, commit changes, push and pull code, and create branches.
Familiar with GitHub




5. CI/CD Concepts

Basic understanding of what Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) are.
Awareness of tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or Azure DevOps, even if not deeply experienced.
Understand how code goes from development to production in an automated way.




6. Container Awareness

Have heard of Docker and understand the basic purpose of containers (e.g., "run applications in isolated environments").
Understand the difference between containers and virtual machines at a high level.
Basic idea of what Docker images and containers are.




7. Cloud Computing Fundamentals

Awareness of cloud platforms like AWS and Azure
Understand concepts like virtual machines, storage, and networking in the cloud.
Know why organizations use the cloud (scalability, flexibility, cost-efficiency).




Nice to Have (Bonus Skills)

These are not mandatory, but having some exposure will be a plus:

Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Basic idea of tools like Terraform – used to define cloud infrastructure using code.
Monitoring and Logging: Awareness of tools like Prometheus (for monitoring) and Grafana (for dashboards).
Basic YAML knowledge: Since tools like Kubernetes and GitHub Actions use YAML, familiarity helps.




Soft Skills

Willingness to learn new tools and concepts.
Good problem-solving attitude.
Ability to follow documentation and troubleshoot issues.
Comfortable working in a team and asking questions when stuck.

Show more
HTML:
Job Title: Junior AWS Engineer (**Immediate Hiring**)

Location: [Anywhere in USA]

Experience: 1–3 years

Employment Type: Full-Time


**NO SPONSPORSHIP**


Are you excited about taking your technical career to new heights with a full-time, W-2 role as a consultant in a dynamic and rapidly growing company? If you are, let's get in touch – your interest is the first step to starting the conversation.


Core Skills and Requirements

1. Basic Linux Knowledge

  • Comfortable working in a Linux terminal (CLI) environment.
  • Able to perform basic file operations (create, copy, move, delete files/folders).
  • Understand and manage file and directory permissions, ownership, and basic user management.
  • Use of common Linux utilities like grep, top, df, ps, and chmod.


2. Basic Networking Fundamentals

  • Understanding of IP addressing, subnetting, and what private/public IPs mean.
  • Knowledge of DNS (Domain Name System) and how name resolution works.
  • Familiarity with HTTP/HTTPS protocols, what ports are, and what firewalls do at a high level.


3. Scripting Basics

  • Ability to read and write basic shell scripts (Bash) to automate repetitive tasks.
  • Some hands-on experience or learning in Python for simple scripting or tool use.


4. Git Version Control

  • Comfortable using Git for source code management.
  • Understand how to clone repositories, commit changes, push and pull code, and create branches.
  • Familiar with GitHub


5. CI/CD Concepts

  • Basic understanding of what Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) are.
  • Awareness of tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or Azure DevOps, even if not deeply experienced.
  • Understand how code goes from development to production in an automated way.


6. Container Awareness

  • Have heard of Docker and understand the basic purpose of containers (e.g., "run applications in isolated environments").
  • Understand the difference between containers and virtual machines at a high level.
  • Basic idea of what Docker images and containers are.


7. Cloud Computing Fundamentals

  • Awareness of cloud platforms like AWS and Azure
  • Understand concepts like virtual machines, storage, and networking in the cloud.
  • Know why organizations use the cloud (scalability, flexibility, cost-efficiency).


Nice to Have (Bonus Skills)

These are not mandatory, but having some exposure will be a plus:

  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Basic idea of tools like Terraform – used to define cloud infrastructure using code.
  • Monitoring and Logging: Awareness of tools like Prometheus (for monitoring) and Grafana (for dashboards).
  • Basic YAML knowledge: Since tools like Kubernetes and GitHub Actions use YAML, familiarity helps.


Soft Skills

  • Willingness to learn new tools and concepts.
  • Good problem-solving attitude.
  • Ability to follow documentation and troubleshoot issues.
  • Comfortable working in a team and asking questions when stuck.

Title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer - Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

Helic & Co. is seeking a detail-oriented Software Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer to ensure the quality and reliability of software applications through rigorous testing and validation. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of QA methodologies and will be responsible for designing test plans, executing tests, and collaborating with teams to enhance software quality.




Responsibilities:

• Design, develop, and execute test plans and test cases based on product requirements.

• Perform functional, regression, integration, and performance testing on web, mobile, or desktop applications.

• Identify, record, and thoroughly document bugs and issues.

• Collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements and resolve defects.

• Develop and maintain automated test scripts using tools like Selenium, Cypress, or similar.

• Participate in Agile development processes, including sprint planning and retrospectives.

• Contribute to continuous improvement of QA practices and tools.




Qualifications:




-Required:

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

• Understanding of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes.

• Experience with manual testing and familiarity with test case management tools (e.g., TestRail, Zephyr).

• Working knowledge of at least one programming/scripting language (e.g., Python, JavaScript, Java) for test automation.

• Familiarity with bug tracking systems (e.g., JIRA, Bugzilla).

• Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

• Good communication and collaboration abilities.




-Preferred:

• Experience with automated testing frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, Playwright).

• Familiarity with CI/CD tools and workflows (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions).

• Exposure to performance testing tools (e.g., JMeter, LoadRunner).

• Knowledge of API testing tools like Postman or SoapUI.

• Experience in Agile or DevOps environments.




Company:

Our reputation professionals and legal team have removed thousands of harmful reviews costing businesses tens of thousands of dollars every month.

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Are you passionate about AI and eager to drive innovation in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment? Do you have experience developing AI-powered applications and enjoy mentoring others? If so, we invite you to join Nexthink as an AI & ML Engineer!

As a key member of our AI team, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance digital employee experiences for millions worldwide.

Responsibilities


Lead AI Development – Design and implement AI-powered products, with a strong focus on Agentic systems.
LLMs done right – Create evaluations and define metrics of success using cutting edge AI platforms.
MLOps - Implement and manage MLOps practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of models and in production environments.
Collaboration & Leadership – Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to align AI capabilities with business needs.
Mentorship & Coaching – Guide and support junior AI engineers, fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing


Qualifications


BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Hands-on experience in LLM-powered production applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, PyTorch).
Proven experience with AWS and cloud-based AI deployments.
Solid understanding of AI model fine-tuning, optimization, and evaluation.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and multi-agent AI architectures.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs
Familiarity with MLOps best practices for deploying and monitoring AI models in production.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Eagerness to learn and adapt
Strong communication skills in English, capable of explaining complex AI concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing.


If you’re excited about pushing the boundaries of AI and mentoring the next generation of engineers, we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).
📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station
🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.
🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.
🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.
🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.
🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About the Role




Cleeven is seeking a talented and driven Data Scientist to join our Swiss consulting team. In this role, you will support our clients across various industries—such as finance, healthcare, energy, and manufacturing—by transforming data into actionable insights that drive innovation and efficiency.




As a Data Scientist, you will work closely with business stakeholders and technical teams to identify problems, develop data-driven solutions, and deploy predictive and prescriptive models in real-world environments. You will be exposed to a wide range of challenges, from customer analytics and process optimization to forecasting, anomaly detection, and NLP.







Responsibilities




Understand client challenges and translate them into data science use cases and solutions.
Explore, clean, and analyze large and complex data sets using statistical and machine learning techniques.
Build, test, and deploy predictive models and data products using modern data science tools and frameworks.
Communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical audiences through visualizations, dashboards, and reports.
Collaborate with data engineers and domain experts to ensure models are scalable, maintainable, and integrated into production environments.
Stay up to date with emerging technologies and methodologies in the field of AI and data science.
Document methodologies, experiments, and code to ensure transparency and reproducibility.







Required Qualifications




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python or R, and strong experience with libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
Solid knowledge of statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization.
Experience working with SQL and data stored in relational databases or data lakes.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git).
Fluent in German and English (C1 level or higher).
Willingness to travel and work on-site at client locations throughout Switzerland.







Key Competencies




Strong problem-solving skills with a curious and analytical mindset.
Ability to communicate technical concepts in a clear and engaging way.
Experience working in cross-functional teams with business and technical stakeholders.
Focused on value creation and real-world impact.
Organized, detail-oriented, and proactive.

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We are seeking a Junior AI Engineer with foundational knowledge in AI, GenAI, and Machine Learning. You will join one of our AI teams and assist them in prototyping, maturing, and shipping AI features to a production-ready level.

You are a pragmatic, results-driven engineer who is eager to learn and understands modern AI stacks but thinks in terms of software reliability, performance, and user impact. You focus on creating scalable, observable solutions that solve real-world problems for our customers.

Because the role is cross-functional, the ability to communicate complex concepts in simple ways is essential. You will collaborate with product, design, front-end, and infrastructure teams to bring delightful AI features to life.

Responsibilities

As part of the AI team at Nexthink, you will:


Assist in implementing new AI features with high-quality coding standards and automated test coverage.
Support solving the engineering challenges behind data collection, retrieval, evaluation, and inference at scale.
Help build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI components, ensuring safe, repeatable deployments.
Instrument robust online/offline evaluation metrics and dashboards to monitor quality in production.
Proactively propose new product capabilities or improvements based on user data and technology advances.
Stay current with the rapidly evolving AI engineering ecosystem and share knowledge with the Nexthink community.
Communicate effectively with (non-technical) stakeholders such as product managers and UX designers.


Qualifications


BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
0-3 years of professional software-engineering experience, including internships or projects.
Basic experience in integrating with LLMs (e.g., Prompting, Evaluation, Observability).
Demonstrated interest in delivering AI-powered features that serve real users at scale (e.g., retrieval-augmented search, Generative AI assistants, predictive analytics).
Fluency in Python or at least one strongly-typed language (TypeScript or Java), with clean-code and testing discipline.
Understanding of cloud-native architectures (AWS or comparable), containerisation (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes / ECS).
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions.
Product mindset and empathy for end-users; able to translate fuzzy product requirements into incremental engineering plans.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English (spoken & written).


If you’re excited about joing one of the top companies working on AI and pushing the boundaries of AI we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station

🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.

🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.

🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that NOT all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

This Data Science position is embedded within the Analytics Team, which plays a pivotal role in developing tools and analyses that drive the day-to-day operations of Vitol. The successful candidate will leverage data science and machine learning to revolutionize how Vitol tracks and anticipates commodity movements across the globe.

While regular collaboration with the central Data Science team is expected, this role is uniquely positioned within the team of developers and analysts focused on vessel and cargo flows. This setup fosters knowledge exchange, process improvements, and regular interaction with various business units that depend on these analyses.

The ideal candidate will have a hands-on approach, ready to dive deep into data, build models, create visualizations, and deliver actionable insights as needed. They will thrive in a fast-paced environment and be motivated by seeing their work have an immediate impact on Vitol’s operations.

Key Responsabilities :


Be an energetic and enthusiastic team member, uniquely positioned to harness the power of data to transform the inner workings of the commodities industry
Gain a deep understanding of Vitol’s core operations and develop creative solutions using data, automation, analytics, models, and optimization to enhance these operations
Explore new datasets and external vendor predictions/algorithms, extract meaningful insights, and present results through visualizations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Work closely with domain experts to design and implement machine learning solutions that are both understandable and usable by non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate with the central Data Science team and IT department to leverage existing tools and capabilities to deliver value to the business


Qualifications


Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent experience
Strong foundation in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning or equivalent experience
Extensive experience in exploring and extracting insights from heterogeneous multi-dimensional datasets is essential
Proficiency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code in a collaborative development environment
Experience in visualizing complex data for diverse audiences using tools such as D3.js, Bokeh, Plotly or similar frameworks
5-7 years of industry experience as a data scientist on real-world datasets, is preferred
C# development experience is a plus
French language skills are an advantage but not required


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


Proven experience in working within an Agile Scrum development model
Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team
Proactive and user-focused approach, embodying a "make it work" mentality, with a genuine interest in both the functional and technical aspects of challenges encountered
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration across diverse teams
Fluent in English, with full proficiency in business communication, both verbal and written
Passionate about leveraging data science and machine learning to innovate and disrupt traditionally human-centric industries
Skilled in deriving, abstracting, and translating value from complex models into actionable insights within a commercial context
Resourceful, creative, and adaptable, thriving in fast-paced, results-driven environments


What We Offer


Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Our Geneva office is located very centrally, 5 minutes from the main train station and 1 minute from the lake. The office has a rooftop lunch area, with views over the lake and Alps.
We organize regular activities to enable our people to meet colleagues from other teams in an informal setting, and to celebrate special achievements

Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Role: Data Scientist

Localisation: Genève, Suisse

Disponibilité : dès que possible

Taux d'occupation : 100%

Langue : Français




Vos missions

Conception & Développement : Rechercher, concevoir, prototyper et développer des solutions d’IA (Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Agents et Assistants intelligents), de l’expérimentation à la mise en production.
Modélisation Avancée : Évaluer et optimiser des modèles de pointe (LLMs, modèles multimodaux, réseaux de neurones, Computer Vision, etc.).
Intégration Technique : Collaborer avec les équipes de développement pour intégrer les modèles d’IA générative et de ML dans les systèmes applicatifs, via Microsoft Azure et GitHub.
Analyse de Données : Collecter, transformer et analyser des jeux de données variés (structurés, non structurés, visuels). La maîtrise de SQL est un atout.
Veille Technologique : Assurer une veille active sur les dernières avancées en Data Science, ML, Computer Vision et technologies émergentes, pour identifier les outils et approches les plus pertinents.
Vulgarisation & Conseil : Traduire des concepts techniques complexes pour des publics non techniques, et accompagner les équipes produit dans la compréhension des capacités de l’IA.
Prise de Besoin : Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes pour identifier les besoins métiers et proposer des solutions innovantes fondées sur la Data Science.
Qualité & Optimisation : Mesurer les performances des modèles, identifier les axes d'amélioration et optimiser les architectures pour assurer leur scalabilité et leur efficacité.







Votre profile & expérience




Diplôme en informatique
Minimum 3 ans d'expérience en sciences de données
Excellente maîtrise de Python
Solide expertise en Machine Learning et Deep Learning
Très bonne compréhension des modèles de Computer Vision et de l’IA générative
Connaissance des services cloud IA, notamment Microsoft Azure (Azure AI Foundry, Azure OpenAI Service) ; Google Cloud est un plus
Maîtrise de SQL et de la manipulation de données
Maîtrise des outils de versioning et collaboration via GitHub
Connaissance des principes de Model Context Protocol (MCP) et A2A
Expérience avec des bibliothèques ML telles que Scikit-learn, PyTorch ou TensorFlow
Bonnes qualités relationnelles et de collaboration







------




Qui Sommes-nous?




Créée en 2007, Antaes est une société suisse de conseil en management et technologie classée dans le top 10 des sociétés de conseil en Suisse. Nous comptons plus de 300 ingénieurs expérimentés qui partagent notre passion.




Présents en Suisse, à Singapour, à Hong-Kong et en France, nous accompagnons nos clients suisses, et internationaux en intervenant dans les domaines suivants :

Conseil en organisation et transformation
Ingénierie Industrielle
Management des systèmes d'Information




En rejoignant nos équipes vous découvrirez :

Une équipe dynamique dans un esprit start-up
Un accompagnement humain et un suivi de l’évolution de votre carrière
Des challenges pour contribuer au développement de votre réseau
Des événements : team building, meet-up, workshop, Winter Event …
Une entreprise certifiée @HappyAtWork et ayant une politique RSE engagée (médaille d’or Ecovadis2023)




Vous aussi, rejoignez l'aventure Antaes :)




Nous aimerions remercier tous les candidats de leur intérêt pour notre organisation. Cependant, nous communiquerons seulement avec les candidats retenus.

La forme masculine désigne, lorsqu’il y a lieu, aussi bien les femmes que les hommes, l’emploi du masculin a pour but de faciliter la lecture du texte.

Title: Optimization Data Scientist
Description:
Contexte et environnement

Your mission

As part of the Optimization Services team, you will design, develop, deploy and support the Data Science models of the team’s systems/applications.

The Optimization Services team focuses on the multi-market multi-asset optimizations of short-term power trading. We are part of the Gas & Power IT department for the Trading business lines of the TotalEnergies company, whose main office is in Geneva with a presence on other continents (Singapore, Houston, Dubaï, etc.).

TotalEnergies Gas & Power Trading (TGP) and its affiliates has a large and complex systems environment, which is evolving with the expansion of the power trading business and its impact on trading IT. To accompany these evolutions, the Optimization Services team participates in a significant change program that will have notable impacts both on the short-term and the long-term. In this context, the team is leveraging Data Science and Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP.

This role is global and focuses on the tools used by the front office and the integration into the overall energy management systems. The continuation of the systems performance, availability, and resilience, as well as scalability, need to be assured.

Activités

What You Will Do

Your focus will be on the Data Science models of the Optimization Service’s team applications. A significant part of these models will be based on Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP. You will interact mainly with the team’s Business Analysts, Data Scientists and Back-end Developers.

Analyze:


Understand the business context and specifications
Analyze the technical and functional feasibility
Participate in the design authority processes



Produce:


Design, develop and deploy new functionalities according to business needs
Ensure the proper functioning of the deliverable through monitoring and testing
Ensure the models are seamlessly integrated in the related applications
Implement the adequate balance between model precision and computation complexity
Adjust the deliverables based on feedback
Ensure adherence to best practice, guidelines and procedures for development, test and deployment
Maintain compliance of development and related activities with audit, cybersecurity and other internal requirements



Run & Change:


Improve the existing applications based on business needs and priorities
Participate in the support of the existing applications



Communicate:


Collaborate with Back-end Developers to integrate features and ensure interoperability
Provide technical support and assistance to Business Analysts and other contributors for specifications, testing and the resolution of incidents / problems
Document the codes as well as the algorithms to facilitate maintenance and knowledge transfer
Ensure and maintain effective interactions with other relevant teams
Contribute to the community of Data Scientists



Profil du candidat

We expect you to have:


A Data Scientist / Optimization Expert background with a proficiency in software development
Knowledge and experience in Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP
Proficiency in Python and its good practices
Interest for the power trading business
An ability to quickly understand the physical mechanisms for power assets (e.g.: how a battery works)
Educated to at least Masters degree level or an equivalent in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar discipline



It would be a plus if you had:


Knowledge of data and analytics, including AI/ML technologies, and their application for the power trading business
Experience in Agile methodologies and project management methodologies
Experience in a power utility or trading environment
Good skills on DevOps (Docker, Git, GitHub Actions)
Good knowledge of noSQL databases (MongoDB)
Experience with Databricks
Experience in Cloud-based environments



Your strengths

You are…


Able to solve complex problems
Rigorous
A Team player
Curious and open-minded
Dynamic and agile
Able to shift from detail-oriented to big-picture views



Languages


English : C1 level as minimum expectation
Competency in French is advantageous



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

At Roche, we thrive to deliver more benefits to our patients as part of our 10-year Pharma vision. An integral part to achieving this vision is to deliver new and innovative data analytics solutions to our scientists across Pharma Technical Operations (PT). To do so, we have formed a new organization called PT Digital and Operational Excellence (PTE) with the aspiration to digitally transform and to become a lean organization.

PTE is the new organization that catalyzes the global development and execution of PT’s Digital and Operational Excellence strategy to enable PT to realize our performance promises. We build a strong cross-functional and inclusive community, further develop the Lean and Digital skills across PT, and scale up our Digital and Advanced Analytics solutions, for the benefit of our colleagues and patients.

We aim to activate a data citizenship mindset and a digital mind, revolutionize our FAIR data ecosystem and systems landscape, re-design excellent processes, and generate transformative insights. We collaborate closely with global functions to deliver impactful value to our patients.

The Opportunity

You will function as an innovator, inventor, investigator, partner, engineer, “firefighter,” and scientist. This includes planning, executing, and delivering AI-based projects, analyzing problems, and exploring datasets.


Cross-Functional Collaboration: As part of cross-functional use case teams, you will tackle high-pressing business problems, becoming familiar with our product-related data, manufacturing processes, and systems
Data Analysis and AI Solutions: You will preprocess structured and unstructured data with the support of Data Engineers to build new Data Products (Data Mesh). Analyze small to medium amounts of static and real-time data to identify trends and patterns, and implement analysis pipelines. Develop AI solutions to resolve issues for our partners (e.g., Quality, Regulatory, Manufacturing)
Junior Technical Lead: As a Junior Technical Lead, you will support the team by driving key digital initiatives and collaborating with stakeholders across IT and PT functions. Your responsibilities include:
Work with IT and PT stakeholders to plan, execute, and sustain digital solutions
Help define and manage user requirements and backlogs, support use case deployments from diagnosis to implementation
Coordinate with data scientists, data engineers, UX/UI designers, IT specialists, and SMEs. Aid in value tracking and capability building
Partner with end customers to develop new analytics capabilities and share best practices
Scope: The initial scope of your projects will primarily be in the PTGenAI team, supporting process improvement, portfolio management, data management, workforce strategy, product delivery


Who You Are:


Education and Experience: You have a Master’s Degree with 1-2 years of relevant work experience in Pharma, holding a degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Bioinformatics, Physics, or a related quantitative field. A PhD is advantageous
Technical and Business Skills: Proficient in advanced analytics and biotech, data pipelining, modeling concepts, and AI platform ecosystems. Skilled in various AI and machine learning algorithms, programming languages (Python, R), data visualization, and cloud computing (GCP/AWS). Familiarity with Dataiku and large data sets is a plus
Interpersonal Skills: Strong relationship management, leadership, and communication skills. Ability to influence without formal authority, inspire cross-functional teams, and communicate complex ideas effectively. Experience with agile methodologies and innovation frameworks is beneficial
Mindset: Outcome-focused, proactive, customer-centric, and capable of strategic and analytical thinking. Demonstrates an enterprise mindset and entrepreneurial behaviors, identifying user needs and generating viable solutions creatively
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Be part of a cross-functional use case team addressing high-pressing business problems, familiarizing yourself with product-related data, manufacturing processes, and systems
Data Analysis and AI Solutions: Undertake data preprocessing, analyze static and real-time data to discover trends, and implement analysis pipelines. Build AI solutions to predict and solve manufacturing-related issues
Agility and Innovation: Demonstrate agility in working, communicating a compelling story and complex concepts with aspirational language, and applying elements of FAIR Data Citizenship in decision-making processes


Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let’s build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let’s build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: AI Developer m/f/d (50 % - 70%), Lucerne
Description:
Doing the right thing. We are active in Switzerland and 20 countries on four continents. Join us with a commitment to help us bring about a more caring society, as

AI Developer m/f/d (50 % - 70%), Lucerne

Our team drives innovation by harnessing data, automation, and artificial intelligence to optimize business processes and enable data-driven decision-making. With expertise in data science, business analysis, and process automation, we develop intelligent solutions that support the digital transformation of our organization.

To strengthen our team we are looking for an AI Developer (m/f/d). In this role, you will significantly influencing the technological future of our organization.

Your duties


Development of AI solutions/ML models
Test, deploy and maintain AI systems
Collaborate with data scientists and other engineers to integrate AI into broader system architecture
Stay current with AI trends and suggest improvements to existing systems and workflows


Our requirements


Knowledge and interest of ML/AI techniques
Proficiency in Python programming and Github
Excellent problem-solving skills and analytical thinking
Managing data flow and infrastructure for effective AI deployment
Collaboration across teams to align AI initiatives with organizational goals
Excellent communication skills to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, AI and other related fields
Hand-on experience implementing AI projects
Machine Learning or AI course certificates


Your place of work will be Lucerne.

Starting date: 01.08.2025 or as agreed upon

Caritas offers attractive working conditions and an open working atmosphere in an international field of activities. For the active development and implementation of the digital transformation, we count on employees with a digital and agile mindset who are keen to participate in processes of change.

For further information please contact: Ms Harry Witzthum, Head of Digital transformation & KI, Telephone +41 41 419 22 22.

Thank you for your interest. We look forward to receiving your job application by 11.08.2025 latest through our web portal.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.




We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.




Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




We use a modern stack of:





PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS


Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks


As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.




Particularly, you will get to:





Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.


Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.


All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.


Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.


Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.





In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements


Ideally, you have:





MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.


Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.


Experience with building and shipping software solutions.


Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits


We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




Interested? Contact us!




We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Data Scientist With Azure AI
Description:
OneAPPS Consulting (www.oneapps.com) is a Technology consulting firm based out of Zurich, Switzerland and offices across Europe. We are working on various projects involving diverse, multicultural teams with clients across the Europe. We are an invaluable partner and our teams have collaborated to support the growth of our clients. With more than 7 locations worldwide we help our clients to deliver their projects smoothly. We look forward to getting to know you and working with you.




Data Scientist with focus on engineering AI solutions with Microsoft Azure

Location: Zurich




Data Engineering: Expertise in data preprocessing, data wrangling, and building data pipelines to ensure data quality and accessibility.

Azure Machine Learning Services: Familiarity with Azure Machine Learning Studio, Azure Databricks, and other Azure AI services for building, training, and deploying machine learning models.

Big Data Technologies: Experience with big data tools and technologies such as Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Azure Synapse Analytics for handling large datasets.

Cloud Computing: Strong understanding of cloud computing concepts, including Azure infrastructure, storage solutions, and cloud security best practices.

Data Visualization and Communication: Ability to visualize data insights using tools like Power BI and effectively communicate findings to stakeholders.




If this role sounds like you, we invite you to apply. Thanks.

Due to work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss Nationals, UK, EU citizens as well as relevant work-permit holders for Switzerland.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect
Description:
JOB OVERVIEW

The Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect is responsible for building, deploying, and scaling advanced machine learning (ML) and optimization models on AWS to solve high-impact business problems in supply chain management. This role requires someone with a deep understanding of cloud-based technologies, capable of enhancing existing code and improving model performance. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, enhance existing cloud-based pipelines, and ensure smooth operation of production models. Additionally, you will contribute to automating KPI reports and support data-driven decision-making across the business.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Advanced Data Science Models: Apply statistical and machine learning models to supply chain management, with a focus on improving cost-efficiency and customer satisfaction.
AI & ML Systems: Develop and deploy AI/ML systems for process optimization, such as scheduling problems, and simulate various delivery scenarios.
Cloud-Based Enhancements: Enhance existing cloud-based data science solutions, implement new ML algorithms, and perform rigorous benchmarking to improve performance.
AWS Cloud Integration: Work with AWS cloud tools (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, etc.) to develop and deploy scalable AI/ML pipelines.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and visualize data to derive actionable business insights and improve workflows.
KPI Automation: Design, prepare, and automate KPI reports to support strategic decision-making.
Monitoring & Validation: Write test and validation scripts to monitor cloud performance, data latency, and ensure data output quality.
Collaboration: Collaborate with product managers, engineering teams, and business stakeholders to align solutions with operational and business goals.
Documentation: Ensure comprehensive documentation of data processes, modeling strategies, and system designs to facilitate knowledge transfer and system maintainability.
Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, AI, and cloud technologies to continuously improve the organization's analytical capabilities.




PROFILE




Education:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).

Work Experience:

5+ years of hands-on experience in data science, AI/ML.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Advanced experience with machine learning libraries.
Deep knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and optimization methods.
Experience with AWS technologies (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, Glue, Athena, etc.).
Experience working on optimization and scheduling (Python libraries preferred).
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
Knowledge of CI/CD practices for data workflows.
Experience in supply chain management.
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code.

Travel Requirements:

Occasional travel may be required for business needs.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
JOB OVERVIEW

The Senior Data Scientist is responsible for leading the design, development, and implementation of advanced data models, machine learning algorithms, and statistical analyses. This role aims to drive strategic decision-making and solve high-impact business challenges across various functions. The Senior Data Scientist will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop solutions, integrate insights, and optimize business outcomes.

The role requires a deep understanding of data science principles, strong analytical skills, and proficiency in machine learning techniques. It also involves working on data wrangling, exploratory analysis, and model deployment, with a focus on achieving production-ready AI/ML solutions that are aligned with business goals.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop End-to-End Data Science Projects: Lead data science initiatives from business exploration and model prototyping to deployment and performance monitoring.
Data Collection and Integration: Collect and integrate data from various sources, including databases, APIs, and cloud platforms, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Clean, preprocess, and validate datasets to ensure they meet quality standards for analysis.
Model Development: Design and develop predictive models and AI systems to optimize manufacturing operations, enable predictive maintenance, and improve supply chain logistics.
Collaboration: Work closely with engineering teams and business stakeholders to ensure that AI/ML solutions are aligned with business objectives and production-ready.
Communication: Effectively communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences through reports, visualizations, and dashboards.
Continuous Learning: Stay current with emerging trends, tools, and best practices in data science and artificial intelligence, ensuring that the organization remains on the cutting edge of technology.




PROFILE




Education:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).

Work Experience:

Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in data science or a related field, with expertise in machine learning, statistical analysis, and model deployment.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Advanced experience with machine learning libraries and frameworks.
Strong knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and experimental design.
Hands-on experience with data wrangling and model development.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and model deployment in different infrastructures.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams to achieve business goals.

Travel Requirements:

Occasional travel may be required for business needs, approximately 15 %

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Project Description:

We are looking for an experienced specialist to work for one of our client from the banking industry.




Responsibilities:

Design and implement advanced machine learning and deep learning models tailored to complex financial datasets and business objectives.
Apply statistical and mathematical methods to analyze data trends, assess risk, and inform predictive modeling.
Evaluate, validate, and monitor model performance, ensuring accuracy, stability, and regulatory compliance.
Collaborate with financial analysts, IT teams, and data scientists to align models with operational and strategic goals.
Translate technical results into actionable insights through clear visualizations and communication to non-technical stakeholders.
Stay current on evolving financial regulations, market developments, and innovations in AI applications for the banking sector.




Mandatory Skills Description:

Strong foundation in statistics, probability, and linear algebra, essential for developing interpretable and robust models.
Deep expertise in Python and R, with hands-on experience using libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Pandas.
Solid understanding of financial markets, instruments, and regulatory frameworks, enabling informed model development and deployment.
Proven ability to evaluate and validate models for fairness, accuracy, and real-world relevance.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with experience presenting to business leaders and cross-functional stakeholders.
Experience with deep learning frameworks, NLP, and time-series forecasting in financial contexts is highly desirable.




Languages:

English: C1 Advanced

Title: Research Scientist (Machine Learning), Lausanne
Description:
We are here to advance human health, by re-imagining drug discovery with the power of artificial intelligence.

The future is coming. A future enabled and enriched by the incredible power of machine learning. A future in which diseases are curtailed or cured by better and faster drug discovery.

Our values exist in service of that future. We think they’ll help us bring it closer, too.

Come and be part of an interdisciplinary team driving groundbreaking innovation and play a meaningful role in contributing towards us achieving our ambitious goals, while being a part of an inspiring and collaborative culture.

The world we want tomorrow is the one we’re building today. It starts with the culture at this company. It starts with you.

About Iso

Isomorphic Labs (IsoLabs) was founded in 2021 and is led by Sir Demis Hassabis. Our aim is to usher in a new era of biomedical breakthroughs and find cures for some of humanity’s devastating diseases.

Our foundations are built on the success of Google DeepMind’s AlphaFold, but we didn’t stop there! We are continuing to develop and implement state-of-the-art technologies as we move towards our goal of dramatically accelerating and improving the process of designing and bringing new medicines to patients.

We have built a world-leading drug design engine comprising foundational AI models that are capable of working across multiple therapeutic areas and drug modalities. The company is continually innovating on model architecture and developing cutting-edge capabilities to advance rational drug design.

Your impact

As a Research Scientist in machine learning (ML), you will play an exciting role in building greenfield machine learning based models and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

Working in a highly creative, fast-paced and interdisciplinary environment, you will be partnering with leading engineers and scientists to conceive, design, and develop cutting edge machine learning algorithms to unlock new modelling and predictive power which will be critical to the organisation’s success. You will draw upon your existing deep research experience whilst learning from those around you, to apply novel techniques and ideas to newly encountered computational biology and chemistry problems.

Depending on your experience:

You will create and lead projects, bringing together a variety of disciplined scientists and engineers to pursue some of the most ambitious modelling problems with deep learning - as well as providing technical mentorship and people management for others in the ML community at Isomorphic Labs

You will be instrumental in leading greenfield machine learning based research projects, building the models, and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

What You Will Do


Contribute to our research directions in machine learning by using your extensive knowledge of the field to apply world-leading ML algorithms to drug discovery.
Identify and create novel ML techniques and the required data to train.
Develop the architectures and training algorithms of machine learning models.
Analyse and tune experimental results to inform future experimental directions.
Implement and scale training and inference engineering frameworks.
Report and present research findings and developments clearly and efficiently, to both other ML scientists and scientists of different disciplines.
Iterate collaboratively with scientists and domain experts, sharing your own domain experience.
Suggest and engage in team collaborations to meet ambitious research goals.


Depending on your experience:


Provide technical mentorship and guidance to the ML research community, advising on projects, and shaping our research roadmap based on your deep technical expertise.
Provide developmental support to other ML research scientists.
Create, lead, and run ML research projects, fostering collaborative and diverse teams to solve high priority modelling problems.Cultivate a diverse and inclusive research culture.


Essential

Skills and qualifications


PhD or equivalent practical experience in a technical field.
A proven track record in machine learning using deep learning techniques, including designing new architectures, hands-on experimentation, analysis, and visualisation.
Strong knowledge of linear algebra, calculus and statistics.
Experience using ML frameworks such as JAX, PyTorch, or TensorFlow, and scientific software such as NumPy, SciPy, or Pandas.
A passion for applying ML research to real world problems.
Depending on your experience: project supervision, leadership, or management.


Nice to have


PhD in machine learning or computer science.
Relevant research experience to the position such as post doctoral roles, a proven track record of publications, or contributions to machine learning codebases.
Experience working in a scientific environment across disciplines (particularly biology, chemistry, physics).
Experience working with biological or chemical data and biological or chemistry software.
Experience working with real-world datasets.
Experience with ML on accelerators.
Experience in any of: large scale deep learning, generative models, graph neural networks, deep learning for drug discovery, deep learning for computer vision, 3D graphics/robotics, real-world applied RL.


Culture and values

We are guided by our shared values. It's not about finding people who think and act in the same way. These values help to guide our work and will continue to strengthen it.

Thoughtful

Thoughtful at Iso is about curiosity, creativity and care. It is about good people doing good, rigorous and future-making science every single day.

Brave

Brave at Iso is about fearlessness, but it’s also about initiative and integrity. The scale of the challenge demands nothing less.

Determined

Determined at Iso is the way we pursue our goal. It’s a confidence in our hypothesis, as well as the urgency and agility needed to deliver on it. Because disease won’t wait, so neither should we.

Together

Together at Iso is about connection, collaboration across fields and catalytic relationships. It’s knowing that transformation is a group project, and remembering that what we’re doing will have a real impact on real people everywhere.

Creating An Extraordinary Company

We believe that to be successful we need a team with a range of skills and talents. We're building an environment where collaboration is fundamental, learning is shared and every employee feels supported and able to thrive. We value unique experiences, knowledge, backgrounds, and perspectives, and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact.

We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Hybrid working

It’s hugely important for us to share knowledge and build strong relationships with each other, and we find it easier to do this if we spend time together in person. This is why we follow a hybrid model, and would require you to be able to come into the office 3 days a week (currently Tuesday, Wednesday, and one other day depending on which team you’re in). If you have additional needs that would prevent you from following this hybrid approach, we’d be happy to talk through these if you’re selected for an initial screening call.

Please note that when you submit an application, your data will be processed in line with our privacy policy.

>> Click to view other open roles at Isomorphic Labs

HTML:
We are here to advance human health, by re-imagining drug discovery with the power of artificial intelligence.

The future is coming. A future enabled and enriched by the incredible power of machine learning. A future in which diseases are curtailed or cured by better and faster drug discovery.

Our values exist in service of that future. We think they’ll help us bring it closer, too.

Come and be part of an interdisciplinary team driving groundbreaking innovation and play a meaningful role in contributing towards us achieving our ambitious goals, while being a part of an inspiring and collaborative culture.

The world we want tomorrow is the one we’re building today. It starts with the culture at this company. It starts with you.

About Iso

Isomorphic Labs (IsoLabs) was founded in 2021 and is led by Sir Demis Hassabis. Our aim is to usher in a new era of biomedical breakthroughs and find cures for some of humanity’s devastating diseases.

Our foundations are built on the success of Google DeepMind’s AlphaFold, but we didn’t stop there! We are continuing to develop and implement state-of-the-art technologies as we move towards our goal of dramatically accelerating and improving the process of designing and bringing new medicines to patients.

We have built a world-leading drug design engine comprising foundational AI models that are capable of working across multiple therapeutic areas and drug modalities. The company is continually innovating on model architecture and developing cutting-edge capabilities to advance rational drug design.

Your impact

As a Research Scientist in machine learning (ML), you will play an exciting role in building greenfield machine learning based models and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

Working in a highly creative, fast-paced and interdisciplinary environment, you will be partnering with leading engineers and scientists to conceive, design, and develop cutting edge machine learning algorithms to unlock new modelling and predictive power which will be critical to the organisation’s success. You will draw upon your existing deep research experience whilst learning from those around you, to apply novel techniques and ideas to newly encountered computational biology and chemistry problems.

Depending on your experience:

You will create and lead projects, bringing together a variety of disciplined scientists and engineers to pursue some of the most ambitious modelling problems with deep learning - as well as providing technical mentorship and people management for others in the ML community at Isomorphic Labs

You will be instrumental in leading greenfield machine learning based research projects, building the models, and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

What You Will Do

  • Contribute to our research directions in machine learning by using your extensive knowledge of the field to apply world-leading ML algorithms to drug discovery.
  • Identify and create novel ML techniques and the required data to train.
  • Develop the architectures and training algorithms of machine learning models.
  • Analyse and tune experimental results to inform future experimental directions.
  • Implement and scale training and inference engineering frameworks.
  • Report and present research findings and developments clearly and efficiently, to both other ML scientists and scientists of different disciplines.
  • Iterate collaboratively with scientists and domain experts, sharing your own domain experience.
  • Suggest and engage in team collaborations to meet ambitious research goals.

Depending on your experience:

  • Provide technical mentorship and guidance to the ML research community, advising on projects, and shaping our research roadmap based on your deep technical expertise.
  • Provide developmental support to other ML research scientists.
  • Create, lead, and run ML research projects, fostering collaborative and diverse teams to solve high priority modelling problems.Cultivate a diverse and inclusive research culture.

Essential

Skills and qualifications

  • PhD or equivalent practical experience in a technical field.
  • A proven track record in machine learning using deep learning techniques, including designing new architectures, hands-on experimentation, analysis, and visualisation.
  • Strong knowledge of linear algebra, calculus and statistics.
  • Experience using ML frameworks such as JAX, PyTorch, or TensorFlow, and scientific software such as NumPy, SciPy, or Pandas.
  • A passion for applying ML research to real world problems.
  • Depending on your experience: project supervision, leadership, or management.

Nice to have

  • PhD in machine learning or computer science.
  • Relevant research experience to the position such as post doctoral roles, a proven track record of publications, or contributions to machine learning codebases.
  • Experience working in a scientific environment across disciplines (particularly biology, chemistry, physics).
  • Experience working with biological or chemical data and biological or chemistry software.
  • Experience working with real-world datasets.
  • Experience with ML on accelerators.
  • Experience in any of: large scale deep learning, generative models, graph neural networks, deep learning for drug discovery, deep learning for computer vision, 3D graphics/robotics, real-world applied RL.

Culture and values

We are guided by our shared values. It's not about finding people who think and act in the same way. These values help to guide our work and will continue to strengthen it.

Thoughtful

Thoughtful at Iso is about curiosity, creativity and care. It is about good people doing good, rigorous and future-making science every single day.

Brave

Brave at Iso is about fearlessness, but it’s also about initiative and integrity. The scale of the challenge demands nothing less.

Determined

Determined at Iso is the way we pursue our goal. It’s a confidence in our hypothesis, as well as the urgency and agility needed to deliver on it. Because disease won’t wait, so neither should we.

Together

Together at Iso is about connection, collaboration across fields and catalytic relationships. It’s knowing that transformation is a group project, and remembering that what we’re doing will have a real impact on real people everywhere.

Creating An Extraordinary Company

We believe that to be successful we need a team with a range of skills and talents. We're building an environment where collaboration is fundamental, learning is shared and every employee feels supported and able to thrive. We value unique experiences, knowledge, backgrounds, and perspectives, and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact.

We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Hybrid working

It’s hugely important for us to share knowledge and build strong relationships with each other, and we find it easier to do this if we spend time together in person. This is why we follow a hybrid model, and would require you to be able to come into the office 3 days a week (currently Tuesday, Wednesday, and one other day depending on which team you’re in). If you have additional needs that would prevent you from following this hybrid approach, we’d be happy to talk through these if you’re selected for an initial screening call.

Please note that when you submit an application, your data will be processed in line with our privacy policy.

Title: AI Software Engineer
Description:
Proclinical Staffing hat sich mit einem etablierten und wachsenden Schweizer IT-Dienstleister zusammengeschlossen, um dessen Teamausbau durch die Einstellung eines AI Software Engineer zu unterstützen. Mein Kunde beschäftigt derzeit über 700 Mitarbeitende und ist auf End-to-End-Dienstleistungen für maßgeschneiderte und integrative Lösungen im Bereich verteilter Softwaresysteme spezialisiert.

Aufgaben und Verantwortlichkeiten

Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Projektteams als praxisorientierter Softwareentwickler unter Einsatz von Technologien wie Java, Angular und Docker
Übernahme der Rolle des AI-Champions im Team und zentrale Ansprechperson für alle KI-bezogenen Themen
Funktion als Hauptansprechpartner für KI-Themen zur Sicherstellung von Klarheit und Abstimmung im Projekt
Identifikation und Bewertung sinnvoller KI-Anwendungsfälle, z. B. LLMs, RAG, Copilots und Prompt Engineering
Förderung des Wissensaustauschs durch KI-Workshops, Schulungen und Pair Programming
Leitung der Entwicklung von Proof-of-Concepts (PoCs) und Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) für KI-gestützte Funktionen
Unterstützung des Product Owners bei der Priorisierung von KI-Initiativen und der Erstellung umsetzbarer User Stories
Beobachtung aktueller Entwicklungen und Trends im KI-Bereich und Einbringung innovativer Ideen ins Team
Pflege und kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung der technischen KI-Dokumentation des Projekts

Deine Fähigkeiten

Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Fullstack-Entwickler (Java, Spring Boot, Angular, Docker etc.)
Erste praktische Erfahrung mit LLMs, RAG, Prompt Engineering und KI-gestützter Softwareentwicklung
Vertraut mit Cloud-Umgebungen (Azure, AWS), Git, CI/CD und Container-Technologien
Kenntnisse in agilen Methoden wie Scrum, Kanban oder SAFe

Dein Profil

Engagierter und erfahrener Softwareentwickler mit über 5 Jahren Berufserfahrung
Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Große Begeisterung für neue Technologien mit einem starken Fokus auf praxisnahe KI-Integration
Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Konzepte verständlich für technische und nicht-technische Zielgruppen zu vermitteln
Pragmatische und praxisorientierte Umsetzung von KI-Lösungen mit Fokus auf den realen Nutzen
Neugierig, motiviert und inspirierend, mit der Fähigkeit, Innovation und Zusammenarbeit im Team zu fördern
Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Sollten Sie Fragen oder Schwierigkeiten bei der Bewerbung haben, wenden Sie sich bitte an Timothy Deschamps unter der t.deschamps@proclinical.com.

Proclinical ist eine spezialisierte Personalberatung, die berufliche Chancen in der pharmazeutischen, biopharmazeutischen, biotechnologischen und medizintechnischen Branche anbietet.

Proclinical Staffing ist außerdem ein Arbeitgeber der Chancengleichheit.

Show more
