Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We're Hiring: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (HealthTech R&D) 
Start Date: August 1, 2025
Languages: English required; French or Spanish is a plus

Our client is building machine learning solutions to transform how clinical trials are conducted. Our goal is to turn raw sensor data from smartphones into meaningful, quantifiable health measures that help clinicians assess whether a treatment is working—earlier and more accurately.
This work is aimed at improving decision-making during the earliest stages of drug development, ultimately helping pharmaceutical teams reduce R&D timelines and costs.
Looking for one or two senior-level machine learning engineers to join our team in Europe.
The Role We’re looking for senior machine learning engineers who are excited to work with real-world, high-variability sensor data and can design systems that extract meaningful clinical insights. This is a hands-on role, with significant influence on how our models are built, validated, and deployed in production.
This position is ideal for someone who has experience translating research into production-level code, and who is motivated by the opportunity to work at the intersection of machine learning, digital biomarkers, and early-stage clinical research.
Responsibilities
Develop and deploy machine learning models that process raw time-series data (e.g., from smartphone sensors) into structured, clinically relevant measures.
Apply techniques such as signal denoising, filtering, and feature extraction to improve model robustness and reliability.
Collaborate with clinical and research teams to define measurable indicators that are sensitive to changes during treatment.
Translate exploratory prototypes into production-grade systems that are well-documented, tested, and suitable for regulated environments.
Mentor and support junior ML scientists, helping shape a consistent and scalable ML approach.
Contribute to the broader vision of building tools that support more efficient and evidence-driven drug development.
Requirements
5+ years of experience developing machine learning models, ideally in time-series, sensor, or biomedical data.
Advanced proficiency in Python and experience with multiple ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn).
Strong understanding of signal processing and experience working with noisy, real-world data.
Prior experience working in or alongside regulated or research environments (e.g., pharma, medtech, clinical trials) is a strong advantage.
Experience deploying ML systems in production, ideally using tools such as Databricks and AWS.
Based in Europe.
English fluency required. French or Spanish is a plus.
Why Join Us This is an opportunity to shape the technical foundation of a platform with the potential to improve how new therapies are developed. Your work will directly support the creation of digital endpoints that could bring new levels of precision and speed to clinical research.
You’ll join a focused, mission-driven team at an early stage and contribute to building both our models and our culture.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist, GeminiApp, Personalization
Description:
About The Team

Our team, GeminiApp, is on a mission to build a universal AI assistant that will empower billions of people. We are creating a personal, proactive, and powerful life assistant that will be used multiple times a day to increase productivity and creativity by 10 to 100-fold. Our work is shaping how humanity interacts with AI at scale.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist on the GeminiApp team, you are a key partner and co-creator in our product strategy. You will be instrumental in building a uniquely proactive and powerful assistant by ensuring our strategic decisions are grounded in data. This is a high-impact role for a data scientist who is excited about working in a fast-paced, innovative environment and who is passionate about building user-centered experiences that will redefine our relationship with technology.

What You’ll Do


Partner with product, engineering, and UX to develop data-driven product strategies
Translate ambiguous questions into well-defined problems, design experiments, and analyze large complex datasets for insights
Develop and implement novel, goal-oriented metrics
Build and deploy statistical/ML models to understand our users, enhance product capabilities and personalize user experience
Communicate findings & recommendations to stakeholders, including executives
Champion data-driven culture by feeding user engagement insights back into models
Collaborate with the GenAI team on model quality and feature adoption
Act as a technical leader for the local team, guiding junior members on complex analyses and upholding best practices to ensure high-quality, impactful work


What We're Looking For


A bias for action and a relentless drive to build something great. You are a resourceful and creative problem-solver, able to find innovative solutions in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You are comfortable with ambiguity and thrive on a challenge.
Strong business acumen and a strategic mindset. You have a proven ability to connect data-driven insights to business impact and can effectively translate business needs into data science problems.
Deep technical expertise. You have a strong foundation in statistical modeling, machine learning, and experimental design. You are proficient in SQL and have hands-on experience with a programming language like Python or R.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills. You can articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences, including executive leadership. You are a compelling storyteller who can use data to influence decisions.
A collaborative and influential partner. You have a track record of successfully collaborating with and influencing cross-functional teams, particularly engineering and product management, to drive data-informed decisions. You are ready to work in an environment with a shared roadmap that holds multiple teams accountable for both model quality and feature adoption.
A commitment to user trust and privacy. You understand the importance of telling users what data is being used and why, and you are committed to providing users with granular, easy-to-understand controls over their personal information.


Why You'll Love Working Here


Impact: You'll have a direct and meaningful impact on a product designed to empower billions of people and be one of the greatest forces for good in the world.
Growth: We're a fast-growing team within Google, and you'll have the opportunity to evolve quickly to meet changing user needs.
Team & Culture: You'll work with a talented and passionate team of people who are excited about what they do and have fun doing it.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, Physics, Economics, or a related quantitative field.
8 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, performing statistical analysis, and coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL).


At Google DeepMind, we value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Application deadline: 12pm GMT Thursday 11th August 2025

Note: In the event your application is successful and an offer of employment is made to you, any offer of employment will be conditional on the results of a background check, performed by a third party acting on our behalf. For more information on how we handle your data, please see ourApplicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for an experienced specialist to work for one of our client from the banking industry.




Responsibilities:

Design and implement data engineering solutions, including preprocessing, wrangling, and pipeline orchestration to ensure high data quality and reliability.
Build, train, and deploy machine learning models using Azure tools such as Machine Learning Studio, Databricks, and Azure AI services.
Manage and optimize workflows for big data processing using technologies like Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Azure Synapse Analytics.
Collaborate with engineering and analytics teams to develop scalable AI systems within the Azure cloud ecosystem.
Ensure solutions adhere to cloud security best practices, data governance, and compliance standards.
Communicate complex data findings through impactful visualizations and storytelling using Power BI and similar tools.




Mandatory Skills Description:

Strong experience in data engineering, with proficiency in building robust pipelines and transforming raw data into analytics-ready formats.
Hands-on expertise with Microsoft Azure AI services, including Machine Learning Studio, Databricks, and related tooling.
Familiarity with big data technologies, particularly Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Azure Synapse Analytics.
In-depth knowledge of cloud computing principles, especially within Azure infrastructure (e.g., storage, networking, identity, and security).
Proficient in data visualization and communication using Power BI, with the ability to clearly articulate insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities, with a solution-oriented and collaborative mindset.

Show more

  • Hands-on expertise with Microsoft Azure AI services, including Machine Learning Studio, Databricks, and related tooling.
  • Familiarity with big data technologies, particularly Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Azure Synapse Analytics.
  • In-depth knowledge of cloud computing principles, especially within Azure infrastructure (e.g., storage, networking, identity, and security).
  • Proficient in data visualization and communication using Power BI, with the ability to clearly articulate insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities, with a solution-oriented and collaborative mindset.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an experienced specialist to work for one of our client from the banking industry.

Responsibilities:

Design and implement advanced machine learning and deep learning models tailored to complex financial datasets and business objectives.
Apply statistical and mathematical methods to analyze data trends, assess risk, and inform predictive modelling.
Evaluate, validate, and monitor model performance, ensuring accuracy, stability, and regulatory compliance.
Collaborate with financial analysts, IT teams, and data scientists to align models with operational and strategic goals.
Translate technical results into actionable insights through clear visualizations and communication to non-technical stakeholders.
Stay current on evolving financial regulations, market developments, and innovations in AI applications for the banking sector.




Mandatory Skills Description:

Strong foundation in statistics, probability, and linear algebra, essential for developing interpretable and robust models.
Deep expertise in Python and R, with hands-on experience using libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Pandas.
Solid understanding of financial markets, instruments, and regulatory frameworks, enabling informed model development and deployment.
Proven ability to evaluate and validate models for fairness, accuracy, and real-world relevance.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with experience presenting to business leaders and cross-functional stakeholders.
Experience with deep learning frameworks, NLP, and time-series forecasting in financial contexts is highly desirable.




Languages:

English: C1 Advanced

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
On behalf of our client Hilo by Aktiia, and as part of an exclusive mandate, we are seeking a versatile and motivated individual to join their pioneering team as a




MACHINE LEARING ENGINEER 100%




Company Overview

Hilo by Aktiia believes, the key to improving cardiovascular health is to provide patients and physicians with a deeper understanding of the blood pressure pattern. Before Hilo, it was not possible to monitor cardiovascular health at scale.

They are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $96M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. They have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Their technology is based on 18 years of research by their founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Hilo by Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device under MDR leading to commercial access of approximately 43 countries worldwide.







Responsibilities

Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges
Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to solve complex technical problems




Your profile

M.Sc or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
2+ years of industry experience applying Deep Learning techniques, ideally in a highly regulated field (medtech, banking, …)
Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
Experience in performing verification and validation (V&V) activities of developed models
Experience in deploying machine learning models in a production environment
Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.) + AWS
Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Creative and hands-on approach to problem-solving
Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
Highly organized and meticulous in code development and documentation, ensuring thorough traceability and clarity in compliance with medical device industry standards
Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit




Benefits

Pension
Competitive compensation package based on experience
Flexible work location (hybrid work schedule)







Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches?




Then Flurin Schwager looks forward to receiving your application documents or your call.

Title: Research Scientist, Deep Learning and Robotic Foundation Models
Description:
Intrinsic is Alphabet’s bet aiming to reimagine the potential of industrial robotics. Our team believes that advances in AI, perception and simulation will redefine what’s possible for industrial robotics in the near future – with software and data at the core.

Our mission is to make industrial robotics intelligent, accessible, and usable for millions more businesses, entrepreneurs, and developers. We are a dynamic team of engineers, roboticists, designers, and technologists who are passionate about unlocking the creative and economic potential of industrial robotics.

Role

As a Research Engineer in the Applied Research team, you conduct applied research and design innovative algorithms in the space of geometric computer vision and image/video/vision-centric foundation models for deployment in industrial robotics at scale. In this role you define processes and develop approaches in Deep Learning that mitigate the risks of hallucinations and improve accuracy and deploy algorithms on industrial robotics workcells to gauge sim-to-real transfer of models. As a Research Engineer at Intrinsic you provide input and guidance for the development and generation of synthetic data and annotations required for training foundation models at scale based on the identification of gaps in the sim-to-real transfer of models. You also work with Research partners and cross-disciplinary engineering teams to ideate new approaches and architectures to bring state of the art foundation models to real-world industrial applications. Constant learning and exploration of unfamiliar technologies is also part of this role.

How your work moves the mission forward

Skills

Your work can play a significant role in democratizing access to advanced AI skills to the average user in robotics and enhance the credibility of deploying AI models at scale in industrial settings. As part of your day-to-day work, you will:


You are insightful and innovative, proactively identifying needs and bottlenecks based on customer problems and proposing practical solutions that are deployable in high throughput environments
You serve as the nexus between the robotics team and our research partners—collaborating with them, providing engineering insights into research projects, and ideating practical next generation solutions
You serve as an advisor to the engineering and other cross-functional teams providing critical guidance in terms of translating early (AI-powered) research capabilities into robust engineering capabilities in Flowstate (Intrinsic’s software platform for robotics solutions)
You continually keep abreast of the latest developments in deep learning, AI, machine learning, perception to ensure that Intrinsic can continually keep evolving its advanced capabilities over time
document and develop the prototype fully so it can be shipped to external users.


In all the above, you will work closely with a sub-team within the R&D division, but will also frequently collaborate with other engineering, and product groups within Intrinsic.

Skills you will need to be successful


Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science, Robotics, or a related technical field with a high degree of passion for robotics and foundation models and a strong inclination towards accelerating the deployment of such models in practical industrial manufacturing applications
3 years of experience in robotics software development or research (work on your PhD can count towards this)
Proficiency programming in Python and at least one of the ML/DL frameworks such as PyTorch, Jax, and/or Tensorflow
Knowledge of robotics perception or manipulation algorithms.
Experience working with robot hardware or simulation environments.
A team player with a product mindset, a willingness to learn, and apply oneself to delivering value in practical real-world problems


Skills that will differentiate your candidacy


Advanced degree (Master's or PhD) in Robotics, Computer Science, or a related technical field.
Expertise in deep learning, including transformer-based approaches for robotics, and other areas such as Learning from Demonstrations, Reinforcement learning
Proven ability to apply robotics ML/AI research to real-world problems and demonstrate tangible impact.
Experience generating or utilizing synthetic data for machine learning in robotics.
Publications in relevant robotics conferences or journals.


At Intrinsic, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Employment at Intrinsic is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications directly related to professional competence. Intrinsic does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), or any other basis protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Intrinsic’s policy to comply with all applicable national, state and local laws pertaining to nondiscrimination and equal opportunity.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at: candidate-support@intrinsic.ai.

Title: Scientific Applications Engineer, Benchling & Lab Platforms
Company: Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering – BIIE
Description:
The Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering (BIIE) is a new interdisciplinary research institute dedicated to innovation in immune engineering. Founded in 2025 through a generous endowment from Fondation Botnar, the BIIE supports scientists in taking on some of the world’s most challenging problems in immunology and global health. The institute unites experts across immunology, biomedicine, bioengineering, computational biology, artificial intelligence, and machine learning, creating a unique multidisciplinary environment with a mission to make a lasting impact and to train future leaders in immune engineering. BIIE’s cutting-edge research spans systems immunology, synthetic biology, and computational immunology.




At the BIIE We are implementing Benchling as our Electronic Lab Notebook/Laboratory Information Management System (ELN/LIMS) to enhance our R&D data management. We seek a skilled Scientific Applications Engineer to customize and support this platform, enabling our researchers to record, manage, and analyze experimental data efficiently. This role sits within the research operations group at the BIIE, but will work day-to-day with scientists at the bench as well as the automation team, bridging cutting-edge immunology research with modern data infrastructure.


Tasks



Benchling Platform Configuration: Serve as the in-house Benchling expert and administrator. Configure the Benchling R&D Cloud to fit our research workflows – including designing custom entity schemas (for samples, assays, inventory), setting up templates/protocols for experiment entries, and configuring workflows (e.g. request & results tracking). Continuously optimize the Benchling tenant for usability and efficiency as our needs evolve.


Scientific Workflow Analysis: Work closely with BIIE’s research teams to understand their experimental workflows and data tracking needs. Translate these requirements into Benchling configurations or suggest process improvements.


LIMS Implementation & Customization: Develop and implement custom extensions or modules within Benchling to cover any functionality gaps. For example, create custom dashboards or analytical reports for scientists, and use Benchling’s APIs & App Canvas to script repetitive tasks and ensure data integrity across projects. Work with Benchling’s support and services team as needed to deploy advanced configurations (e.g. validation workflows, custom integrations).


Systems Integration: Integrate Benchling with other laboratory and data systems to streamline data flow. This includes connecting instruments and automation equipment to Benchling (for automatic data upload), and integrating Benchling with our other platforms (such as data analysis pipelines or a data warehouse) via APIs. Develop Python scripts or use integration tools to ensure sample and experiment data in Benchling can be pushed to, or pulled from, external databases and analysis software.



Requirements



Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Biology, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, or a related field. Familiarity with immunology or biomedical research environments is highly advantageous, enabling you to better understand and anticipate the scientists’ needs.


2+ years experience administering or implementing ELN/LIMS platforms in a research or clinical lab setting. Direct experience with Benchling is strongly preferred.


Proficiency in scripting/programming for data integration and automation. Python experience is required (e.g., for using Benchling’s APIs or processing data exports). SQL knowledge is required for querying and potentially interfacing with relational databases. Experience with RESTful APIs and data formats (JSON, CSV) is expected.





At BIIE, you will be an integral part of a mission to accelerate immunology breakthroughs. This role offers the opportunity to shape how cutting-edge research data is captured and utilized, by building a digital foundation for our labs. You will work in a highly collaborative and interdisciplinary setting. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, opportunities for professional development (including Benchling certification programs), and the chance to make a tangible impact on scientific discovery by empowering researchers with effective technology.

Title: Machine Learning Evangelist @AI Startup
Description:
Lightly AG is an official ETH and HSG Spin-off in the field of machine learning and computer vision. Its products are used by leading companies in autonomous driving, medical imaging, and visual inspection to curate visual machine learning data.




Lightly consists of a small team of talented developers, researchers, and business developers in Zurich, who all have a massive impact on the business and product. The company is backed by Y-Combinator, Wingman Ventures, and Soma Capital.


Tasks


At Lightly, our mission is to drive the democratization of artificial intelligence through open-source innovation. Our flagship repository, Lightly, is the leading framework for training self-supervised and foundation models.




We believe in a community-driven approach to AI advancement and strive to empower developers and organizations with the tools they need to create transformative AI solutions. Our open-source commitment is central to this mission, fostering collaboration and innovation within the global AI community.




As a Machine Learning Evangelist at Lightly, you will be a key player in our mission to build and nurture a vibrant open-source community. You will engage directly with developers, data scientists, and AI enthusiasts to promote Lightly, create compelling technical content, and contribute to the ongoing development of our platform




Responsibilities:




Community Engagement (20% of time)





Actively participate in community forums, including GitHub, Stack Overflow, and Slack/Discord channels, addressing questions and fostering discussions.


Organize and host virtual meetups, webinars, and other community events to engage and grow our user base.


Develop and manage community programs, such as ambassador or advocate initiatives, to encourage community involvement and contribution.





Content Creation (40% of time)





Generate high-quality technical content, including blog posts, tutorials, screencasts, and conference talks that educate and inspire our community.


Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to produce content that highlights new features, use cases, and best practices.





Product Contribution (40% of time)





Contribute to the development of Lightly, particularly in areas related to community feedback and user experience improvements.


Assist in the creation of product documentation and guides to ensure ease of use for new and existing users.



Requirements


Who we are looking for:





Professional experience in machine learning or data science (2+ years preferred).


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.


Proficiency in Python and familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.


Experience with open-source projects, either as a maintainer or active contributor.


Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to create engaging technical content.


Passion for building and nurturing community relationships and fostering a collaborative environment.





Nice to Have:





Experience with computer vision applications.


Prior experience in a developer advocacy or technical marketing role.


Familiarity with collaborative development tools (e.g., GitHub, Slack).





Important: We believe in people who are driven by curiosity and are willing to learn and take the next step. Please also reach out if you don't exactly "check all these boxes".


Benefits



Competitive salary, depending on experience.


Equity options to share in the success of our company.


Flexible working hours and a remote-friendly work environment.


Comprehensive benefits package, including financial support for sports/health, mobility, and education.


Opportunities for professional growth and development in an innovative and supportive team.


Optional: Office in the heart of Zurich next to the central station with Snacks


Company events, retreats, and offsites





If you're passionate about AI and open source, and you thrive in a community-centric environment, we'd love to hear from you!




Apply Now: Please include your resume, a cover letter, and links to any relevant projects or content you've created.

Show more
HTML:
Lightly AG is an official ETH and HSG Spin-off in the field of machine learning and computer vision. Its products are used by leading companies in autonomous driving, medical imaging, and visual inspection to curate visual machine learning data.


Lightly consists of a small team of talented developers, researchers, and business developers in Zurich, who all have a massive impact on the business and product. The company is backed by Y-Combinator, Wingman Ventures, and Soma Capital.


Tasks

At Lightly, our mission is to drive the democratization of artificial intelligence through open-source innovation. Our flagship repository, Lightly, is the leading framework for training self-supervised and foundation models.


We believe in a community-driven approach to AI advancement and strive to empower developers and organizations with the tools they need to create transformative AI solutions. Our open-source commitment is central to this mission, fostering collaboration and innovation within the global AI community.


As a Machine Learning Evangelist at Lightly, you will be a key player in our mission to build and nurture a vibrant open-source community. You will engage directly with developers, data scientists, and AI enthusiasts to promote Lightly, create compelling technical content, and contribute to the ongoing development of our platform


Responsibilities:


Community Engagement (20% of time)



  • Actively participate in community forums, including GitHub, Stack Overflow, and Slack/Discord channels, addressing questions and fostering discussions.

  • Organize and host virtual meetups, webinars, and other community events to engage and grow our user base.

  • Develop and manage community programs, such as ambassador or advocate initiatives, to encourage community involvement and contribution.


Content Creation (40% of time)



  • Generate high-quality technical content, including blog posts, tutorials, screencasts, and conference talks that educate and inspire our community.

  • Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to produce content that highlights new features, use cases, and best practices.


Product Contribution (40% of time)



  • Contribute to the development of Lightly, particularly in areas related to community feedback and user experience improvements.

  • Assist in the creation of product documentation and guides to ensure ease of use for new and existing users.


Requirements

Who we are looking for:



  • Professional experience in machine learning or data science (2+ years preferred).

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.

  • Proficiency in Python and familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.

  • Experience with open-source projects, either as a maintainer or active contributor.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to create engaging technical content.

  • Passion for building and nurturing community relationships and fostering a collaborative environment.


Nice to Have:



  • Experience with computer vision applications.

  • Prior experience in a developer advocacy or technical marketing role.

  • Familiarity with collaborative development tools (e.g., GitHub, Slack).


Important: We believe in people who are driven by curiosity and are willing to learn and take the next step. Please also reach out if you don't exactly "check all these boxes".


Benefits

  • Competitive salary, depending on experience.

  • Equity options to share in the success of our company.

  • Flexible working hours and a remote-friendly work environment.

  • Comprehensive benefits package, including financial support for sports/health, mobility, and education.

  • Opportunities for professional growth and development in an innovative and supportive team.

  • Optional: Office in the heart of Zurich next to the central station with Snacks

  • Company events, retreats, and offsites


If you're passionate about AI and open source, and you thrive in a community-centric environment, we'd love to hear from you!


Apply Now: Please include your resume, a cover letter, and links to any relevant projects or content you've created.

Title: Data Science Engineer (h/f) 80-100%
Description:
Tu souhaites rejoindre une équipe au cœur de la transformation digitale par la donnée et l’IA ? Tu veux aller au-delà du simple modèle IA et contribuer à la mise en place de solutions fiables, sécurisées et déployables à l’échelle ?

Intègre l’équipe Advanced Analytics (au sein du secteur Strategy & Data Analytics), dont la mission est de concevoir des solutions concrètes et innovantes en combinant analytique avancée, machine learning et intelligence artificielle générative (GenAI).

Rejoins-nous pour travailler sur des projets concrets à l’interface entre data science, développement Python, ingénierie logicielle, DevSecOps et infrastructures cloud & on-prem.

TA MISSION


Tu industrialises les solutions IA, en assurant leur automatisation, leur déploiement, leur packaging et leur monitoring
Avec rigueur et méthode, tu mets en place des pipelines CI/CD robustes et sécurisés pour les projets data
En lien étroit avec les équipes sécurité, IT et architecture, tu garantis la conformité et la scalabilité des solutions
Tu développes des environnements techniques à la fois reproductibles et collaboratifs, facilitant le travail d’équipe
Acteur·rice clé de notre écosystème MLOps / DevSecOps, tu contribues à la mise en place d’outils cloud, de solutions de conteneurisation, de gestion des accès et de gouvernance des modèles
Tu participes activement au développement de packages Python internes, d’outils d’automatisation ou de petites applications data utiles à l’équipe comme aux métiers


Tes qualités


Tu maîtrises Python dans un contexte production, avec une structuration modulaire, une gestion rigoureuse des dépendances, des tests et du packaging
À l’aise avec les outils CI/CD, tu travailles idéalement avec GitLab et des environnements conteneurisés comme Kubernetes
En environnement cloud (Azure, DataBricks), tu mobilises tes connaissances en infrastructure as code et en sécurité : authentification, certificats, conformité et audits
Tu évolues avec fluidité dans un environnement Linux et automatises les tâches grâce à des scripts Bash
Capable de vulgariser des concepts techniques, tu sais les rendre accessibles à un public non expert, avec clarté et sens du contact


Ta formation


Tu es diplômé·e d’un Bachelor ou Master ou d’une école d’ingénieur en informatique, data science, systèmes distribués, mathématiques appliquées ou formation équivalente avec une forte composante technique.


Pour nous rejoindre


Partage-nous ton parcours avec ton CV, et tu peux volontiers y ajouter quelques mots pour nous parler de toi et de tes motivations


Fonction : Ingénieur/e Données N04

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?

Si toi aussi tu aimes l’entre-aide, la bienveillance et la proactivité, tu es à la bonne place !

Ici, au Groupe Mutuel, nous t’offrons la possibilité d’exercer une activité variée tout en favorisant un environnement de travail stimulant qui concilie ta vie privée ainsi que professionnelle. Tu te retrouveras dans une équipe où travail, rigueur mais surtout plaisir sont les mots d’ordre.

Entrée en fonction: Aussi vite que possible, mais aussi lentement que nécessaire!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist Delivery
Description:
Why you should join

At NetGuardians and Intix, we’re joining forces to build the future of financial crime prevention. Our unique combo of standardized data mastery and powerful AI analytics means you’ll work at the bleeding edge of fintech innovation. Think plug-and-play intelligence, smarter fraud detection, and a real impact on global trust in finance.

What You Will Do

Deliver cutting-edge data science solutions that protect banks and their customers from fraud and financial crime.


Lead analytics implementations for clients, from PoC to production.
Translate raw data into smart fraud prevention insights using Python and ML.
Collaborate with delivery and engineering teams to solve real-world problems with real-time urgency.
Build and maintain tools, models, and documentation that scale across customers.
Continuously learn and innovate — because financial crime never sits still, and neither do we.


Who You Are

You’re fluent in Python (pandas, sklearn, matplotlib, Jupyter — the works), and you enjoy writing clean, reusable code. You’re comfortable navigating Git and CI/CD environments, and while experience in banking or fintech is a bonus, your curiosity and drive to learn matter more. You communicate clearly, ask smart questions, and thrive in collaborative settings. You're proactive, imaginative, and unafraid to challenge the status quo if it means making things better — for your team, our tech, or our clients. Proficiency in English is a must; French is a nice plus.

Who We Are

We’re NetGuardians and Intix — two fintech innovators creating a new standard in AI-powered financial crime prevention. Our global team works with leading banks across 30+ countries. We're diverse, deeply collaborative, and genuinely care about the people we protect — and the people we work with.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer - Computer Vision
Description:
We are looking for a machine learning & computer vision expert to strengthen our team in Zurich.

The goal of this position is to develop and fine-tune state of the art vision and 3D geometric models for scene segmentation and scene understanding.

Requirements

Experience with developing and training state of the art (transformer-based) vision models. Experience with 3D models to operate on point clouds is a plus.

Particularly:


PhD or master's degree in computer vision or machine learning with relevant project experience (e.g. master thesis)
Excellent knowledge of Python, PyTorch and the training of deep neural networks
Hands-on experience in the training and deployment of 2D and 3D segmentation and environment understanding models
Robotics experience is a plus.


We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment, and who is able and willing to take ownership of projects and decisions.

Benefits

We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.

We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.

We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.
Show more

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink, a Swiss and global tech unicorn!

Welcome to Nexthink - one of Switzerland's biggest unicorn tech companies! We're not just another tech company; we're revolutionizing how millions of people experience their digital experience.

Why Nexthink? At Nexthink, we’re the pioneers of Digital Employee Experience (DEX) technology. Using a powerful mix of real-time analytics, clever automation, and cutting-edge AI and Machine Learning, we're helping some of the world's biggest companies create digital workplaces that delight their employees at work. Think of us as the architects of the future workplace!

With a truly global presence, our teams innovate across different locations. Headquartered in both Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, US, Nexthink has more than 9 offices worldwide.. We’re trusted by over 1,300 customers worldwide, and the best part? We’re just getting started! 🚀

We’re a team of passionate tech enthusiasts, problem solvers, and innovators. At Nexthink, collaboration is key—we encourage curiosity, creativity, and bold thinking. If you love solving real-world challenges and want to be part of an exciting growth journey, you might just be the Nexthinker we’re looking for!

Job Description

We are seeking a Senior AI Engineer with experience building and operating AI-powered software systems. You will join one of the AI teams and be responsible for prototyping, maturing and shipping AI features to a production-ready level. You will also integrate external AI services (e.g., LLM providers) into Nexthink’s cloud platform.

You are a pragmatic, results-driven engineer who understands modern AI stacks but thinks in terms of software reliability, performance and user impact. You focus on creating scalable, observable solutions that solve real-world problems for our customers.

Because the role is cross-functional, the ability to communicate complex concepts in simple ways is essential. You will collaborate with product, design, front-end and infrastructure teams to bring delightful AI features to life.

Responsibilities:

As part of the AI team at Nexthink, you will:


Implement new AI features with high-quality coding standards and automated test coverage
Solve the engineering challenges behind data collection, retrieval, evaluation and inference at scale
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI components, ensuring safe, repeatable deployments
Instrument robust online/offline evaluation metrics and dashboards to monitor quality in production
Proactively propose new product capabilities or improvements based on user data and technology advances
Stay current with the rapidly evolving AI engineering ecosystem and share knowledge with the Nexthink community
Mentor junior engineers in best practices for shipping and operating AI features in production
Communicate effectively with (non-technical) stakeholders such as product managers and UX designers


Qualifications


BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
5+ years professional software-engineering experience, including shipping and operating cloud services in production
Experience in integrating with LLMs (e.g. Prompting, Evaluation, Observability)
Demonstrated success delivering AI-powered features that serve real users at scale (e.g., retrieval-augmented search, Generative AI assistants, predictive analytics)
Fluency in Python or at least one strongly-typed language (TypeScript or Java), with clean-code and testing discipline
Solid grasp of cloud-native architectures (AWS or comparable), containerisation (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes / ECS)
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics and quickly identify quality regressions
Product mindset and empathy for end-users; able to translate fuzzy product requirements into incremental engineering plans
Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English (spoken & written)


If you’re excited about pushing the boundaries of AI and mentoring the next generation of engineers, we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).
📍 Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.
🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.
🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.
🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.
🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.
🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

  • 💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).
  • 📍 Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.
  • 🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
  • 🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
  • 🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.
  • 🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.
  • 🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.
  • 🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.
  • 🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

Title: Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science)
Description:
CT_Technology & Innovation-E122

Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science) - Full Time - Winterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

Are you passionate about innovation and eager to make a real impact in the transition to a more sustainable future? As part of our dynamic R&D team within the Technology & Innovation organization, you’ll play a key role in developing cutting-edge solutions—from initial concept to commercialization. In this position, your focus will be on digitalization-driven research supporting breakthrough technologies such as recycling and carbon capture. This is your chance to contribute to sustainable innovation at the forefront of industrial transformation.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


Support data-driven technology development for chemical and process engineering projects.
Contribute to the design of experiments to enable targeted and efficient data collection.
Gather, structure, and manage experimental data from lab and pilot-scale units.
Analyze experimental data to identify trends, optimize process performance, and determine critical process parameters.
Help improve experimental design methodologies based on insights from data analysis.
Assist in the implementation of new analytical technologies informed by your findings.
Contribute to ongoing digitalization efforts by integrating data science techniques into experimental workflows.


To succeed in this role, you will need:


Currently pursuing or recently completed a Master or PhD degree in Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering, or a related field.
Solid understanding of reaction and separation processes.
Strong background in data science, including experience in visualizing and evaluating experimental data.
Proficient programming skills, preferably in Python.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office tools (e.g., Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
Strong ability to prioritize and coordinate tasks independently.
A proactive mindset with a willingness to learn and contribute original ideas.


What we offer you:


25 days holiday (exclusive of bank holidays) + service days
Defined contribution pension scheme
Employee Assistance Program/health care
On-site car parking/public transport allowance
Access to a wide range of discounts


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.

Do you have a question about the role?

Reach out to Alexi Donadoni at Alexi.Donadoni@sulzer.com . Our team is looking forward hearing from you!

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2025 in Brazil, China, Finland, Germany, Ireland, Switzerland, South Africa, the UK and the USA.

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

Are you passionate about innovation and eager to make a real impact in the transition to a more sustainable future? This is your chance to contribute to sustainable innovation at the forefront of industrial transformation.

Title: Research Associate, Protein Expression
Company: Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering – BIIE
Description:
Research Associate

The Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering (BIIE) is a non-profit research institute focusing on developing translational solutions for treatment, prevention and diagnostics of diseases relevant in global child & adolescent health. We are looking for a Research Associate to support the design, development, and optimization of protein expression platforms to support our cutting-edge research in immune engineering.


Tasks


The key responsibilities of the Research Associate:





Implement high-throughput strategies for the expression and purification of recombinant proteins in various expression systems.


Operate and maintain laboratory equipment for fermentation, cell culture, protein purification, and analysis.


Screen expression conditions using small-scale expression studies to identify optimal conditions for large-scale protein production.


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality proteins for biochemical assays, structural studies, and therapeutic development.


Analyze and interpret experimental data, maintaining detailed records of experiments and outcomes.


Contribute to the development of new technologies and methodologies to improve (high-throughput) protein expression workflows.


Prepare technical reports, summaries, protocols, and quantitative analyses.


Present findings to team members and contribute to scientific discussions within the group.



Requirements


Core skills and experience expected from the Research Associate:





Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering, or related field.


Familiarity with molecular biology techniques, such as PCR, cloning, and vector construction.


Experience in recombinant protein expression and purification using a variety of expression systems (e.g., E. coli, yeast, insect, mammalian cells).


Familiarity with high-throughput techniques and automation tools for protein expression and purification.


Proficient in analytical techniques for protein characterization (e.g., SDS-PAGE, Western blot, HPLC).


Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.


Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.





In addition, these skills make you even more successful in this role:





Experience in a life science research environment.


Experience with Benchling for documenting laboratory results and storing data





About the Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering




The Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering (BIIE) is a newly founded non-profit research organization aiming to become a world leading research institute for the advanced study of immunological systems with a mission to develop translational solutions for the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease. The scientific foundation of the BIIE and the broader field of Immune Engineering is based on the intersection of three interdisciplinary subdomains: (i) systems immunology, (ii) synthetic immunology and (iii) computational immunology. The BIIE will serve as a hub for multidisciplinary science, by uniting people with diverse expertise in immunology, biomedicine, bioengineering, systems and synthetic biology, computational biology, artificial intelligence and machine learning. As part of the mission of BIIE to make a lasting impact, it will dedicate significant efforts in training early-stage researchers in this unique multidisciplinary environment, thus enabling them to become future leaders in Immune Engineering.

Show more

Title: Scientific Data Architect - Basel, Switzerland
Description:
Who We Are

TetraScience is the Scientific Data and AI Cloud company. We are catalyzing the Scientific AI revolution by designing and industrializing AI-native scientific data sets, which we bring to life in a growing suite of next gen lab data management solutions, scientific use cases, and AI-enabled outcomes.

TetraScience is the category leader in this vital new market, generating more revenue than all other companies in the aggregate. In the last year alone, the world's dominant players in compute, cloud, data, and AI infrastructure have converged on TetraScience as the de facto standard, entering into co-innovation and go-to-market partnerships: Latest News and Announcements | TetraScience Newsroom:

In connection with your candidacy, you will be asked to carefully review the Tetra Way letter, authored directly by Patrick Grady, our co-founder and CEO. This letter is designed to assist you in better understanding whether TetraScience is the right fit for you from a values and ethos perspective.

It is impossible to overstate the importance of this document and you are encouraged to take it literally and reflect on whether you are aligned with our unique approach to company and team building. If you join us, you will be expected to embody its contents each day.

Who You Are

You are a product-minded, outcome-obsessed driver of technical scientific solutions.

You a high velocity self-starter. You refuse to let uncertainty obstruct your path to designing and building solutions.

You roll up your sleeves, try things out, and get things done. You do not hesitate to prototype, demo, and build in order to accelerate delivery of products for your end users.

You thrive in environments where you can collaborate with scientists, product managers, and engineers to transform complex scientific data into actionable outcomes. Your ability to engage with scientists and business leaders alike makes you a key player in maximizing the value of scientific data.

With rich experience applying cutting edge data methodologies to the biopharma R&D domain, you bridge understanding between present-day pain points and generalizable solutions.

You are an insatiable learner, with a track record of deeply learning new tools, methods, and domains.

You fundamentally embody the principles of extreme ownership and have a demonstrated history of building extensible data models and applications for Biopharma end users to maximize value from their data via analysis and integration with AI/ML.

This role will require extreme self-discipline and determination as we forge a category that will fundamentally and forever change the life science industry.

What You Have Done


PhD with 7+ years / Masters with 10+ years of industry experience in life sciences with extensive domain knowledge in drug discovery (target ID through lead optimization), preclinical development, CMC (all drug modalities), or product quality testing
Proven track record of defining, designing, prototyping, and implementing productized AI/ML-driven use cases in cloud environments
Collaborated with cross-functional teams, including product managers, software engineers, and scientific stakeholders
Performed extensive exploratory data analysis and workflow optimization to enable scientific outcomes not previously possible
Engaged diverse audiences, from scientists to executive stakeholders using your excellent communication and storytelling abilities
Advised scientists in a consulting capacity to further research, development, and quality testing outcomes


Requirements

What You Will Do


You will be a critical team member in a unique partnership to industrialize Scientific AI. As such, you will engage directly with customers onsite 4-5 days per week in the Basel Region, building strong relationships, deeply understanding their scientific data challenges and requirements, and accelerating solutions
Design and implement extensible, reusable data models that efficiently capture and organize scientific data for scientific use cases, ensuring scalability and future adaptability
Translate scientific data workflows into robust solutions leveraging the Tetra Data Platform
Own, scope, prototype, and implement solutions including:
Data model design (tabular & JSON)
Python-based parser development
Lab software (e.g., ELN/LIMS) integration via APIs
Data visualization and app development in Python (using app frameworks like Streamlit and plotting tools like holoviews and Plotly)
Collaborate with Scientific Business Analysts (SBAs), customer scientists and applied AI engineers to develop and deploy models (ML, AI, mechanistic, statistical, hybrid)
Programmatically interrogating proprietary instrument output files
Dynamically iterate with scientific end users and technical stakeholders to rapidly drive solution development and adoption through regular demos and meetings
Proactively communicate implementation progress and deliver demos to customer stakeholders
Collaborate with the product team to build and prioritize our roadmap by understanding customers' pain points within and outside Tetra Data Platform
Rapidly learn new technologies (e.g., new AWS services or scientific analysis applications) to develop and troubleshoot use cases


Benefits


Competitive Salary and equity in a fast-growing company
Supportive, team-oriented culture of continuous improvement
Generous paid time off (PTO)
Flexible working arrangements - Remote work when not at Customer Sites


We are not currently providing visa sponsorship for this position.
Show more

  • Competitive Salary and equity in a fast-growing company

Title: Bioprocess Engineer
Description:
For more than 19 years, through our consulting and engineering activities, we have supported our clients throughout the entire lifecycle of biotechnology, pharmaceutical and device products.

Part of an organization of more than 750 Life-science experts, Consultys Switzerland supports and develops talented individuals recognized for their technical and scientific expertise. Our activities allow us to be present in both French-speaking and German speaking Switzerland, with agencies in Lausanne and Basel.

At Consultys, we're proving that it's possible to combine people and performance.

Much more than concepts, our 3 values "Respect, Recognition and Transparency" guide us and are the foundation of our history, the heart of our group's success.




As part of our development, we are recruiting a Bioprocess Engineer to join our teams.




Job description:

As Senior Bioprocess Engineer, you will manage operational activities in Upstream and Downstream or BioConjugates manufacturing, e.g. tech transfer support, material planning, document and batch record preparation, training and troubleshooting, deviation handling
As your key entry role is focusing on the role out of new SAP functionality, a strong expertise in Change Management documentation as well as thorough updates of manufacturing documentation (e.g. SOPs, batch records) is key
In this role, you will act as a functional lead for an interdisciplinary team of production personnel, supervisors and specialists and be accountable for the successful roll-out of new initiatives, i.e. performance and results of assigned projects
Establish training documentation for manufacturing personnel, plant logistics and (as needed) other manufacturing related areas
Guide and support activities for clinical and/or commercial manufacturing in one or more defined DSP areas, e.g. capture, intermediate purification, polishing or drug substance filling
Ensure implementation of procedures which enable efficient operation of single-use and/or stainless steel equipment for the purification of therapeutic proteins from either microbial or mammalian expression systems or for the manufacturing of therapeutic BioConjugates




Your profile:

Bachelor, Master’s Degree or PhD in Biotechnology, Bio-chemical Engineering, Biochemistry or related Life Science subject
Significant work experience in Downstream Processing or BioConjugates Manufacturing in the biotech/biopharma industry e.g. chromatography, ultra-/diafiltration and dead-end filtration
Very good GMP understanding
Strong experience in SAP, aspects of material management (BOM)
Profound knowledge of logistics workstreams within production
Profound knowledge as End-User of MES
Excellent communication skills in English and German
Strong team orientation
Structured, well-organized working attitude and solution-oriented working style
Open-minded for new ideas and suggestions




Do you want to join the consulting world in a human-sized company that values the individual and performance?

To invest in long-term innovative projects?

To share your skills within a cohesive team where experiences are freely shared?

Then join us!

CONSULTYS is open to all talents and is committed to diversity and inclusion.

Title: Junior R&D Engineer
HTML:
Manpower

Fondata nel 1948 a Milwaukee, Wisconsin, USA, Manpower è una società internazionale leader nel settore delle risorse umane. Presente a livello mondiale in 75 paesi con oltre 3'000 filiali risponde ai bisogni dei suoi 400'000 clienti.

Specialisti nel reclutamento e nella selezione di personale fisso e temporaneo in diversi settori dell'economia, siamo presenti in Svizzera da oltre 60 anni con più di 300 collaboratori in più di 40 filiali.

Nell'ottica di rafforzamento della propria struttura il nostro cliente, ci ha incaricato di selezionare il seguente profilo professionale:

https://www.manpower.ch/fr/job/mendrisio/junior-r-d-engineer/616336

MISSIONE

Inserimento nel team R&D - Automation Projects, con il compito di supportare attività tecniche e progettuali legate a ricerca, test sperimentali, analisi materiali e gestione operativa di progetti, in collaborazione con altri reparti e sotto la guida di figure senior.

ATTIVITÀ PRINCIPALI

  • Prove tecnico-sperimentali
  • Esecuzione di test su impianti, materiali, componenti o prototipi;
  • Preparazione attrezzature e strumenti di prova;
  • Analisi e report dei dati sperimentali;
  • Supporto nell'individuazione di non conformità e nel miglioramento tecnico.
  • Progettazione e sviluppo
  • Supporto allo sviluppo di prodotto/processo con uffici tecnici e automazione;
  • Redazione di documentazione tecnica (disegni, specifiche, report, verbali).
  • Gestione progetti
  • Collaborazione alla pianificazione e monitoraggio dei progetti;
  • Aggiornamento documentazione e reportistica;
  • Partecipazione a meeting tecnici con team interni ed esterni.

REQUISITI

Formazione ed esperienza

  • Laurea magistrale in Ingegneria Meccanica, dei Materiali o affini;
  • Esperienza in ambito industriale o manifatturiero nella gestione progetti;
  • Ottimo inglese scritto e parlato (altre lingue costituiscono un plus);
  • Cittadinanza svizzera o UE.

Competenze

  • Conoscenze base di metallurgia, meccanica dei materiali e tecnologie produttive;
  • Capacità di leggere disegni tecnici e usare strumenti di misura;
  • Familiarità con prove meccaniche (trazione, durezza, resilienza);
  • Uso base di CAD 3D;
  • Buone doti organizzative, analitiche e attenzione al dettaglio;
  • Spirito di squadra, autonomia, iniziativa e attitudine al problem solving;
  • Elevata integrità e condotta etica;
  • Collaborazione trasversale tra team e reparti.

SE RITIENE DI POSSEDERE TUTTI I REQUISITI RICHIESTI, NON ESITI AD ISCRIVERSI E A CANDIDARSI SUL NOSTRO SITO UFFICIALE: WWW.MANPOWER.CH, ALLEGANDO IL SUO CURRICULUM VITAE.

Branche: Uhrenherstellung und Luxusartikeln

Funktion: Forschung und Entwicklung

Karrierestufe: Angestellte/r

Title: Research Associate (m/f/d
Description:
Work Selection AG

We are looking for a motivated and committed Research Associate Mass Spectrometry (m/f/d) for our client, F. Hoffmann-La Roche Ltd. based in Basel, for a 9 month assignment with the option to extend.

In Roche's Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients to tackle some of the world's toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicine. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

This position is located in Lead Discovery, a department within Small Molecule Research which is part of the Therapeutic Modalities function, where the discovery of chemical starting points for further optimization in medicinal chemistry is our primary focus. We closely collaborate with our therapeutic areas and functions to convert hypotheses into innovative therapeutics.

The MS team within the Lead Discovery department is using a wide range of mass spectrometry based approaches for high throughput screening for hit finding, profiling of lead compounds and discovering drug candidate target interaction using cell free assays, cellular systems and tissue samples. This lab based position will primarily focus on deciphering drug candidate target interaction by quantifying endogenous metabolites, lipids, and characterizing protein modification in cellular systems and tissue.

Tasks & Responsibilities


In this lab based role, you will implement, optimize and use LC-MS workflows for metabolites, lipids and proteins, including sample preparation, measurement, data analysis and reporting
You will prepare and analyze samples from cell culture and tissue using mass spectrometry
You present and discuss your data and findings with colleagues
You work collaboratively with your colleagues to contribute to general laboratory operations within the MS team, including instrument maintenance, and troubleshooting


Must Haves


You completed an apprenticeship, or possess a BS or MS degree in a relevant field
Min 3 years. experience in the pharmaceutical or life science field
You have hands-on experience with LC and MS equipment like Triple Quadrupole and/or ToF type instruments, including method development, routine analysis and troubleshooting of instrumentation
You bring experience with sample preparation techniques such as homogenization of tissue and cells, extraction or related approaches
Fluent in written and verbal English


Benefits


Enjoy exclusive discounts all year round at renowned retailers and over 200 top brands
Benefit from fleet discounts when purchasing a new car or receive consistent fuel discounts with our fuel card
Be part of one of the most prestigious pharmaceutical companies and actively shape the future of healthcare
Work on a state-of-the-art campus with green spaces, social areas, and an inspiring atmosphere
Take advantage of attractive fitness and swimming pool offers or use the gaming room as a creative retreat


Have we sparked your interest?

Don't hesitate and submit your complete application documents online today.

We look forward to hearing from you!

HTML:
Work Selection AG

We are looking for a motivated and committed Research Associate Mass Spectrometry (m/f/d) for our client, F. Hoffmann-La Roche Ltd. based in Basel, for a 9 month assignment with the option to extend.

In Roche's Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients to tackle some of the world's toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicine. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

This position is located in Lead Discovery, a department within Small Molecule Research which is part of the Therapeutic Modalities function, where the discovery of chemical starting points for further optimization in medicinal chemistry is our primary focus. We closely collaborate with our therapeutic areas and functions to convert hypotheses into innovative therapeutics.

The MS team within the Lead Discovery department is using a wide range of mass spectrometry based approaches for high throughput screening for hit finding, profiling of lead compounds and discovering drug candidate target interaction using cell free assays, cellular systems and tissue samples. This lab based position will primarily focus on deciphering drug candidate target interaction by quantifying endogenous metabolites, lipids, and characterizing protein modification in cellular systems and tissue.

Tasks & Responsibilities

  • In this lab based role, you will implement, optimize and use LC-MS workflows for metabolites, lipids and proteins, including sample preparation, measurement, data analysis and reporting
  • You will prepare and analyze samples from cell culture and tissue using mass spectrometry
  • You present and discuss your data and findings with colleagues
  • You work collaboratively with your colleagues to contribute to general laboratory operations within the MS team, including instrument maintenance, and troubleshooting

Must Haves

  • You completed an apprenticeship, or possess a BS or MS degree in a relevant field
  • Min 3 years. experience in the pharmaceutical or life science field
  • You have hands-on experience with LC and MS equipment like Triple Quadrupole and/or ToF type instruments, including method development, routine analysis and troubleshooting of instrumentation
  • You bring experience with sample preparation techniques such as homogenization of tissue and cells, extraction or related approaches
  • Fluent in written and verbal English

Benefits

  • Enjoy exclusive discounts all year round at renowned retailers and over 200 top brands
  • Benefit from fleet discounts when purchasing a new car or receive consistent fuel discounts with our fuel card
  • Be part of one of the most prestigious pharmaceutical companies and actively shape the future of healthcare
  • Work on a state-of-the-art campus with green spaces, social areas, and an inspiring atmosphere
  • Take advantage of attractive fitness and swimming pool offers or use the gaming room as a creative retreat

Have we sparked your interest?

Don't hesitate and submit your complete application documents online today.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Algorithm Developer Intern
Description:
Are you ready to dive into the world of genomics and data science? At SOPHiA GENETICS, we’re offering an exciting opportunity for a Algorithm Developer Intern to join our team and help explore how gene conversion events and copy number variations (CNVs) can be detected in complex pseudogenic regions using Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS).

Over 30% of staff at SOPHiA GENETICs hold PhDs. You will be joining a small team of experts specializing in the research and development of cutting-edge software solutions for analyzing copy number variation (CNV) data derived from next-generation sequencing (NGS) technologies. CNVs affect susceptibility to cancer by regulating gene expression and play a crucial role in tumor suppressor genes. Over the years, the CNV team has released leading algorithms for CNV detection, gene conversion and star allele analysis. By joining us, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to the research and development of state-of-the-art tools at the cutting edge of the field, with impact on research and clinical applications worldwide.

You will be involved in:


NGS data exploration to gain initial insights, for example through testing the analytical performance of a pre-existing WGS algorithm.
Technical analysis, e.g. through statistical models, to evaluate how analytical performance may be improved.
Evaluation of the technical feasibility, e.g. by developing prototype algorithms, of such improvements.
Critical evaluation and management of the day-to-day running of the project.
Presentation of results to members of the team/department/senior management.


Requirements


PhD or Masters degree in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Computational Biology, Data Science)
Excellent analytical and algorithmic skills.
Excellent understanding of statistical methods.
Some understanding/experience in manipulating NGS data (bam file or coverage) would be a plus.
Proficient in Python. Proficiency in another language (e.g. R) would be a plus.
Fluent English (spoken and written).
Independence and experience in driving research projects.
Good team-work and collaboration skills.
Good communication and presentation skills.


Benefits

What will you learn:


How to work with real-world NGS data, including BAM files and coverage analysis.
Data exploration, statistical modeling, and visualization techniques.
How to contribute to scientific innovation in a matrix organization.
Best practices for communicating complex results to technical and non-technical audiences.


All SOPHiA GENETICS internships & apprenticeships are paid as per each country's best practices and degree level.

Location: Rolle, Switzerland

Start: September 2025 (duration 6 months)

Contract type: Internship contract, 80-100%

Application process

Apply now with your CV and any supporting information.

Suitably qualified candidates will be invited through an interview and screening process where you will speak with member of our Talent Management Team, the hiring leader, alongside key colleagues.

All resumes should be in English for a successful review!

SOPHiA GENETICS:

We believe there is a smarter, more data-driven way to make decisions in healthcare and our AI SaaS Platform enables that. You will have direct input into our mission to radically improve the outcomes for Cancer & Rare Disease patients globally. Enable our customers to push industry boundaries, as we pioneer into newly discovered fields and combine complex, multi-modal data for the first time!

For more information, visit our website: https://www.sophiagenetics.com.
Show more

Title: Patrouilleur 100% (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir suchen ab der Wintersaison 2025/2026 für eine unbefristete Anstellung eine/n:

Patrouilleur 100% (m/w/d)

Der Titlis ist ein Ort, an dem Pioniergeist und Entschlossenheit aufeinandertreffen. Mit rund 450 Mitarbeitenden aus über 45 Nationen, die in einer Vielzahl von Berufsfeldern arbeiten, gestalten wir jeden Tag aufs Neue aufregende und bewegende Erlebnisse. Als #TheTeamToBe verkörpern wir die Leidenschaft, abseits der ausgetretenen Pfade zu gehen und die Zukunft mutig zu gestalten. Unsere Vielfalt und unser gemeinsames Streben nach Höchstleistung machen das Arbeiten bei den Titlis Bergbahnen zu einer aussergewöhnlichen und inspirierenden Erfahrung. Ski- und Snowboard-Fans aus aller Welt erleben hier unbeschwerten Winterspass. Wir verwöhnen unsere Gäste mit Herzlichkeit und perfektem Service. Neben den Titlis Bergbahnen führen wir zwei Hotels und mehrere Restaurants im Skigebiet und in Engelberg.

Teile deine Leidenschaft für unsere einzigartigen Attraktionen und Dienstleistungen mit uns und werde Teil unseres Teams.

Deine Aufgaben


Medizinische Erstversorgung von verunfallten Personen
Spreng- und Sicherungsarbeiten
Instandstellung der Pistenmarkierungen und Absperrungen
Unterhaltsarbeiten Gletscher
Aushilfe in anderen Teams


Das bringst du mit


Zentralkurs A/B sowie Lawinensprengausweis wünschenswert, oder Bereitschaft, diese zu absolvieren
Handwerkliche Begabung
Führerausweis B von Vorteil
Teamgeist und Servicebereitschaft im Umgang mit unseren Gäste
Sprachgewandtheit in Deutsch und Englisch, weitere Sprachen von Vorteil
Verantwortungsbewusst, belastbar und flexibel
Bereitschaft für Einsätze am Wochenende und in der Nacht


Davon profitierst du


Ein interessantes und vielfältiges Arbeitsumfeld in einer beliebten Tourismusdestination in der Zentralschweiz
Ein aufgestelltes und kollegiales Team
Attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen mit interessanten Mitarbeitervergünstigungen
Betriebliche und ausserbetriebliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten


Bist du bereit, gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft zu gestalten?

Dann bewirb dich gerne auch, wenn du das Anforderungsprofil nicht vollständig erfüllst. Dein Potenzial für diese Position können wir in einem gemeinsamen Gespräch erörtern.

Wir freuen uns auf dich.

Bewerben

Titlis Bergbahnen

Stefan Hallenbarter

Leiter Pisten- und Rettungsdienst

Gerschnistrasse 14

6391 Engelberg

Schweiz

+41 41 639 50 50

shallenbarter@titlis.ch

www.titlis.ch

Drucken Weiterleiten
