Title: Clinical Research Associate (m/w/d)
Description:
The Clinical Research Associate will design, plan, coordinate, and conduct all activities involved in initiating, monitoring, and completing clinical research studies for in vitro diagnostics.




The perfect candidate has a degree in Medical technology with first professional experiences in clinical research or laboratory research.




General Information:

• Start date: asap, latest Start Date: 01.10.2025

• Planned duration: 1 year, extension is likely

• Remote/Home Office: 2-3 on-site

• Travel: 25-30% within Europe




Tasks & Responsibilities:

Ensuring studies are conducted and documented in accordance with the study protocol, standard operating procedures, good clinical practices and other applicable regulatory requirements
Validating product performance claims
Supplying data for critical Regulatory submissions
Defining the functional and clinical utility of investigational products
Obtaining opinions and input regarding investigational products from laboratories or customers, who may be considered key opinion leaders
The CRA is responsible for adhering to the policies of the quality system and achieving quality objectives through daily actions
Performing or coordinating aspects of clinical studies including site selection, study initiation, site monitoring, and study closeout
Maintaining communication with study investigators to ensure studies are completed in a timely fashion and ensuring that study objectives are met
Interfacing with cross functional staff to support post launch activities
Reviewing cases with investigators to resolve discrepancies
Ensuring that studies adhere to FDA regulations, Good Clinical Practices, IVD directives, and company policies and procedures




Qualifications and experience:

Bachelor’s degree (Masters and PhD also ok) in science or relevant field, Medical technology degree preferred, but not required if R&D background is adequate
Experience in clinical research or laboratory research
Min. 2 years of prior relevant experience
Experience in Pathology
Basic knowledge of, and skill in applying, applicable clinical research regulatory requirements GCP and ICH guidelines
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English
Medical laboratory experience
Good therapeutic and protocol knowledge
Computer skills including proficiency in use of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint and use of a laptop computer and iPhone and iPad
Effective time and financial management skills
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers, and clients

Deadline for submittals: 18/07

Title: Engagement Director, EMEA
Description:
Who We Are

TetraScience is the Scientific Data and AI Cloud company. We are catalyzing the Scientific AI revolution by designing and industrializing AI-native scientific data sets, which we bring to life in a growing suite of next-gen lab data management solutions, scientific use cases, and AI-enabled outcomes.

TetraScience is the category leader in this vital new market, generating more revenue than all other companies in the aggregate. In the last year alone, the world's dominant players in compute, cloud, data, and AI infrastructure have converged on TetraScience as the de facto standard, entering into co-innovation and go-to-market partnerships: Latest News and Announcements | TetraScience Newsroom

In connection with your candidacy, you will be asked to carefully review the Tetra Way letter, authored directly by Patrick Grady, our co-founder and CEO. This letter is designed to assist you in better understanding whether TetraScience's values and ethos are the right fit for you.

It is impossible to overstate the importance of this document and you are encouraged to take it literally and reflect on whether you are aligned with our unique approach to company and team building. If you join us, you will be expected to embody its contents daily.

Requirements

Who You Are

TetraScience is hiring an elite engagement leader for key accounts in EMEA. The Engagement Director role concurrently drives activities for renewal numbers and drives overall success of implementation delivery and value realization. There is also a parallel effort to closely collaborate with Account Executives and Pre-sales TAMs to identify and land expansion opportunities.

As we rapidly evolve our platform and open up new value creation paths with new SKUs and new personas, we require an uncompromising and results-driven engagement leader to help us deliver scientific and operational value as well as expand within our customer base.

You are a customer centric and see-around-the-corner individual with a passion for delivering value while navigating customer hierarchy within the high-inertia Life Sciences industry.

You will need to fundamentally embody the principles of extreme ownership and have a demonstrated history of building and leading high-performing delivery or engagement teams.

You will have demonstrable experience in managing critical activities of your delivery teams and proof of consistently delivering complex data solutions in challenging scenarios. You are a top-tier communicator and able to tell compelling stories in difficult situations. You will be a forward-deployed captain to ensure customer success no matter the obstacles or friction the team encounters.

For the avoidance of doubt, we remain in the category creation and evangelism phase and thus you are not coming in to follow a strict playbook or be a siloed people manager. It will require extreme self-discipline and determination as we forge a category that will fundamentally and forever change the life sciences industry.

What You Have Done


7+ years in delivery leadership roles within the Life Sciences software and data market with expertise in at least two of the following three areas: Discovery/Early-Stage Development, Late-Stage Development/CMC, Manufacturing/QC
3+ years in management consulting
Worked in startup environments
Led teams to successfully deploy solutions in the top 250 bio/pharma cohort (not biotech alone)
Delivered complex enterprise deals - $ hundreds of thousands to millions in ARR per deal
Expanded customer land deals - $ hundreds of thousands to millions in ACV
Evidenced strong program leadership skills while navigating difficult periods with your delivery team(s)
Delivered solutions within GxP-compliant areas
Coached and mentored Engagement, Project, Program and/or Customer Success Managers who went on to do their best work due to your assistance
Operated effectively in a fast-paced, team environment


What You Will Do


Execute a comprehensive delivery motion to drive faster time-to-value with high customer satisfaction and meet annual renewal targets
Lead key account delivery teams consisting of project managers, scientific data architects, scientific business analysts and data engineers, aligning on clear targets and objectives to ensure team success
Leverage and coordinate cross-functional teams, when necessary (Legal, Engineering, Marketing, Product), to efficiently coordinate complex implementations and product deployments
Collaborate with Sales leadership and Account Executives to pursue new business opportunities within existing accounts during implementation and in the absence of an active delivery motion
Gain a deep and broad understanding of TetraScience's Product, enabling you to evangelize and explain it to customer teams in a way each persona will comprehend
Work closely with product teams to bring customer enhancement requests to fruition and deliver more value and maintain customer awareness of relevant Product roadmap details
Stay up-to-date on industry trends and emerging technologies, positioning TetraScience as a thought leader in the market
Collaborate with Account Executives to create and execute account-specific plans in order to meet expansion goals and support the renewal strategy
Maintain ongoing relationships with existing customers, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and retention while expanding your network within the accounts
Manage renewal forecasts and account health providing regular updates to leadership on progress toward targets of your accounts
Lead by example and inspire your delivery teams to do the best work of their life
Employ analytical and EQ skills to generate insights from customers' data strategies and actions, respectively


Benefits


Competitive Salary and equity in a fast-growing company
Supportive, team-oriented culture of continuous improvement
Generous paid time off (PTO)
Flexible working arrangements - Remote work


We are not currently providing visa sponsorship for this position
Show more

  • Coached and mentored Engagement, Project, Program and/or Customer Success Managers who went on to do their best work due to your assistance
  • Operated effectively in a fast-paced, team environment

What You Will Do

  • Execute a comprehensive delivery motion to drive faster time-to-value with high customer satisfaction and meet annual renewal targets
  • Lead key account delivery teams consisting of project managers, scientific data architects, scientific business analysts and data engineers, aligning on clear targets and objectives to ensure team success
  • Leverage and coordinate cross-functional teams, when necessary (Legal, Engineering, Marketing, Product), to efficiently coordinate complex implementations and product deployments
  • Collaborate with Sales leadership and Account Executives to pursue new business opportunities within existing accounts during implementation and in the absence of an active delivery motion
  • Gain a deep and broad understanding of TetraScience's Product, enabling you to evangelize and explain it to customer teams in a way each persona will comprehend
  • Work closely with product teams to bring customer enhancement requests to fruition and deliver more value and maintain customer awareness of relevant Product roadmap details
  • Stay up-to-date on industry trends and emerging technologies, positioning TetraScience as a thought leader in the market
  • Collaborate with Account Executives to create and execute account-specific plans in order to meet expansion goals and support the renewal strategy
  • Maintain ongoing relationships with existing customers, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and retention while expanding your network within the accounts
  • Manage renewal forecasts and account health providing regular updates to leadership on progress toward targets of your accounts
  • Lead by example and inspire your delivery teams to do the best work of their life
  • Employ analytical and EQ skills to generate insights from customers' data strategies and actions, respectively

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary and equity in a fast-growing company
  • Supportive, team-oriented culture of continuous improvement
  • Generous paid time off (PTO)
  • Flexible working arrangements - Remote work

We are not currently providing visa sponsorship for this position

Une équipe dynamique, motivée et en pleine croissance

Title: Buchhändler*in 60% (a)
Description:
Sehen Sie sich als Botschafter*in des Lesens?

Mit Ihrer Leidenschaft sind Sie bei uns genau richtig. Bei der Orell Füssli Thalia AG schaffen wir Räume für vielfältige Geschichten und Wissen, die unsere Gesellschaft inspirieren und bereichern. Ausserdem ist Orell Füssli ein Ort, an dem sich die Mitarbeitenden wohl fühlen, an dem man gerne und gut zusammenarbeitet sowie gemeinsam mehr erreicht. Für die Reiseabteilung unsere Filiale Kramhof in Zürich suchen wir per 1. September 2025 eine*n

Ihre Hauptaufgaben


Lots*in in der Welt von Geschichten und Wissen
Kompetente und inspirierende Beratung unserer Kundschaft
Lagerbewirtschaftung und Bestellwesen (bestellen, remittieren, recherchieren)
Markt- und Trendbeobachtung
Präsentation von Büchern und Non-Books


Ihr Profil


Abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Buchhändler*in mit fundierter Berufserfahrung
Affinität zum Buch sowie zu den elektronischen Medien
Kunden- und verkaufsorientierte Persönlichkeit mit Erfahrung im Kundenkontakt
Interesse am aktuellen Zeitgeschehen
Stilsicheres Deutsch und gute Englischkenntnisse


Unser Angebot


Kollaborative und wertschätzende Unternehmenskultur
Zentraler Arbeitsort mit guten ÖV-Anbindungen
Der aktuellen Lebenssituation angepasste Arbeitszeitmodelle
Grosszügige Ferienregelung und vielseitiges Rabattangebot
Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Filial- und bereichsübergreifende Entwicklungsoptionen
Show more

Title: Senior AI Inference Engineer (100% Remote)
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:

Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About the job:

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

Responsibilities:


Work on deploying machine learning models to edge devices using frameworks such as Llama.cpp, ONNX, TVM, MLC LLM, and IREE (MLIR).
Collaborate closely with researchers to assist in coding, training and transitioning models from research to production environments.
Integrate AI features into existing products, enriching them with the latest advancements in machine learning.
Excellent programming skills in Python, and a solid understanding of C/C++.
Experience with platforms such as Llama.cpp, ONNX, TVM, MLC LLM, and IREE (MLIR), which facilitate the deployment of models to specific GPU architectures.
Experience in NLP, transformers, fine-tuning, computer vision, TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Experience working with LLMs, fine tuning, RAG, transformers is a plus.
Demonstrated ability to rapidly assimilate new technologies and techniques.
A degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D.
Show more

Title: Team Leader Performance Optimization
Description:
Join the Audi F1 Project - Shape the Future of Motorsport!

Welcome to the Audi F1 Project.

Audi will be competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship from 2026.

The new team has three locations. Audi's Motorsport Competence Center in Neuburg (Germany) is considered one of the most modern of its kind in Europe. The Sauber Group's Formula 1 factory in Hinwil (Switzerland) is known for its innovative technologies and passion for racing. The Sauber Motorsport Technical Center, UK will be operational this year. Our Power Unit comes from Neuburg, while Hinwil is responsible for the development of the chassis and race operations.

What you need? The mindset of an athlete. If you are someone for whom giving up isn’t an option and limits are just something to be overcome, you can bring Vorsprung durch Technik to Formula 1 with us. Become part of this unique project and make motorsport history. Become part of this unique project and make motorsport history.

This position for the Audi F1 Project is at Sauber in Hinwil (Switzerland).

Your mission


Responsible for the quality and the development of the pre-event simulations and methodologies
Remote garage support during the events
Responsible for the in-event and post-event analysis
Coordination of the in-event correlation of the offline simulation
Continuous improvement oaf the predictive and analysis tools


Your profile


Master’s degree or PHD in mechanical or automotive engineering or applied mathematics
5 years’ experience in a relevant field (Vehicle Science / Vehicle Performance / Vehicle Dynamics / DiL Simulator)
Extensive understanding of vehicle dynamics
Experience in Matlab is required, advanced level will be advantageous
Accustomed to a conscientious working style under time pressure
Resilient as well as stress tolerant (flexibility of working hours)
Proficiency in English language skills. German language skills will be an advantage
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (3-month internship)
Description:
Job Description

Purpose of the position:

Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities

Position Functions


Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)
Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Connect & Align with Marketing
Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe (20%)
Competitor Set Mapping
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition
Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics 20%)
Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics


Knowledge And Skills Required


Bachelor Degree
Good Excel / Microsoft Office Skills
Power BI knowledge is a plus
English fluent mandatory
Ability to connect with cross functional teams


#PanEurope

About Us

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we’ve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.

The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.

Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we’re grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.
Show more

Title: Senior Bioprocess Engineer
Description:
Step into a pivotal role at a global CMO and help shape the future of healthcare manufacturing.

Proclinical is seeking a Senior Bioprocess Engineer to focus on operational readiness, process improvement, and the roll-out of new initiatives within microbial, bio-conjugates, or mammalian manufacturing. The successful candidate will play a key role in driving change management, assisting with tech transfers, and ensuring efficient production processes. This is an exciting opportunity for professionals passionate about innovation and collaboration in biopharmaceutical manufacturing.

Please note that to be considered for this role you must have the right to work in this location or hold an EU passport.

Responsibilities:

Oversee operational activities in upstream, downstream, or bio-conjugates manufacturing, material planning, document preparation, training, troubleshooting, and deviation handling.
Lead the roll-out of new SAP functionalities, ensuring thorough updates to manufacturing documentation such as SOPs and batch records.
Act as a functional lead for interdisciplinary teams, ensuring successful project execution and initiative roll-outs.
Develop and implement training documentation for manufacturing personnel, plant logistics, and other related areas.
Guide and assist clinical and/or commercial manufacturing activities in defined downstream processing (DSP) areas, such as capture, purification, polishing, or drug substance filling.
Ensure efficient operation of single-use or stainless-steel equipment for therapeutic protein purification or bio-conjugate manufacturing (e.g., Antibody Drug Conjugates).

Key Skills and Requirements:

Degree in Biotechnology, Biochemical Engineering, Biochemistry, or a related life science field.
Expertise in downstream processing or bio-conjugates manufacturing, including chromatography, ultrafiltration/diafiltration, and dead-end filtration.
Strong understanding of GMP regulations.
Proficiency in SAP, particularly in material management and BOM aspects.
Experience with MES systems as an end-user.
Proven ability to create and support training documentation.
Excellent communication skills in English and/or German.
Strong project management skills and a structured, solution-oriented working style.
Team-oriented mindset with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments.


If you are having difficulty in applying or if you have any questions, please contact Ashley Bennett at a.bennett@proclinical.com.

If you are interested in applying to this exciting opportunity, then please click 'Apply' or to speak to one of our specialists please request a call back at the top of this page.

Proclinical is a leading life sciences recruiter focused on finding exceptional people and matching them with the finest positions across the globe. Proclinical is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

By submitting this application, you confirm that you've read and understood our privacy policy, which informs you how we process and safeguard your data - https://www.proclinical.com/privacy-policy.

Show more

  • Proven ability to create and support training documentation.
  • Excellent communication skills in English and/or German.
  • Strong project management skills and a structured, solution-oriented working style.
  • Team-oriented mindset with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments.

If you are having difficulty in applying or if you have any questions, please contact Ashley Bennett at a.bennett@proclinical.com.

If you are interested in applying to this exciting opportunity, then please click 'Apply' or to speak to one of our specialists please request a call back at the top of this page.

Proclinical is a leading life sciences recruiter focused on finding exceptional people and matching them with the finest positions across the globe. Proclinical is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

By submitting this application, you confirm that you've read and understood our privacy policy, which informs you how we process and safeguard your data - https://www.proclinical.com/privacy-policy.

Title: Višji svetovalec v Sektorju za izvajalce zdravstvene dejavnosti
Description:
Opis delovnega mesta

Z izbranim kandidatom bo sklenjeno delovno razmerje za nedoločen čas s polnim delovnim časom.

Izbrani kandidat bo delo na delovnem mestu višji svetovalec opravljal v nazivu višji svetovalec III, z možnostjo napredovanja v višji naziv višji svetovalec II in višji svetovalec I.

Izhodiščni plačni razred predmetnega delovnega mesta je v skladu z določbami Zakona o skupnih temeljih sistema plač v javnem sektorju (Uradni list RS, št. 95/24) 22.

Izbrani kandidat bo delo opravljal v prostorih Ministrstva za zdravje na lokaciji Ulica Ambrožiča Novljana 7, Ljubljana oz. v njegovih uradnih prostorih.

Zahteve za prijavo

Kandidati, ki se bodo prijavili na prosto delovno mesto, morajo izpolnjevati naslednje pogoje:


končano najmanj visokošolsko strokovno izobraževanje (prva bolonjska stopnja)/visokošolska strokovna izobrazba (prva bolonjska stopnja) oziroma najmanj visokošolsko univerzitetno izobraževanje (prva bolonjska stopnja)/visokošolska univerzitetna izobrazba (prva bolonjska stopnja), smer: PRAVO;
najmanj 4 leta delovnih izkušenj;
opravljeno obvezno usposabljanje za imenovanje v naziv;
opravljen strokovni izpit iz upravnega postopka druge stopnje;
znanje uradnega jezika;
državljanstvo Republike Slovenije;
ne smejo biti pravnomočno obsojeni zaradi naklepnega kaznivega dejanja, ki se preganja po uradni dolžnosti, in ne smejo biti obsojeni na nepogojno kazen zapora v trajanju več kot šest mesecev;
zoper njih ne sme biti vložena pravnomočna obtožnica zaradi naklepnega kaznivega dejanja, ki se preganja po uradni dolžnosti.


Zahtevane delovne izkušnje se skrajšajo za tretjino v primeru, da ima kandidat univerzitetno izobrazbo (prejšnjo) ali magistrsko izobrazbo (druga bolonjska stopnja).

Pri izbranem kandidatu se bo preverjalo, ali ima opravljeno obvezno usposabljanje za imenovanje v naziv, v nasprotnem primeru bo moral izbrani kandidat najpozneje v enem letu od sklenitve pogodbe o zaposlitvi opraviti usposabljanje, predpisano v skladu z 89. členom Zakona o javnih uslužbencih.

Pri izbranem kandidatu se bo preverjalo ali ima opravljen strokovni izpit iz upravnega postopka druge stopnje. V nasprotnem primeru bo moral izbrani kandidat strokovni izpit iz upravnega postopka druge stopnje opraviti najkasneje v treh mesecih od sklenitve delovnega razmerja v skladu z 31. členom Zakona o splošnem upravnem postopku.

Izbrani kandidat bo moral pred sklenitvijo pogodbe o zaposliti opraviti osnovno usposabljanje s področja varovanja tajnih podatkov.

Delovne naloge

Delovno Področje


organiziranje medsebojnega sodelovanja in usklajevanja notranjih organizacijskih enot in sodelovanja z drugimi organi;
sodelovanje pri oblikovanju sistemskih rešitev in drugih najzahtevnejših gradiv;
samostojna priprava zahtevnih analiz, razvojnih projektov, informacij, poročil in drugih zahtevnih gradiv;
samostojno opravljanje drugih zahtevnejših nalog;
vodenje najzahtevnejših upravnih postopkov.


Prednosti pri izbiri

Prednost Pri Izbiri Bodo Imeli Kandidati


s poznavanjem ureditve zdravstvene dejavnosti v Republiki Sloveniji;
z delovnimi izkušnjami s področja upravnih postopkov;
z delovnimi izkušnjami nudenja pomoči pri pripravi pravnih aktov.


Postopek prijave

OBRAZEC ZA PRIJAVO JE OBVEZNA SESTAVINA PRIJAVNE VLOGE POSAMEZNEGA KANDIDATA.

Kandidati pošljejo pisne prijave s prilogami v zaprti ovojnici z označbo: "za javni natečaj – št. objave: 110-65/2025-2711", na naslov: Ministrstvo za zdravje, Kadrovska služba, Štefanova ulica 5, Ljubljana, in sicer v roku 15 dni po objavi na osrednjem spletnem mestu državne uprave GOV.SI in na Zavodu RS za zaposlovanje. Za pisno obliko prijave se šteje tudi elektronska oblika, poslana na elektronski naslov: gp.mz@gov.si, pri čemer veljavnost prijave ni pogojena z elektronskim podpisom.

Kontaktna oseba za dodatne informacije


Lidija Pevec Arsov


Kontaktna oseba za dodatne informacije o izvedbi javnega natečaja (vsak delovnik med 9. in 11. uro)


01 478 60 56
lidija.pevec-arsov@gov.si


Besedilo in prijavni obrazec


Besedilo javnega natečaja in prijavni obrazec
besedilo visji svetovalec v Sektorju za izvajalce zdravstvene dejavnosti DM 4413 (doc, 82 KB)
obrazec visji svetovalec v Sektorju za izvajalce zdravstvene dejavnosti DM 4413 (docx, 36 KB)

Title: Senior AI Engineer– VLAs (Vision-Language Action) & Dexterous Manipulation
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Engineer/Scientist to join a cutting-edge robotics team in Zurich, focused on humanoid manipulation through state-of-the-art AI. You will contribute to developing and deploying learning-based controllers to enable robots to interact intelligently, reliably, and flexibly with complex environments.
This role is deeply hands-on with real robot hardware, leveraging your expertise across vision-language-action (VLA) models, diffusion models, reinforcement learning, and dexterous manipulation.

What we’re looking for:
PhD or Master's in Robotics, AI, or related fields
Strong expertise in learning-based dexterous manipulation (multi-fingered grasping, task-oriented manipulation)
Practical experience with running real-time controllers on robotic hardware
Deep knowledge of diffusion models, transformers, CVAEs, normalizing flows
Experience working with ROS, PyTorch, and Python
Familiarity with vision-language models (VLA/VLMs/LLMs) for robotic planning or failure detection
Bonus: experience with synthetic data generation, simulation environments, teleoperation systems
Why this role?
Join a high-calibre team (ex-ETH / ex-NVIDIA founders) backed by significant investment (Seed + Series A secured)
Work at the intersection of simulation, reinforcement learning, and robotics hardware
Contribute to next-generation humanoid robots without reliance on traditional imitation learning paradigms
If you’re passionate about building more intelligent robots through cutting-edge AI and want to work in a fast-moving, well-resourced environment, we’d love to hear from you.
Show more

If you’re passionate about building more intelligent robots through cutting-edge AI and want to work in a fast-moving, well-resourced environment, we’d love to hear from you.

Title: Biotech Manufacturing Engineer – Fermentation & Automation
Description:
Biotech Manufacturing Lead – Fermentation & Automation




Duration: Approx. 7 Months (extension is possible)
Workload: 41 hours/ week - (100% workload)
Remote work: NOT possible




Key Accountabilities and Duties:




Oversees, plans and supports execution of manufacturing campaigns in the area of microbial fermentation
Responsible to prepare and execute SHE, EM, operation and cleaning risk analysis for the assigned products and the implementation and control of defined measures.
Responsible to establish timely and with high quality the required production documentation (preparation and review of electronic batch records) specific to the assigned production area.
Perform manufacturing activities according to cGMP guidelines, ensuring batch execution, evaluating test results, resolving issues, troubleshoot manufacturing equipment and make recommendations for resolution.
Reviews production documentation and works on deviations, change requests and implementation of CAPAs to ensure high-quality GMP standards.
Working as production expert in Capital investment projects for building and commissioning of the manufacturing units.
Responsible for delivering all input required for the specific set-up, commissioning and qualification of the manufacturing suites and equipment including automation.
Prepares changes and reviews DeltaV recipes for equipment and facility parts.
Coordinates and supports Engineering and workshops for campaign preparation and change-over activities in the facility.
Responsible for training of the operators for the manufacturing of the assigned products.




Qualifications & Skills:




Bachelor / Master Degree - preferably in Biotechnology, Biochemistry or related disciplines
Good biotechnology expertise and/or knowledge in biotechnical engineering preferable in the area of microbial fermentation
Fluent in English; German is a plus
Excellent GMP understanding
MES and DeltaV system knowledge is a very big plus
Good communication skills and interaction with all kinds of interfaces within the organization & strong team orientation
Structured, focused and well-organized working attitude; open-minded for new ideas and suggestions; high motivation and dynamic drive
Show more

  • Responsible to prepare and execute SHE, EM, operation and cleaning risk analysis for the assigned products and the implementation and control of defined measures.

Title: Laboratory Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
As a first-tier supplier to our renowned business partner, Roche Diagnostics in Rotkreuz, we are immediately seeking a motivated and dedicated Laboratory Scientist for a temporary assignment of one year with the possibility of extension

The Assay Development team is responsible for the development of molecular diagnostic and screening tests based on PCR technology in the areas of infectious diseases, genomics, and oncology, from early feasibility to commercial launch.

Tasks


Working with high throughput lab – analyzer
Routine lab work with infectious samples and leading of own experiments including the analysis of them
Plan and execute different work packages for the development of molecular diagnostics test
Participation in project meetings and presentation of experimental data
Precise documentation of experiments using electronic lab journals according to GMP Standards
Equipment handling and maintenance
Statistical data analysis using different software and tools (e.g. JMP)
Author official documents (e.g. Design History Files)


Must Haves


Graduate as Biomedical Analyst Scientist (BMA HF) or apprenticeship as Lab Technician (Biology, Medical Diagnostics, Chemistry) or at least Bachelor or Master degree in Life Sciences with practical experience from the Lab (no PhD graduates)
Ideally 2+ years of lab experience with data analyses and biostatistics
Very good and thorough documentation skills
English fluency written and orally is a must, German is a plus
Open-minded team player
Pro-active mindset and organized working style
Flexible, strategic thinking and self-dependent person


Nice to Haves


Lab experience from a biotechnical environment with infectious sample handling Biosafety Level 2 (*)
Experience in a GMP/GLP environment


Benefits


Work with modern and modern tools in an innovative working environment
Experience a work culture that promotes diversity and inclusion and in which all employees feel valued
Profit from financial support for your professional further training plans
Take advantage of unbeatable discounts at renowned retailers and over 200 top brands all year round
Profit from fleet discounts when purchasing new cars or receive constant discounts on fuel with our fuel card


Are you interested? Do not hesitate and submit your complete application documents online today. We look forward to hearing from you!

Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüssen daher alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Geschlecht, sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Alter und Identität. Zur leichteren Lesbarkeit und besseren Verständlichkeit verwenden wir nur eine Gender-Form. Selbstverständlich sind im jeweiligen Kontext alle Genderformen gleichermassen gemeint.

Title: Livreur (Locarno)
Description:
Smood SA recherche ses prochain(e)s collaborateur(rice)s pour des postes de :

Livreur pour la ville de Locarno

En collaboration directe avec le Manager local, votre mission sera d'assurer la livraison de repas et de courses, commandés par nos clients.

Requirements

Indispensable pour ce poste :


Permis de conduire (Voiture/Scooter)
Véhiculé(e) avec une plaque d'immatriculation suisse (Voiture/Scooter) ou vélo
Pas de casier judiciaire
Aisance avec les outils de communication modernes
Une personne dynamique et engagée


Benefits

Ce que Smood propose :


Salarié(e) à l'heure, selon le planning défini par le manager local
Convention Collective de Travail
Un contrat à durée maximale en premier lieu, puis possibilité de passer sur un contrat à durée indéterminée en cas de bonne performance
Une équipe dynamique, motivée et en pleine croissance
Un travail varié et mobile
Une activité de contact, tant avec nos partenaires qu'avec nos clients
Travailler de manière autonome et responsable


Smood est un acteur majeur en Suisse de la livraison de repas de vos restaurants préférés à domicile ou au bureau. Nous sommes présents dans les principales villes de Suisse et poursuivons notre expansion de jour en jour.

Intéressé(e) ? Téléchargez l'application Smood Driver et envoyez-nous votre candidature.

https://www.smood.ch/fr/o/join-us/driver

Title: Portier (m/w/d) 60-100%
Description:
"We are successful because we do ordinary things in an extraordinary way"

(Ueli Prager, Founder of Mövenpick)

Gehst Du auch gerne den besonderen Weg, um durch Qualität in Deiner täglichen Arbeit zu überzeugen?

Dann suchen wir Dich nach Vereinbarung als...

Portier (m/w/d) im Stundenlohn

Dein Lächeln verzaubert jeden Gast und lässt Herzen höherschlagen. Auch am Telefon und per Email versprühst Du Charme und Professionalität.

Du bist Gastgeber/in aus Leidenschaft und ein Organisationstalent sondergleichen! Unsere Gäste werden sich gerne an Dich erinnern und beim nächsten Besuch überrascht sein, dass Du dich noch an deren Namen erinnerst. Du bist stolz, in so einem tollen Haus unseren Gästen einen ausserordentlichen Aufenthalt zu bescheren. Du weisst, dass dies eine einzigartige Chance ist an einem so ungewöhnlichen Ort mitzuwirken und möchtest diese Gelegenheit nur ungern verstreichen lassen.

#yourdailybusiness


Kofferservice der an- und abreisenden Gäste
Valetservice der an- und abreisenden Gäste
Unterstützung bei der Reinigung der öffentlichen Bereiche (Fensterreinigung, Staubsaugen, Reinigung des Eingangsbereiches etc.) inklusive dem Aussenbereich
Wäscheservice bei unseren Gästen in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Front Office und der Lingerie
Abreisekontrolle der ausstehenden abzureisenden Zimmer / Suiten
Minibarkontrolle in den Zimmern / Suiten
Unterstützung bei Verteilaktionen für die Zimmer / Suiten
Zusatzaufgaben im Rahmen seiner Tätigkeit (bspw. Abholfahrten mit dem hoteleigenen Fahrzeug)
Unterstützung und Zusammenarbeit mit unserer externen Housekeeping Firma
Unterstützung des Teams am Front Office in der Operativen


#yourqualifications


Du hast bereits Erfahrung als Portier in der gehobenen Hotellerie
Spass an Deinem Beruf, Passion für Sauberkeit und Ordnung
Selbstständige und exakte Arbeitsweise sowie gute körperliche Belastbarkeit
Du schätzt die Vorzüge im Schichtdienst zu arbeiten (kein Nachtdienst)
Gute Deutsch-und Englischkenntnisse, alle weiteren Sprachen sind von Vorteil
Du hast Lust und Pioniergeist, Teil eines einzigartigen Projekts zu sein


#whatsinforyou


Offene Feedbackkultur und Mitsprachemöglichkeit
Stellung und Reinigung der Berufskleidung
Kostenlose Getränke (Kaffee, Tee und Wasser etc.)
FELFEL-Kühlschrank mit leckeren Gerichten in der Personalkantine

HTML:
"We are successful because we do ordinary things in an extraordinary way"

(Ueli Prager, Founder of Mövenpick)

Gehst Du auch gerne den besonderen Weg, um durch Qualität in Deiner täglichen Arbeit zu überzeugen?

Dann suchen wir Dich nach Vereinbarung als...

Portier (m/w/d) im Stundenlohn

Dein Lächeln verzaubert jeden Gast und lässt Herzen höherschlagen. Auch am Telefon und per Email versprühst Du Charme und Professionalität.

Du bist Gastgeber/in aus Leidenschaft und ein Organisationstalent sondergleichen! Unsere Gäste werden sich gerne an Dich erinnern und beim nächsten Besuch überrascht sein, dass Du dich noch an deren Namen erinnerst. Du bist stolz, in so einem tollen Haus unseren Gästen einen ausserordentlichen Aufenthalt zu bescheren. Du weisst, dass dies eine einzigartige Chance ist an einem so ungewöhnlichen Ort mitzuwirken und möchtest diese Gelegenheit nur ungern verstreichen lassen.

#yourdailybusiness

  • Kofferservice der an- und abreisenden Gäste

Title: Ingenieurgeologen/in, Materialwissenschaftler/in, Chemieingenieur/in
Description:
Die TFB-Gruppe ist eine schweizweit tätige, führende Unternehmensgruppe in den Bereichen Bauexpertise (Neubau, Instandsetzung, Materialtechnologie), Baustoffprüfung mit drei akkreditierten Baustoffprüflaboratorien, Weiterbildung für die Baubranche, Entwicklung und Vertrieb von Prüf- und Monitoring-Geräten, Forschung und Normung.




Für den Bereich Beratung & Expertisen suchen wir für den Standort Wildegg eine/n




Ingenieurgeologen/in, Materialwissenschaftler/in, Chemieingenieur/in Arbeitspensum 80 – 100%




Sie interessieren sich für die Erhaltung von Bauwerken und Untersuchungen in einem Baustoffprüflabor. Dazu verfügen Sie über materialtechnische Kenntnisse im Bereich Bindemittel und Betonbau und möchten Ihr Know-how in einem neuen Umfeld einbringen und erweitern? Dann sind Sie bei uns genau richtig! Nach einer strukturierten Einarbeitung bieten wir Ihnen eine spannende Möglichkeit, Ihr Wissen gezielt einzusetzen.




Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehören:

• Unterstützung des Baustoffprüflabors bei Spezialprüfungen im Bereich Zement, Beton und Gesteinskörnungen

• Mikroskopische Gefügeuntersuchungen von Beton an Dünnschliffpräparaten

• Petrographische Analysen von Gesteinsgemischen

• Kundenberatungen im Bereich Bindemittel und Beton

• Unterstützung Bauproduktehersteller bei der Optimierung ihrer Produkte

• Zustandsuntersuchung von Betonbauten und Ingenieurbauwerken

• Mitarbeit bei der Zertifizierung von Bauprodukten, Tätigkeit als Auditor

• Mitwirkung als Dozent/in bei Weiterbildungsveranstaltungen und CAS-Programmen

• Durchführen von angewandten Forschungs- und Entwicklungsprojekten




Was wir Ihnen bieten:

• Mitarbeit in einem dynamischen und motivierten Team (Ingenieure, Geologen, Chemiker, Baustoffprüfer)

• Sehr abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit Entwicklungspotenzial

• Grosse Selbstständigkeit und Mitgestaltungsmöglichkeiten

• Attraktive Arbeitsbedingungen wie flexible Arbeitszeiten und vorteilhafte Sozialversicherungen




Was Sie mitbringen:

• Hoch- oder Fachhochschulabschluss in Geologie, Materialwissenschaft oder Ingenieurwesen

• Unternehmerisches und lösungsorientiertes Handeln

• Selbstständige, sorgfältige und effiziente Arbeitsweise

• Guter mündlicher und schriftlicher Ausdruck in Deutsch und Englisch, Französischkenntnisse von Vorteil

• Kommunikations- und organisationsstarke Persönlichkeit mit hoher Sozialkompetenz




Interessiert?

Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung! Senden Sie Ihre Unterlagen per E-Mail an Herr Yves Schiegg (schiegg@tfb.ch). Falls Sie Fragen zur Position haben, steht Ihnen Herr Schiegg unter +41 62 887 72 49 gerne zur Verfügung.




Mehr über uns und unsere spannenden Tätigkeiten erfahren Sie auf www.tfb.ch.

TFB AG Lindenstrasse 10, 5103 Wildegg Dr. Yves Schiegg

Bereichsleiter Beratung & Expertisen +41 62 887 72 49 | schiegg@tfb.ch

Show more

Title: Internship Project Engineer
Description:
The job

Are you ready to take your engineering skills to the next level? At Younergy, we empower you with the tools and opportunities to shine as Intern Engineer in the world of the solar photovoltaics systems. This position leverages your expertise in civil, mechanical, and electrical engineering concepts, allowing you to make a meaningful impact on the future of clean energy. Join our leading Swiss solar company, working from our offices in Crissier, Switzerland.

As an Intern PV Project Engineer, your primary goal is to support Project Managers in coordination with the Engineering Department to craft solar PV System designs and electrical layouts that not only meet customer requirements but also adhere to local regulations. Your work will be at the forefront of ensuring the efficiency and accuracy of our solar installations. Join our dynamic team to spearhead the adoption of solar energy, contribute to our business success, and be a part of the renewable energy evolution - come join us!

What will be your main responsibilities?


Use software tools like PVSol to design state-of-the-art PV systems
Static calculations for different types of solar panel structures
String design calculations
Develop electrical diagrams
Expertly interpret blueprints and technical drawings
Collaborate cross-functionality with engineering, project management, and installation teams to meet client needs and deadlines



What will you need to succeed?


Student degree in architectural, mechanical, civil, or electrical engineering, or the equivalent qualifying experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in French
Another language is a plus



What can you expect?


To join a fast-growing solar company at the forefront of the distributed energy revolution
Working with dynamic colleagues in a multicultural environment
Opportunity to develop within the company, including possible relocation to Portugal
Contribute to an important mission to accelerate the adoption of renewable energy in Europe



Don't wait, apply now!
Show more

Title: Postdoctoral Fellow
Description:
PSI Home
Career & Education
Job Opportunities


The Paul Scherrer Institute PSI is the largest research institute for natural and engineering sciences within Switzerland. We perform cutting-edge research in the fields of future technologies, energy and climate, health innovation and fundamentals of nature. By performing fundamental and applied research, we work on sustainable solutions for major challenges facing society, science and economy. PSI is committed to the training of future generations. Therefore, about one quarter of our staff are post-docs, post-graduates or apprentices. Altogether, PSI employs 2300 people.

For the Center for Radiopharmaceutical Sciences, we are looking for a

Postdoctoral Fellow

08.07.2025


Postdoctoral
2211-00
100%


Share Job


Facebook
LinkedIn
Mail
X (Twitter)


Apply online now

Your tasks

You will take preclinical cancer research in radiopharmaceutical sciences to the next level by implementing sophisticated in vitro models based on innovative approaches, combining new technologies with classic approaches. You collaborate with researchers and technicians from diverse backgrounds and coordinate projects. By contributing your own expertise and integrating it with the knowledge of other team members, you drive the project toward successful outcomes.

Your profile

You hold a master degree in chemistry, biology, engineering or a related field within Life Sciences or Material Sciences. During your PhD studies you developed expertise in microphysiological systems (e.g. organ-on-a-chip). You are highly motivated to work in an interdisciplinary environment and have the ability to integrate methodologies and concepts from diverse research fields. You are driven by curiosity for new technologies and inspired to develop your own ideas to effectively advance scientific projects in preclinical cancer research. You have the skills to address scientific challenges and are confident in taking on responsibility. You have strong proficiency in spoken and written English, complemented by excellent communication skills.

We offer

Our institution is based on an interdisciplinary, innovative and dynamic collaboration. You will profit from a systematic training on the job, in addition to personal development possibilities and our pronounced vocational training culture. If you wish to optimally combine work and family life or other personal interests, we are able to support you with our modern employment conditions and the on-site infrastructure.

Your employment contract is limited to 2 years.

For further information, please contact Prof. Dr. Cristina Müller, phone +41 56 310 44 54.

Please submit your application online by 31 August 2025 (including list of publications and addresses of referees) for the position as a Postdoctoral Fellow (index no. 2211-00).

Paul Scherrer Institute, Human Resources Management, Serdal Varol, 5232 Villigen PSI, Switzerland

Title: Sensor Fusion Engineer
Description:
About us:

Daedalean is a Zürich-based startup founded by experienced engineers who want to completely revolutionize air travel within the next decade. We combine computer vision, deep learning, and robotics to develop full “level-5” autonomy for flying vehicles.

Your role:

To facilitate the integration of additional sensors (such as radar or lidar) into Daedalean's various systems, going beyond purely camera-based environment perception in order to make them more accurate, more reliable, and employable in an even wider range of environmental conditions.

Your tasks will include the following:


Research, analyze, and select sensors suitable for our products and applications.
Prepare raw sensor data for fusion, including tasks like data alignment, synchronization, calibration, noise reduction, and handling outliers to ensure data compatibility and quality
Design and implement algorithms that integrate data from diverse sensor modalities (e.g., cameras, lidar, radar, IMUs, GPS) to create a unified and robust perception of the surroundings. This may involve techniques from data fusion, signal processing, and machine learning
Collaborate with hardware and software teams to integrate sensors and sensor fusion algorithms into our prototypes and products
Test new sensors and validate sensor fusion algorithms in both simulated environments and real-world scenarios to ensure accuracy, reliability, and safety



Requirements:


At least 2 years hands-on working experience with at least two of the following sensor types: radar, lidar, cameras
In-depth knowledge of various sensor types (lidar, radar, cameras, IMUs, GPS), their operating principles, strengths, weaknesses, and data characteristics
Good programming skills in C++
Experience with sensor fusion algorithms
Master’s in Aerospace Engineering, Robotics, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field



Benefits:


A team of experienced engineers and researchers, who joined us from most recognized companies and institutions
Difficult and interesting problems to solve.
Hybrid work setting
Learning & Development budget: visit conferences of your choice
Gym membership

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Position

Data Scientist

Job Responsibilities

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.

Main Responsibilities


Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.
Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.


Profile


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
Preferably experience with Dataiku.
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
Fluency in English and Italian are a mus


Additional Information

LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person’s singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent
Show more

Title: Data Scientist/ML Engineer
Description:
Ciao, talento del tech! 🌟

Siamo MatchGuru, piacere di conoscerti!




Ci presentiamo, come è giusto che sia 🤝

MatchGuru è più di una piattaforma: è l'epicentro dove talenti e aziende si scoprono, capiscono e incontrano.

Con le nostre soluzioni tecnologiche proprietarie, acceleriamo ed efficientiamo il processo di selezione, liberandolo da rallentamenti ed errori. Questo ci rende una vera e propria guida sia per i talenti, che accompagniamo verso le opportunità più affini alle proprie caratteristiche e aspettative, sia per l’azienda, che aiutiamo a scovare i candidati perfetti prima di ogni altri competitor.




Come farai match con la tua azienda ideale💘

Candidandoti a uno degli annunci delle nostre Talent Acquisition, ti collegherai alla piattaforma MatchGuru, dove potrai creare il tuo profilo da zero, inserire le tue competenze tecniche e raccontarci qual è l’azienda in cui ti piacerebbe lavorare. Una volta che ci avrai detto tutto di te, il nostro team di recruiter ti contatterà per presentarti la tua azienda ideale. Sarà un colpo di fulmine?




⭐ L'opportunità

Posizione: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer
Seniority: 2+ anni di esperienza
Modalità di lavoro: Ibrido su Roma
Contratto: Collaborazione con Partita IVA




💡 Potresti fare match con questa posizione se:

Hai una laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Statistica o campi affini
Hai forti competenze in Python e conosci bene librerie ML (scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch) e strumenti di data science (pandas, NumPy)
Hai una solida comprensione dei mercati finanziari e delle dinamiche di trading
Hai un'ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese




💼 Le tue responsabilità includeranno:

Sviluppare, testare e ridefinire modelli predittivi
Creare pipeline di machine learning
Tradurre ipotesi di investimento in feature scalabili insieme al team prodotto
Analizzare rischi e comportamenti delle strategie in diversi contesti di mercato




🌟 Nice to have:

Hai contribuito a progetti open source in ambito trading o machine learning




💶 Ma andiamo al sodo: ecco cosa ti offriamo

Collaborazione in P.IVA
Opportunità di crescita rapida in una startup statunitense in forte espansione
Ambiente di lavoro dinamico, giovane e internazionale
Offsite internazionali




Se pensi di essere il match perfetto per questa opportunità o conosci qualcuno che potrebbe esserlo, candidati subito oppure contattaci! 📩




Proviamo a matchare? 🚀




N.B. Ricorda di esplicitare nel CV il tuo consenso al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.LGS. 196/03. La ricerca è rivolta a persone di ogni genere, nel rispetto della normativa vigente (L.903/77).

Title: Junior Data Scientist | Big Data & Advanced Analytics (Milano-Roma)
Description:
Junior Data Scientist – Big Data & Advanced Analytics




Sede: Milano - Roma (Ibrido)

Azienda: Be Management Consulting

Settore: Consulenza direzionale e IT per il settore bancario




CHI CERCHIAMO

Siamo alla ricerca di un Junior Data Scientist con una forte passione per l’Intelligenza Artificiale e il Machine Learning. Cerchiamo una persona curiosa, proattiva e desiderosa di mettersi in gioco, imparare sul campo e crescere rapidamente in un ambiente dinamico e innovativo.




COSA FARAI

Supporto all’analisi e modellazione dati: collaborerai allo sviluppo di modelli di Machine Learning e AI, affiancato da profili più senior.
Sviluppo algoritmi e sperimentazione: parteciperai all’implementazione per l’elaborazione e l’interpretazione dei dati, contribuendo alla trasformazione digitale delle aziende.
Big Data & Advanced Analytics: contribuirai all’analisi di dataset complessi nel settore finanziario.
Data Visualization: realizzerai dashboard e report sotto la guida di figure esperte per rendere i dati facilmente comprensibili agli stakeholder.
Formazione continua: imparerai a lavorare in team multidisciplinari, sperimentando tecnologie e approcci innovativi.




REQUISITI

Formazione: Laurea Magistrale o PHD in Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria o discipline affini.
Esperienza: 0–2 anni in ambito Data Science / AI / Advanced Analytics (anche tirocini o progetti universitari rilevanti).
Competenze tecniche Conoscenza di Python (o alternativamente R, Matlab, SPSS, SAS), SQL e strumenti di analisi statistica. Familiarità con ambienti cloud (preferibilmente Azure).
Soft Skills: Forte motivazione, spirito di iniziativa, voglia di imparare, capacità di lavorare in team e affrontare nuove sfide.
Lingue: Ottima conoscenza dell’inglese scritto e parlato.
Tool: Interesse per strumenti di Data Visualization e BI







CHI SIAMO

Be | Shaping the Future, parte del gruppo Engineering, è tra i principali player in ambito Management Consulting e ICT Solutions. Forniamo servizi di Business Advisory, Information Technology e Digital Engagement, supportando primarie istituzioni finanziarie e industriali nelle loro sfide di trasformazione digitale. Con circa 2.000 dipendenti e una presenza internazionale, il Gruppo è un punto di riferimento nel settore Financial Services.

Be Management Consulting è la società del Gruppo Be | Shaping the Future specializzata in Business Advisory. Supportiamo i nostri clienti nella gestione di progetti complessi con un approccio tailor-made, combinando competenze specialistiche e capacità di orchestrare soluzioni end-to-end.




COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Flessibilità: Sede a Milano con ampia possibilità di smart working.
Formazione continua: Accesso a corsi interni ed esterni per lo sviluppo professionale.
Feedback & crescita: Valutazioni periodiche basate sul merito e contatto diretto con il senior management.
Percorso di carriera dinamico: Crescita rapida in un ambiente giovane e imprenditoriale.




Durante il colloquio risponderemo a tutte le tue curiosità su Be e su come puoi fare la differenza.

Let’s shape our future together!




“I dati che Lei ci fornirà saranno raccolti dalla società Be Shaping the Future S.p.A. in quanto esclusivamente finalizzati alle attività di ricerca e selezione del personale, per posizioni aperte attuali e future, per un potenziale inserimento all’ interno delle singole società del gruppo Be: Be Shaping the Future S.p.A., Be Shaping the Future Management Consulting S.p. A., Be Shaping the Future Corporate Services S.p.A., Be Shaping the Future DigiTech Solutions S.p.A., IQUII Srl, Tesla Consulting Srl, Dream Of Ordinary Madness Entertainment S.r.l, Be Your Essence S.r.L , Be Poland Think, Solve & Execute Sp. z o. o., iBe Think Solve, Execute Ltd., targit GmbH, Be Think, Solve, Execute RO s.r.l., Be Ukraine Think, Solve, Execute LLC., nonché di ogni altra società appartenente al Gruppo Be. Per quanto non espressamente previsto in questo annuncio si rinvia all’Informativa privacy di Gruppo https://www.be-tse.it/it/ della quale l’interessato dichiara di aver preso visione condividendone il contenuto”.

Title: BNL BNP Paribas – Data Scientist
Description:
Entrare a far parte di BNL Gruppo BNP Paribas, significa lavorare in una delle principali banche italiane, parte di un Gruppo internazionale leader europeo nei servizi bancari e finanziari, presente in più di 70 paesi con circa 199 mila collaboratori. Significa quindi lavorare in un ambiente sfidante, con una cultura internazionale e fortemente orientato all’innovazione.

Chi cerchiamo

Siamo alla ricerca di un Data Scientist da inserire all’interno della struttura Tribe Data Platform.

Cosa farai concretamente?

Il candidato avrà come principale obiettivo quello di garantire impatto concreto dei progetti di Intelligenza Artificiale all’interno dell’organizzazione, facilitando scalabilità, efficienza e innovazione.

Le sue responsabilità principali saranno quelle di progettazione di modelli avanzati, coordinamento alle implementazioni e supervisione dei profili più junior.

Guiderà quindi le scelte tecniche, interagendo con gli stakeholder al fine di comprendere le esigenze e tradurle in soluzioni tecniche scalabili.

Le Competenze Richieste


Padronanza di tecniche avanzate di machine learning, ottimizzazione modelli e data engineering.
Esperienza con infrastrutture dati (es. cloud, data lake, pipeline ETL).
Capacità di scegliere l’approccio analitico più adatto a contesti diversi.
Ottime doti comunicative per spiegare risultati complessi a pubblici non tecnici.


Di cosa si occupa la struttura Tribe Data Platform

La tribe Data Platform, tra le prime ad aver adottato la modalità di lavoro Agile all’interno della Banca, rappresenta il centro di competenza nell’ambito dell’Intelligenza Artificiale all’interno dell’organizzazione e verso il Gruppo Bnp Paribas.

Guida Pertanto La Strategia AI Attraverso


lo sviluppo di nuovi casi d’uso di Intelligenza Artificiale anche generativa
realizzando e manutenendo le piattaforme applicative di riferimento
programmi di formazione specifici e animando la community dei Data Scientist


Inoltre


assicura la valorizzazione del patrimonio informativo della banca con l’aggiornamento continuo del Datawarehouse e la creazione di Datamart tematici, a supporto di Business Intelligence e Advanced Analytics, garantendo il rispetto della Data Quality, in coerenza con le strategie definite dal CoE Data Governance & Quality del Gruppo;
assicura, in coerenza con le linee guida del Gruppo, il coordinamento del Framework Data Protection (GDPR) al fine di definire i processi Privacy end-to-end in ottica Privacy by Design;
sviluppa la comunità della Data Guild garantendo il presidio di Privacy, Intelligenza Artificiale, Reportistica e Dati al fine di diffondere l’approccio Data-Driven in tutte le strutture di business e funzioni aziendali


Il/la Candidato/a Ideale


È preferibilmente in possesso di una Laurea in, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Economia o Informatica
Ha acquisito un’esperienza di almeno 3-7 anni nel medesimo ruolo
Possiede ottime capacità analitiche
È in possesso di un’ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese


Sedi di lavoro: Roma

In un mondo che cambia, la diversità e l’inclusione sono valori fondamentali. BNP Paribas offre pari opportunità di lavoro a tutti i candidati idonei e si impegna attivamente a garantire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutte le diversità siano valorizzate.

Cosa aspetti? Candidati per il ruolo di Data Scientist e costruiremo insieme, passo dopo passo, la banca del domani: innovativa, responsabile e sostenibile. Il tuo futuro professionale nel Gruppo BNP Paribas ti aspetta!

Il presente annuncio si rivolge a candidati di ambo i sessi (D.Lgs. 198/2006, Codice Pari Opportunità)

Cosa aspetti? Candidati per il ruolo di Data Scientist e costruiremo insieme, passo dopo passo, la banca del domani: innovativa, responsabile e sostenibile. Il tuo futuro professionale nel Gruppo BNP Paribas ti aspetta!

Il presente annuncio si rivolge a candidati di ambo i sessi (D.Lgs. 198/2006, Codice Pari Opportunità)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Location: Rome, Italy (Hybrid)

Job Type: Full-time




The Opportunity

HCL Software is looking for a creative and driven Machine Learning Engineer or Data Scientist to join our innovation hub in Rome. You'll be at the center of our mission to democratize AI by building a groundbreaking no-code platform for Agentic AI.

This isn't just a modeling job; it's a chance to build the tools that empower others to create powerful AI agents without writing a single line of code. If you're passionate about Generative AI and want to build solutions with massive scale and impact, we want to talk to you.




What You'll Do:

Build an Agentic AI Platform: Take a leading role in designing and developing our innovative no-code platform, enabling users to build, test, and deploy custom AI agents.
Develop & Fine-Tune Advanced Models: Design, train, and optimize a range of machine learning models, with a strong focus on Large Language Models (LLMs) and other Generative AI techniques.
Engineer Data Pipelines: Own the data lifecycle from start to finish—build robust pipelines for data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing, and perform expert feature engineering.
Innovate & Research: Stay at the forefront of the AI/ML landscape. Research new techniques from papers and open-source projects and apply them to solve real-world challenges.
Collaborate for Impact: Partner closely with software engineers, product managers, and other data scientists to seamlessly integrate your ML models into HCL's core products.




What You'll Bring (Requirements):

Proven Experience: A track record of success in a Machine Learning Engineer or Data Scientist role, with demonstrable projects.
Programming Mastery: Expert-level Python skills are a must.
ML Framework Expertise: Deep, hands-on experience with modern ML libraries like PyTorch or TensorFlow, and frameworks for generative models like LangChain, LangGraph, or similar.
Core Data Science Skills: Strong abilities in data preprocessing, feature engineering, and rigorous model evaluation.
Strong Foundations: A Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field like Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or Applied Math.
Communication Skills: The ability to clearly explain complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.




Nice to Haves:

Experience with MLOps: deploying and managing models in production using cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
Familiarity with other programming languages like Java.




Why You'll Love Working Here

Build Something New: This is a rare opportunity to shape a flagship AI product from the ground up, with a focus on cutting-edge Generative AI and agent-based systems.
Direct Impact: Your work will directly empower users and businesses, making a visible and measurable impact on our products and the industry.
Continuous Learning: We support your growth with opportunities to attend conferences, pursue certifications, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the field.
Global Collaboration: Be part of a diverse, intelligent, and supportive international team that values creativity and pushing boundaries.




Ready to build the future of AI? Apply now!




Note: Kindly attach resume in English




**HCL is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees




Certificate of Disability in Force by law 68/99. If you have a valid disability certificate, kindly let us know during the selection process.

Among HCL's principles we would like to highlight diversity and inclusion as a strength in our values and practices. To achieve all our objectives, it intends to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as a key factor and differentiator of fundamental innovation in our organization. We welcome and value all people, and we are committed to the inclusion and sense of belonging of each person who is part of HCL.

HCL is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.




Candidate Data Privacy Notice

https://www.hcltech.com/candidate-privacy-notice

  • Build Something New: This is a rare opportunity to shape a flagship AI product from the ground up, with a focus on cutting-edge Generative AI and agent-based systems.
  • Direct Impact: Your work will directly empower users and businesses, making a visible and measurable impact on our products and the industry.
  • Continuous Learning: We support your growth with opportunities to attend conferences, pursue certifications, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the field.
  • Global Collaboration: Be part of a diverse, intelligent, and supportive international team that values creativity and pushing boundaries.


Ready to build the future of AI? Apply now!


Note: Kindly attach resume in English


**HCL is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees


Certificate of Disability in Force by law 68/99. If you have a valid disability certificate, kindly let us know during the selection process.

Among HCL's principles we would like to highlight diversity and inclusion as a strength in our values and practices. To achieve all our objectives, it intends to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as a key factor and differentiator of fundamental innovation in our organization. We welcome and value all people, and we are committed to the inclusion and sense of belonging of each person who is part of HCL.

HCL is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.


Candidate Data Privacy Notice

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Sei un* Artificial Intelligence Engineer pront* a nuove sfide? Allora continua a leggere, perché ti stiamo cercando per un'opportunità di carriera unica!




Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo con solida esperienza nello sviluppo e nell’ottimizzazione di modelli linguistici di grandi dimensioni (LLM) e tecniche avanzate di Natural Language Processing (NLP).




Le responsabilità

🚩Progettare, sviluppare e ottimizzare modelli NLP e LLM per applicazioni enterprise

🛠️Eseguire fine-tuning, prompt engineering, e gestire pipeline di NLP su modelli open-source o custom

💻Integrare modelli AI all’interno di sistemi scalabili tramite API e architetture cloud

🔤Lavorare con vector database per soluzioni basate su retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) o semantic search

🔨Collaborare con team multidisciplinari per portare in produzione soluzioni AI performanti e affidabili




I requisiti

🎓Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica o affini (PhD è un plus)

🚩Esperienza avanzata in Python per lo sviluppo di soluzioni AI/ML

🛠️Familiarità con le principali librerie e framework AI (es. Transformers, Hugging Face, LangChain, spaCy)

💻Solida esperienza nella progettazione e consumo di API RESTful / GraphQL

🔤Esperienza con cloud provider come GCP o AWS, inclusi strumenti AI/ML (Vertex AI, Sagemaker, etc.)

🔨Conoscenza pratica di LLM open-source (es. LLaMA, Mistral, Falcon), Fine-tuning supervisionato o LoRA e Vector DB (es. FAISS, Weaviate, Pinecone)




L’offerta

Orario full time
Sede di lavoro: Roma, modalità di lavoro in sede (Zona Prati)
RAL commisurata all'esperienza
Un ambiente di lavoro stimolante, dinamico e giovane
Opportunità di partecipare a corsi di formazione
Iniziative di team building per favorire la coesione e il benessere del team
Assicurazione sanitaria e welcome kit




Il profilo ideale

Eccellenti abilità tecniche e passione per l'innovazione
Capacità di collaborare in team, ottima gestione dello stress e capacità di problem solving
Spirito creativo e orientato al raggiungimento degli obiettivi




Chi Siamo

Contrader è una società con esperienza pluriennale in ambito ICT, esperta nella realizzazione di progetti e nella consulenza aziendale ad altissima specializzazione nel settore ICT e nello sviluppo di componenti software. Abbiamo la ferma convinzione che la crescita aziendale sia strettamente legata alla capacità di anticipare i cambiamenti, esplorando strade e idee innovative. La nostra missione va infatti oltre l'offerta di soluzioni immediate e miriamo a creare risorse altamente qualificate per il futuro.




https://contrader.it/
