Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Sei un* Machine Learning Engineer pront* a nuove sfide? Allora continua a leggere, perché ti stiamo cercando per un'opportunità di carriera unica!







Le responsabilità

🚩Progettare e implementare pipeline di training e retraining scalabili per modelli ML/LLM

🛠️Gestire dati su larga scala per pre-processing, augmentation, versioning e validazione

💻Collaborare con Data Scientist e AI Engineer per lo sviluppo di modelli ottimizzati

🔤Eseguire il fine-tuning di modelli pre-addestrati (es. BERT, GPT, LLaMA) per task specifici

🔨 Integrare i modelli in ambienti produttivi tramite API robuste e scalabili

👉Utilizzare vector DB per sistemi RAG o retrieval-based

💼Ottimizzare l’infrastruttura su cloud (GCP/AWS) per efficienza e costi




I requisiti

🎓Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica o affini (PhD è un plus)

🚩Forte padronanza di Python e principali librerie ML (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn)

🛠️Esperienza nel design e deployment di API RESTful

💻Conoscenza dei principali strumenti per il versioning e l’orchestrazione (MLflow, DVC, Airflow, Prefect)

🔤Esperienza su cloud GCP e/o AWS (es. Vertex AI, Sagemaker, BigQuery, S3, Lambda)

🔨Familiarità con: Modelli LLM e modelli NLP open-source; Tecniche di fine-tuning supervisionato, LoRA, quantizzazione Vector database (FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate)

👉Solide basi in architetture di ML pipeline, job scheduling e ottimizzazione delle risorse

💼Conoscenza di MLOps e CI/CD per modelli AI (plus)







L’offerta

Orario full time
Sede di lavoro: Roma, modalità di lavoro in sede (Zona Prati)
RAL commisurata all'esperienza
Un ambiente di lavoro stimolante, dinamico e giovane
Opportunità di partecipare a corsi di formazione
Iniziative di team building per favorire la coesione e il benessere del team
Assicurazione sanitaria e welcome kit




Il profilo ideale

Eccellenti abilità tecniche e passione per l'innovazione
Capacità di collaborare in team, ottima gestione dello stress e capacità di problem solving
Spirito creativo e orientato al raggiungimento degli obiettivi




Chi Siamo

Contrader è una società con esperienza pluriennale in ambito ICT, esperta nella realizzazione di progetti e nella consulenza aziendale ad altissima specializzazione nel settore ICT e nello sviluppo di componenti software. Abbiamo la ferma convinzione che la crescita aziendale sia strettamente legata alla capacità di anticipare i cambiamenti, esplorando strade e idee innovative. La nostra missione va infatti oltre l'offerta di soluzioni immediate e miriamo a creare risorse altamente qualificate per il futuro.




https://contrader.it/

Title: Generative AI & Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RINA is currently recruiting for a Generative AI & Machine Learning Engineer to join its office in Rome / Genoa / Naples / Bari / Milan within the Digital Technology and Cybersecurity Division.

Mission

The mission of this role is to design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge generative AI solutions on the Azure platform. The successful candidate will leverage Azure's AI tools and services to create innovative applications that drive business growth and efficiency.

Key Accountabilities


Solution Design & Development: Design and develop generative AI models and algorithms using Azure Cognitive Services, Azure OpenAI, and Azure Machine Learning.
AI Model Training: Fine-tune and optimize pre-built generative models or develop custom solutions for NLP, image generation, and other AI applications.
Cloud Integration: Implement end-to-end AI solutions, integrating them with existing cloud infrastructures and leveraging Azure services such as Azure Data Lake, Azure Functions, and Azure DevOps.
Deployment & Monitoring: Deploy AI models in production environments, ensuring scalability, security, and high performance. Utilize Azure’s monitoring tools to track model performance and optimize for efficiency.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, cloud architects, and product teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Innovation: Stay updated with the latest trends in AI and cloud technology, continuously improving and adapting the AI solutions to enhance business capabilities.


Qualifications

Proven +2 years experience as


Programming Languages: Advanced proficiency in Python, with experience in using AI/ML libraries (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow).
Azure AI Services: Strong knowledge of Azure OpenAI, Cognitive Services, and Azure Machine Learning.
Cloud Architecture: Solid understanding of cloud architecture, especially within the Azure ecosystem (Azure Functions, Azure DevOps, Azure Kubernetes Services).
DevOps Practices: Experience with DevOps practices for AI deployment (CI/CD pipelines, containerization).
Generative Models: In-depth experience with models like GPT-4, Llama, including fine-tuning and customization.
NLP Techniques: Experience in natural language processing and text generation patterns.


Nice to Have:


Advanced Python Development: Knowledge of best practices, frameworks, and code optimization.
Teamwork: Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Problem Solving: Analytical skills to tackle complex issues.
Certifications: Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate or similar certifications.


Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering General

Master’s Degree

Competencies


CLIENT INTIMACY - Embrace internal and external client needs, expectations, and requirements to ensure maximum satisfaction
EARN TRUST - Take everyone's opinion into account and remain open to diversity
PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT - Promote commitment by keeping promises as a Role Model
MANAGE EMOTIONS - Recognise one's and other's emotions and express and regulate one's reactions
PIONEER CHANGE - Actively embrace change and benefit from the new circumstances
BUILD NETWORK - Forge trust relationships, across departments, and outside the organization
MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS - Structure activities according to priorities, actions, resources and constraint
ADDRESS THE WAY - Have a big picture of different situations and reinterpret it in a perspective way
THINK FORWARD - Capitalise on experiences and translate them into action plans for the future


With over 5,800 employees and 200 offices in 70 countries worldwide, RINA is a multinational player which provides certification, marine classification, product testing, site supervision and vendor inspection, training and engineering consultancy services across a wide range of sectors. Our business model covers the full process of project development, from concept to completion. The aim is to guarantee a project’s technical, environmental and safety - and sometimes also economic and financial - sustainability.

At RINA, we endeavor to create a work environment where every single person is valued and encouraged to develop new ideas. We provide equal employment opportunities and are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels respected and safe from discrimination or harassment of any kind. It is the policy of RINA to provide equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy) national origin, age, disabilities, marital status, sexual orientation, genetics, military status, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, other protected veterans (veterans who served during a war or in a campaign or expedition for which a badge has been authorized), and Armed Forces service medal veteran, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. We are strongly committed to this policy and believe in the concept and spirit of the law.

RINA does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or agencies. Any resume submitted to any employee of RINA without a prior written search agreement will be considered unsolicited and the property of RINA. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Title: Front End Developer - Italy
Description:
Company Overview

We are seeking ambitious and self-driven candidates to join our global team. Our company offers opportunities to work with cutting-edge technology and provides career growth prospects.

Job Description

The Front-End Developer will be responsible for translating designs into code and creating customer-centric experiences. This role involves collaboration with a diverse, globally distributed team including software engineers, UX designers, product/project managers, and domain specialists.

Key Responsibilities


Implement user interface designs using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript
Develop responsive and cross-browser compatible web applications
Collaborate with UX designers to optimize user experiences
Work within Agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban)
Utilize test-driven development practices
Manage source control systems adhering to best practices
Communicate effectively with team members across different time zones


Education

Required Qualifications


Bachelor/Master's degree in Computer Science or related field


Technical Skills


Proficiency in JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3
Experience with functional programming
Expertise in at least one of: Angular or React
Familiarity with test-driven development tools and practices
Knowledge of source control systems and best practices


Methodologies


Experience with Agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban)


Soft Skills


Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills for effective teamwork


Language


Fluency in English (both written and spoken)


Legal


Valid EU visa or work permit


Preferred Qualifications


Experience working in distributed teams
Knowledge of additional front-end frameworks or libraries
Understanding of UX/UI principles


Employment Details


Contract Type: Full-time, permanent
Working Mode: Hybrid


Learn more at iongroup.com.

Important Notes

According to the Italian Law (L.68/99) please note that candidates from the disability list will be given priority.

Please do not apply if you don’t currently have the legal right to work in Italy, or if that right is just about to expire, or if that right has restrictions imposed which would prevent you from undertaking a full-time employment contract.

Due to the high volume of applications, only those candidates that meet the required criteria for selection will be contacted.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Siamo alla ricerca di un AI Engineer con focus su LLM e automazione intelligente, da inserire nell'organico del nostro team di Roma.

Tale figura è il punto di riferimento per l’integrazione di modelli linguistici avanzati in applicazioni aziendali, workflow automatizzati e soluzioni intelligenti. Il ruolo richiede una solida capacità di orchestrazione di strumenti di AI generativa, automazione lowcode e API, con un approccio orientato all’efficienza dei processi e all’innovazione concreta.




Responsabilità:

Integrazione di LLM nei Processi: progettare e implementare chatbot, assistenti virtuali, agenti intelligenti e motori di risposta automatica basati su modelli LLM.
Prompt Engineering Avanzato: scrivere e ottimizzare prompt complessi per ottenere output coerenti, personalizzati e utili a seconda del contesto applicativo.
Sviluppo di Workflow Automatizzati: creare e mantenere automazioni tra strumenti aziendali usando piattaforme come Make, Zapier, n8n o simili.
Orchestrazione API e AI Services: integrare servizi esterni tramite API REST/GraphQL e orchestrare tool come OpenAI, Anthropic, Meta AI, Hugging Face, ecc.
Data Pipeline e Preprocessing: gestire flussi di dati strutturati e non strutturati per alimentare i modelli, anche tramite scraping, parsing, e normalizzazione.
Ottimizzazione e A/B Testing: testare diverse varianti di prompt, modelli e flussi automatizzati per ottimizzare le performance e la user experience.
Supporto e Consulenza Interna: collaborare con team di prodotto, marketing, operation e customer care per identificare casi d’uso concreti.




Requisiti preferenziali :

Competenze Tecniche: conoscenza di LLM (OpenAI GPT-4, Claude, LLaMA, Grok, ecc.),
linguaggi come Python/JavaScript, e tool come LangChain, LlamaIndex, AutoGPT.
Esperienza con Automazione: utilizzo avanzato di Make, Zapier, 8n8, Airtable, Notion, Slack,
Gmail, ecc. in scenari di automazione end-to-end.
Formazione: laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria o campi affini. Esperienza anche autodidatta
con portfolio di progetti AI/automation è considerata altamente rilevante.
Certificazioni: OpenAI Developer Badge, Zapier Expert, Make Partner Certification, o
equivalenti.
Soft Skills: mentalità creativa e sperimentale, capacità di sintesi, attenzione ai dettagli,
orientamento al problem solving.




Cosa ti offriamo?

Opportunità di lavoro in un ambiente dinamico e stimolante;
Orario di lavoro flessibile;
Programma di welfare aziendale;
Ticket Restaurant;
Formazione e Sviluppo continuo;
Possibilità di Smart Working rispetto al ruolo ricoperto;
Accesso ai corporate benefits aziendali;
Azioni di work-life balance per conciliare equilibrio vita privata e professionale. Certificati Family Audit.

Orario di lavoro: Full-time

Sede di lavoro: Roma

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91

Show more
HTML:
Siamo alla ricerca di un AI Engineer con focus su LLM e automazione intelligente, da inserire nell'organico del nostro team di Roma.

Tale figura è il punto di riferimento per l’integrazione di modelli linguistici avanzati in applicazioni aziendali, workflow automatizzati e soluzioni intelligenti. Il ruolo richiede una solida capacità di orchestrazione di strumenti di AI generativa, automazione lowcode e API, con un approccio orientato all’efficienza dei processi e all’innovazione concreta.


Responsabilità:

  • Integrazione di LLM nei Processi: progettare e implementare chatbot, assistenti virtuali, agenti intelligenti e motori di risposta automatica basati su modelli LLM.
  • Prompt Engineering Avanzato: scrivere e ottimizzare prompt complessi per ottenere output coerenti, personalizzati e utili a seconda del contesto applicativo.
  • Sviluppo di Workflow Automatizzati: creare e mantenere automazioni tra strumenti aziendali usando piattaforme come Make, Zapier, n8n o simili.
  • Orchestrazione API e AI Services: integrare servizi esterni tramite API REST/GraphQL e orchestrare tool come OpenAI, Anthropic, Meta AI, Hugging Face, ecc.
  • Data Pipeline e Preprocessing: gestire flussi di dati strutturati e non strutturati per alimentare i modelli, anche tramite scraping, parsing, e normalizzazione.
  • Ottimizzazione e A/B Testing: testare diverse varianti di prompt, modelli e flussi automatizzati per ottimizzare le performance e la user experience.
  • Supporto e Consulenza Interna: collaborare con team di prodotto, marketing, operation e customer care per identificare casi d’uso concreti.


Requisiti preferenziali :

  • Competenze Tecniche: conoscenza di LLM (OpenAI GPT-4, Claude, LLaMA, Grok, ecc.),
  • linguaggi come Python/JavaScript, e tool come LangChain, LlamaIndex, AutoGPT.
  • Esperienza con Automazione: utilizzo avanzato di Make, Zapier, 8n8, Airtable, Notion, Slack,
  • Gmail, ecc. in scenari di automazione end-to-end.
  • Formazione: laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria o campi affini. Esperienza anche autodidatta
  • con portfolio di progetti AI/automation è considerata altamente rilevante.
  • Certificazioni: OpenAI Developer Badge, Zapier Expert, Make Partner Certification, o
  • equivalenti.
  • Soft Skills: mentalità creativa e sperimentale, capacità di sintesi, attenzione ai dettagli,
  • orientamento al problem solving.


Cosa ti offriamo?

  • Opportunità di lavoro in un ambiente dinamico e stimolante;
  • Orario di lavoro flessibile;
  • Programma di welfare aziendale;
  • Ticket Restaurant;
  • Formazione e Sviluppo continuo;
  • Possibilità di Smart Working rispetto al ruolo ricoperto;
  • Accesso ai corporate benefits aziendali;
  • Azioni di work-life balance per conciliare equilibrio vita privata e professionale. Certificati Family Audit.

Orario di lavoro: Full-time

Sede di lavoro: Roma

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91

Title: BORSA DI STUDIO DATA SCIENTIST “R F-2021-12372565 - A comprehensive investigation of cell-free Epimarks Power In diagnosis and prognosis of Nonalcoholic fatty liver (E-PIN)”
Company: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
Description:
Descrizione azienda

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS, World’s Best Hospital per il terzo anno consecutivo secondo la classifica Newsweek e unico italiano nella top 40 a livello mondiale.

La sua Mission è quella di affermarsi nelle seguenti aree di maggior rilievo:

Innovazione, Cura, Ricerca e Solidarietà

CHI CERCHIAMO?

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS è alla ricerca di persone con spirito d'iniziativa e capacità innovative, approccio alla multidisciplinarietà e al lavoro di gruppo, con voglia di intraprendere un percorso insieme nell’eccellenza professionale sanitaria in un contesto sfidante ed internazionale.

Posizione

BANDO DI SELEZIONE PER TITOLI

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli IRCSS indice una selezione per titoli per il conferimento di una Borsa di Studio destinata al progetto

“R F-2021-12372565 - A comprehensive investigation of cell-free Epimarks Power In diagnosis and prognosis of Nonalcoholic fatty liver (E-PIN)”

Il Borsista Si Occuperà Di


Il Data Scientist addetto analizza e processa i dati mediante approcci ed algoritmi avanzati di intelligenza artificiale seguendo le indicazioni dello specialista.
Si occupa di creare e validare modelli predittivi in collaborazione con i team clinici nel campo della ricerca traslazionale.
Supporta la redazione di pubblicazioni e protocolli.


Requisiti

L’ammontare del Fondo destinato alla borsa di studio sarà pari ad Euro lordi complessivi 20.000,00per l’intera durata della borsa di studio. La borsa di Studio avrà una durata di 18 mesi e l’impegno di massima necessario allo svolgimento del progetto sarà di 30 ore settimanali.

Il borsista dovrà essere in possesso del seguente titolo di studio:


Laurea in Data Science, Ingegneria Biomedica, Informatica, Fisica.


Costituiscono Altri Requisiti Necessari


Competenza nell'analisi ed elaborazione di dati e bioimmagini.
Esperienza nello sviluppo di modelli predittivi di machine learning e deep-learning.
Conoscenza avanzata di linguaggi di programmazione: Python, MatLAB&Simulink, R, C++.
Conoscenza avanzata dei sistemi operativi Linux e Windows.
Conoscenza avanzata dei pacchetti MS Office
Conoscenza avanzata dei software di statistica (SPSS, STATA, R)


Altre informazioni

La Commissione Esaminatrice Sarà Composta Da

Il Direttore Scientifico della Fondazione o un suo delegato, in qualità di Presidente;

Il Responsabile scientifico del progetto o un suo delegato in qualità di componente specialista nella disciplina interessata al progetto;

Il Direttore Risorse Umane o un suo delegato, che svolgerà le funzioni di Segretario.

La valutazione dei titoli dei candidati avverrà attraverso un giudizio sintetico motivato espresso dalla Commissione per ciascun candidato.

Se necessaria sarà prevista una prova orale.

Il vincitore riceverà apposita comunicazione scritta previa formale convocazione presso i preposti uffici della Direzione Risorse Umane.

Entro i successivi 5 giorni dalla ricezione della comunicazione, il vincitore dovrà presentare formale dichiarazione di accettazione della borsa di studio.

Il mancato rispetto dei termini e delle modalità indicati nella comunicazione trasmessa al vincitore determinano la decadenza del vincitore stesso.

La partecipazione alla selezione non determinerà la formazione di una graduatoria.

Può essere previsto un colloquio orale ai candidati in possesso dei requisiti previsti.

Entro il 24 luglio 2025 gli interessati, in possesso dei requisiti anzidetti, possono recapitare la domanda di ammissione al bando, scaricabile attraverso il seguente link https://www.policlinicogemelli.it/moduli-borse-di-studio/ e il proprio cv, corredato di tutti i titoli ritenuti opportuni, all’indirizzo di posta elettronica [email protected]

Prima di procedere alla candidatura, si prega di effettuare la necessaria registrazione attraverso il tasto “Apply Now”.

Il presente bando è pubblicato in data 10 luglio 2025 e sarà ritirato il 24 luglio 2025.

Title: ML Engineer Senior
HTML:
NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, è tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services. Con più di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicità, talento ed attitudine. Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunità e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate as Senior Machine Learning Engineer in NTT DATA will have a solid Generative AI hands-on capability (preferably on Azure/GCP and on-premise GenAI architecture and MLops), mathematical background, experience working on a range of classification, informational retrieval, clustering, and optimization problems, establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analysis, model development, model validation and model implementation.

The Senior Machine Learning Engineer will work alongside experienced Data Scientists, Data and ML Engineers to identify business opportunities, design and create new data pipelines from scratch, from experiments to deploying them in production.

He/She will be responsible for multiple projects, leading the ML Engineers and connecting with the stakeholders.

Required Skills

  • At least 5 years of production experience working in Data Science or Software Engineering;
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms;
  • At least 6/12 months of experience in Generative AI deployment and underlying architecture handling;
  • Vector Database knowledge is well appreciated;
  • Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture;
  • Fluent in a at least two mainstream programming language (Python, Scala, Java, C++);
  • Experience in building an infrastructure for technical users, such as Data Scientist, ML practitioners or data consumers/producers;
  • Strong knowledge of Spark, Databricks is a strong plus;
  • Experience developing/deploying ML solutions in one of the public cloud platforms and on a Cross-cloud base, Snowflake knowledge is a plus;
  • Deep knowledge with machine learning frameworks (such as Keras or PyTorch);
  • Ability to design and implement machine learning pipelines in a production environment;
  • Experience with deployment including knowledge of CI/CD, containerization, and related concepts with a focus over MLops/Re-Training/Drift Management;
  • Ability to train more junior team members in multiple Machine Learning and Deep Learning concepts;
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal team members and external clients


Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Pisa, Roma, Torino

﻿ Third parties fraudulently posing as NTT DATA recruiters

NTT DATA recruiters will never ask job seekers and candidates for payment or banking information during the recruitment process, for any reason. Please remain vigilant of third parties that may try to impersonate NTT DATA recruiters, either in writing or by phone, in an attempt to deceptively obtain personal data or money from you. All email communications from an NTT DATA recruiter will be associated with an @ email address. NTT DATA will not use any non-NTT DATA or personal email domains (Gmail, Yahoo, etc.) or personal communication channels (WhatsApp, Facebook etc) at any time during the recruitment process. If you suspect any fraudulent activity, please .

Title: AI/GenAI Engineer
HTML:
Collaborates with the technical team to implement both traditional machine learning and generative AI systems under senior guidance.

This role supports the entire AI development process, from data collection and preprocessing through model deployment and monitoring for both predictive and generative applications. The Engineer builds and refines prompt templates for various LLM use cases while implementing retrieval-augmented generation systems to enhance generative applications with external knowledge. They contribute to solution development using established frameworks and model architectures, focusing on feature engineering for traditional ML and context engineering for generative applications.

This position involves conducting comparative evaluations between traditional machine learning approaches and generative AI alternatives to determine optimal solutions for specific business problems. The Engineer maintains comprehensive documentation of code, methodologies, and experimental results for both AI and generative AI implementations. They actively participate in code reviews and knowledge-sharing sessions while staying current with emerging trends across the AI/GenAI landscape. Throughout the software development lifecycle, the Engineer implements AI-assisted tools and workflows to enhance productivity and quality, collaborating across teams to integrate these capabilities into existing systems.

Mandatory

  • 2+ years of experience in AI/GenAI/ML development roles, with demonstrated experience in generative AI;
  • Experience implementing AI/GenAI features throughout different phases of software development;
  • Solid understanding of fundamentals across machine learning, deep learning, and generative AI;
  • Proficiency in Python programming with experience using TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, and LangChain;
  • Working knowledge of prompt engineering techniques for LLMs and other generative models;
  • Good understanding of relational and vector databases for AI/GenAI applications.


Preferred

  • Basic knowledge of Java, C#, Go, or Node.js for AI/GenAI integration;
  • Familiarity with version control systems and collaborative development workflows;
  • Experience with AI-assisted software development tools and workflows;
  • Clear communication skills for presenting technical findings on AI/GenAI implementations;
  • Basic understanding of ML/GenAI deployment processes and monitoring requirements;
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt to rapidly evolving AI/GenAI technologies;
  • Bachelor's degree or higher in relevant field (or equivalent practical experience).


Location : Milano, Roma, Torino, Pisa, Napoli, Treviso, Cosenza, Genova, Bari, Salerno, Bologna.

Title: Research Scientist Display Technologies
Description:
Research Scientist

Display Technologies Unit

IRBM is a scientific contract research organization (CRO) that stands at the forefront of drug discovery, leveraging a single, unified research facility, located in Pomezia (Rome), Italy, to accelerate team-based breakthroughs and improve efficiencies from initial concept to pre-clinical candidate.

With a history of contributing to several approved drugs, and its own internal pipeline of oncology and other therapeutic assets, IRBM is powered by deep collaborations and decades of expertise from leading global institutions. Our comprehensive in-house capabilities assist partners in achieving key milestones and progressing towards clinical readiness, positioning IRBM as a major player in driving innovation in the pharmaceutical and biotech fields.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated PhD Scientist with expertise in drug discovery, Phage Display, and mRNA display technologies to join our Display Technologies team. The successful candidate will contribute to the identification and development of novel therapeutic agents and play a key role in our drug discovery efforts and will be responsible for driving the execution and expansion of the state-of art of new Display methodologies. Candidates with prior research experience abroad will be given priority.

Key Responsibilities

Design and execute experiments using Phage Display and mRNA display technologies to identify high-affinity peptides and antibodies.
Conduct bio-panning and selection rounds to enrich for target-specific clones.
Analyze sequencing data to identify unique peptide and antibody sequences.
Develop and optimize assays for binding, internalization, and functional activity of identified candidates.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate findings into broader drug discovery projects.
Maintain detailed and accurate records of experimental procedures and results.
Present research findings at internal and external meetings and conferences.
Stay current with advancements in drug discovery, Phage Display, and mRNA display technologies.

Qualifications & Requirements:

PhD in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, or a related field.
Extensive experience with drug discovery, Phage Display, and mRNA display technologies.
Proficiency in molecular biology techniques such as PCR, cloning, and sequencing.
Strong background in protein-protein interactions and assay development.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Ability to coordinate multiple projects.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Proficient in English.
Experience with high-throughput screening (HTS) methods is a plus.

The position is based in Pomezia (RM).

During the job interview, we will evaluate each candidate’s experience, and the job offer will be commensurate.

We thank all applicants for their interest. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

IRBM considers all qualified applicants without discrimination, including on the basis of race, gender, age, disability, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, or other protected classes. We nurture an inclusive culture where everyone can show their full potential and enjoy a fulfilling career.

Title: Neolaureato STEM
Description:
Start your Career in Tech – AI, Data & Cloud (Neolaureati STEM)




Neolaureati STEM per Percorsi Professionali in AI, Data Engineering & Cloud Analytics




Hai una laurea in ambito STEM e vuoi costruire la tua carriera nel mondo dell’innovazione tecnologica? Ti appassionano i dati, l’intelligenza artificiale e il mondo del cloud?




Humanativa Group, società di consulenza e system integration nel settore ICT, ti offre l’opportunità di entrare in un percorso dedicato a giovani neolaureati che vogliono crescere nei settori più dinamici del mercato:

📊 Data Engineering

🤖 Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning

☁️ Cloud Analytics & Business Intelligence




🎓 Chi cerchiamo

Neolaureati o laureandi in discipline STEM:

▪️ Informatica, Ingegneria (Informatica, Gestionale, Automazione), Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Data Science con interesse verso uno o più dei seguenti ambiti:




Data Engineering: pipeline, database, Big Data, Spark, SQL
Pipeline dati (ETL/ELT)
Database e modellazione dati
Big Data & Distributed Processing




Data Analytics & Cloud: strumenti e piattaforme cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) con focus sulle seguenti tecnologie:
Computing, storage, database, machine learning, IoT, DevOps, analytics.
S3 (storage), EC2 (computing), RDS/Redshift (database),
Lambda (serverless), SageMaker (ML), Glue (ETL)
BigQuery (analisi di dati su larga scala)
Cloud Storage, Cloud Functions, Vertex AI (ML end-to-end)
Pub/Sub (messaggistica), Dataflow (ETL in streaming/batch)
Azure Synapse Analytics, Data Lake, Azure Functions




AI & Machine Learning: modelli predittivi, reti neurali, Python, TensorFlow, NLP, computer vision con interesse e basi in:
Intelligenza Artificiale
Machine Learning & Deep Learning
Python, SQL, TensorFlow, PyTorch o simili
Esperienze con progetti accademici, tesi o hackathon a tema AI




🚀 Perché scegliere Humanativa

✅ Lavorerai su progetti reali e innovativi per clienti di alto profilo

✅ Avrai accesso a percorsi formativi strutturati e certificazioni

✅ Ti inserirai in team composti da professionisti di talento, in un ambiente stimolante

✅ Investiamo sul tuo futuro con formazione on-boarding e upskilling




📈 Cosa ti offriamo

Contratto iniziale finalizzato all’assunzione stabile
Percorso formativo personalizzato (Data, AI, Cloud)
Affiancamento con mentor e accesso a piattaforme e-learning avanzate
Possibilità di crescita verticale in linea con le tue passioni e attitudini




Il tuo futuro inizia qui.

Valorizza la tua laurea con uno sbocco lavorativo nel mondo dell’ICT di frontiera: costruisci con noi il tuo percorso come professionista dei dati, dell’intelligenza artificiale e delle piattaforme cloud.




Candidati ora!

✅ Investiamo sul tuo futuro con formazione on-boarding e upskilling


📈 Cosa ti offriamo

  • Contratto iniziale finalizzato all’assunzione stabile
  • Percorso formativo personalizzato (Data, AI, Cloud)
  • Affiancamento con mentor e accesso a piattaforme e-learning avanzate
  • Possibilità di crescita verticale in linea con le tue passioni e attitudini


Il tuo futuro inizia qui.

Valorizza la tua laurea con uno sbocco lavorativo nel mondo dell’ICT di frontiera: costruisci con noi il tuo percorso come professionista dei dati, dell’intelligenza artificiale e delle piattaforme cloud.


Candidati ora!

Title: Data Science Engineer
HTML:
Fincons Group è una società internazionale di consulenza IT che da oltre 40 anni accompagna le imprese nel cogliere le opportunità del cambiamento digitale, proponendo soluzioni e tecnologie all’avanguardia che anticipano sempre il futuro. Alle aziende dei settori Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and Insurance, International Institutions, Manufacturing, Media, Public Administration e Transportation, Fincons offre consulenza sulle strategie IT in diversi ambiti, così come servizi di system integration di pacchetti internazionali, soluzioni proprietarie e servizi IT in Smart-Shore e in Off-Shore. Il Gruppo conta oggi 2800 collaboratori e diverse sedi in Italia, Svizzera, UK, Germania, Francia, Belgio, Stati Uniti ed India.

Nell’ottica di un potenziamento dell’organico, il Gruppo è alla ricerca di un profilo di:

Data Science Engineer

La risorsa sarà coinvolta in un progetto per importante cliente internazionale nel mondo manufacturing, di implementazione di un'innovativa soluzione di produzione di processo guidata dall'AI.

La figura dovrà aver maturato solide competenze di Data Science per progettare e implementare analisi avanzate e algoritmi predittivi basati sui dati generati dalle macchine.

Responsabilità:

Il candidato deve essere in grado di applicare un ragionamento critico e autonomo per affrontare diverse tipologie di problemi, individuando soluzioni efficienti, performanti ed adeguate.

Sarà responsabile di padroneggiare l'intero processo di sviluppo dei modelli end-to-end, dalla raccolta e preparazione dei dati, formazione dei modelli, valutazione e presentazione degli stessi.

Infine, i modelli prodotti dovranno essere monitorati e verificati utilizzando processi ad hoc, al fine di programmare in modo appropriato e tempestivo i lavori di riqualificazione e garantire costantemente le prestazioni e l'affidabilità dei modelli.

Requisiti:

  • Esperienza nel ruolo di almeno 5 anni;
  • Consolidata esperienza di Python, per la programmazione orientata ad oggetti, scripting e notebook (Jupyter);
  • Esperienza nel progettare ed implementare algoritmi analitici e predittivi avanzati basati su dati generati dalle macchine;
  • Integrazione e manipolazione di dati provenienti da varie fonti on-premise e Cloud (AWS) per lo sviluppo di soluzioni di Data Analytics;
  • Data cleaning e ispezione di timeseries, dataset strutturati e non strutturati con pandas, scikit-learn e Numpy;
  • Conoscenza di concetti di machine learning e deep learning necessari a sviluppare algoritmi di predizione come LSTM, RNN,NN, Decision Trees;
  • Attività di Data Visualization e presentazione dei dati adottando Matplotlib, Seaborn o affini;
  • Progettare il monitoraggio post-deployments e le pipeline di re-training;
  • Sfruttare i servizi AWS (Lambda, SageMaker, RDS) per l'elaborazione e la modellazione scalabile dei dati;
  • Collaborare con altri Data Scientist, Process Engineer e team DevOps;
  • Conoscenza fluente della lingua inglese, livello almeno B2.


Nice to have:

  • Esperienza nel settore manifatturiero, nell'IoT o nell'automazione dei processi industriali;
  • Familiarità con ambienti containerizzati (Docker, Kubernetes);


Cosa offriamo:

  • Un percorso di carriera strutturato, volto alla valorizzazione e al potenziamento delle competenze
  • Accesso ai programmi di formazione e certificazione aziendali
  • Contesto internazionale, giovane e stimolante
  • Modalità di lavoro ibrida e orario flessibile.


Sede di lavoro: Roma

E’ richiesta la disponibilità ad effettuare trasferte.

La ricerca è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi. Saranno prese in considerazione, altresì, candidature di risorse che risultino appartenenti alle Categorie Protette con percentuale di invalidità superiore al 46%.

I dati saranno trattati e conservati esclusivamente ai fini della presente o di future selezioni, garantendo i diritti di cui all’art. 13 Dlgs 196/03 e del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679).

Title: Junior - Cloud Strategy
Description:
Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team Cloud Strategy & Architecture di Deloitte Engineering nella sede di Milano/Roma, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il team di Cloud Strategy & Architecture si impegna ogni giorno a guidare i clienti nello sviluppo ed esecuzione di strategie cloud multi-dimensionali che considerano le piattaforme, le architetture, la sicurezza, gli aspetti organizzativi e finanziari derivanti dall’adozione delle soluzioni Cloud, supportando i propri clienti nella definizione della cloud strategy e nel disegno dell’architettura target da implementare.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:


Supportare i propri clienti nella definizione della cloud strategy, nel disegno dell’architettura target da implementare, nella migrazione dei workloads in cloud, nel cloud native application development, fino alla governance delle soluzioni Cloud implementate.
Raccogliere e analizzare i dati a supporto dell’elaborazione di soluzioni per i clienti
Possedere un forte orientamento al team working, alla collaborazione e al supporto dei colleghi, mantenendo sempre un approccio positivo alle situazioni
Partecipare ad importanti progetti internazionali End to End lavorando sulla definizione della cloud strategy delle aziende clienti


Winning Requirements


Laurea triennale/specialistica (conseguita o in corso di completamento) in Ingegneria o discipline tecnico/scientifiche affini
Forte propensione/interesse per il Cloud e per le nuove tecnologie emergenti
Gradita la conoscenza di piattaforme cloud come AWS, Azure e GCP
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata
Ottime capacità analitiche, precisione, autonomia organizzativa e spiccato orientamento al raggiungimento dei risultati
Disponibilità a trasferte


To Make an Impact that Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo.

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

FedEx Dataworks is an organization rooted in connecting the physical and digital sides of their network to meet today's needs and address tomorrow's challenges. The Data Scientist role involves leveraging AI and data science to optimize delivery experiences and contribute to data-driven solutions in logistics.




Responsibilities:

• Under full supervision, helps advance Dataworks’ broad capabilities to use and deploy cutting edge data science and machine learning tools and methods in Dataworks projects, platforms and products.

• Anchors current best practices by supporting the design and build of reusable data science assets.

• Simultaneously works to help keep Dataworks on the bleeding edge by researching and understanding the very latest and most sophisticated methods and tools for grappling with large scale and complex problems.

• Learns and helps apply descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, prescriptive and ensemble modeling, statistical techniques, and use of database tools and/or other approaches in quantitative analysis of complex business situations.

• Helps provide recommendations to issues through knowledge of data scientific methods and machine learning / data engineering practices.

• Works in tandem with data scientists in peer positions.

• The Data Scientist I plays a pivotal role, focused on supporting data science innovation within Dataworks, helping to define and build the Dataworks organization, and supporting more senior data scientists in the delivery of key business initiatives.

• S/he acts as a “universal translator” between IT, business, software engineers and data engineers, collaborating with these multi-disciplinary teams.

• The Data Scientist I will contribute to the adherence of technical standards for data science and machine learning, including the design and construction of reusable data assets.

• S/he will learn to work with large data sets and solve difficult analytical problems, often applying advanced methods.

• S/he will support the creation and implementation of solutions from concept to production, using current and emerging technologies to evaluate trends and develop actionable insights and recommendations.

• Day-to-day, s/he will be involved in code development and the support of small-scale deployments.

• Understanding at a high-level both the business and technical problems Dataworks aims to solve

• Exploring data and crafting models to answer core business problems that may not have a common blueprint

• Supporting the invention of new approaches and algorithms for tackling data intensive problems

• Helping the team scale up from “laptop-scale” to “cluster scale” problems by contributing to efforts to standardize and industrialize solutions

• Delivering tangible value rapidly, collaborating with diverse teams of varying backgrounds and disciplines

• Interacting with peer technologists from the broader enterprise and outside of FedEx (partner ecosystems and customers) to create synergies and identify opportunities for improvement

• Following best practices for future reuse in the form of accessible, reusable patterns, templates, and code bases




Qualifications:




-Required:

• Technical background in computer science, data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistics or other quantitative and computational science

• Experience or familiarity with designing and deploying large scale technical solutions, which deliver tangible, ongoing value

• Direct experience or familiarity with building and deploying production systems that implement modern, data scientific methods at scale

• Ability to context-switch, to provide support to dispersed teams which may need an 'expert hacker' to unblock an especially challenging technical obstacle, and to work through problems as they are still being defined

• Demonstrated ability to support technical projects within a team, often working under tight time constraints to deliver value

• An 'engineering' mindset, willing to make rapid, pragmatic decisions to improve performance, accelerate progress or magnify impact

• Comfort with working with distributed teams on code-based deliverables, using version control systems and code reviews

• Solid theoretical grounding in the mathematical core of the major ideas in data science

• Good understanding or familiarity with a class of modelling or analytical techniques, often supported by Masters-level research in the subject

• Familiarity with the mathematical 'primitives' and generalizations of data science – e.g., expertise in Linear Algebra, and Vector Calculus

• Use of agile and devops practices for project and software management including continuous integration and continuous delivery

• Strong knowledge in advanced data science and machine learning tools and methods, including the iterative development of analysis pipelines to provide insights at scale.

• Strong knowledge and experience in conducting end-to end analyses, including data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, and presentations.

• Experience as a member of multi-functional project teams.

• Strong oral and written communication skills.

• General knowledge or familiarity with some of the following common languages and tools: SKLearn, XGBoost, Tensorflow, Pytorch, MLlib and other core machine learning frameworks, Python, Scala, Java and other modern programming languages, MLFlow, Databricks, Spark, Kafka and other data tools and frameworks, CPLEX, Gurobi and other similar optimization modeling packages.

• Data Scientist I Minimum Qualifications: Minimum Education: Bachelor's Degree in computer science, operations research, statistics, applied mathematics or related quantitative discipline. A related advanced degree may offset the related experience requirements.

• Minimum Experience: One-year equivalent experience in computer science, operations research, statistics, applied mathematics or related quantitative discipline. A related advanced degree may offset the related experience requirements.

• Data Scientist II Minimum Qualifications: Minimum Education: Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Operations Research, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.

• Minimum Experience: At least two (2) years of professional experience applying data science (e.g., machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistical analysis), operations research (e.g., optimization, algorithms, mathematical modeling), and data analytics to reduce costs, enhance profitability, and improve customer experience. An advanced degree in a related field may be considered in lieu of some experience.

• Data Scientist III Minimum Qualifications: Minimum Education: Master’s Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Operations Research, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or related quantitative discipline. Directly related PhD preferred.

• Minimum Experience: At least three-four (3-4) years of professional experience applying data science (e.g., machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistical analysis), operations research (e.g., optimization, algorithms, mathematical modeling), and data analytics to reduce costs, enhance profitability, and improve customer experience. An advanced degree in a related field may be considered in lieu of some experience.




-Preferred:

• Building and managing data pipelines: You'll be skilled in setting up and maintaining automated processes (like ETL) to get data from different sources into a usable format, using tools like Airflow.

• Optimizing data for analysis: You'll know how to store and access data efficiently in various databases (SQL) and data warehouses (like Snowflake or BigQuery) so it's ready for model building.

• Ensuring data quality: You'll be able to create systems that check, clean, and track data to make sure it's reliable and accurate for machine learning models.




Company:

Please follow the official FedEx LinkedIn Company Page for updates, product and service information, operating company news and regular content: https://www.linkedin.com/company/fedex/. FedEx Dataworks has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description


Spait Infotech is a leading software development and staffing company with a strong global presence in India, USA, Canada, UK, and Australia. We specialize in delivering cutting-edge software solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of businesses worldwide. Our team of skilled developers and IT professionals ensure high-quality services in software development, including web applications, mobile apps, and enterprise solutions. Additionally, we provide comprehensive staffing solutions to support organizational growth, offering temporary staffing, contract-to-hire, and direct hire placements.


Role Description


This is a contract role for a Data Scientist based on-site in Wilmington, DE. The Data Scientist will be responsible for analyzing large datasets, performing statistical analyses, and creating data visualizations. Other tasks include developing predictive models, conducting data analysis, and identifying trends and patterns in data to support business decisions. The role requires collaboration with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions.


Qualifications

\n

Data Science and Statistics skills
\n

Proficiency in Data Analytics, including processing and analyzing large datasets
\n

Competence in Data Visualization tools and techniques
\n

Strong Data Analysis skills
\n

Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills
\n

Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team setting
\n

Experience in programming languages such as Python or R
\n

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field
\n

Experience in the software development industry is a plus
\n

\n

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Entry Level
Description:
Kensho is an Artificial Intelligence company that builds solutions to uncover insights in messy and unstructured data. They are seeking upcoming graduates to join their team of Machine Learning Engineers to develop a cutting-edge GenAI platform and LLM-powered applications.




Responsibilities

Work with unique proprietary unstructured data and structured datasets, applying advanced NLP techniques to extract insights and build solutions that drive business value.
Design, build and maintain scalable production-ready ML systems.
Actively participate in the ML model lifecycle, from problem framing and data exploration to model experimentation, deployment, and monitoring in production, ensuring the continuous improvement and optimization of our ML solutions.
Partner with our ML Operations team to deliver solutions for automating the ML model lifecycle, from technical design to implementation.
Work in a cross-functional team of ML engineers, Product Managers, Designers, Backend & Frontend engineers who are passionate about delivering exceptional products.




Qualification




Required

Bachelor's degree or higher with relevant classwork or internships in Machine Learning
Experience with advanced machine learning methods
Strong statistical knowledge, intuition, and experience modeling real data
Expertise in Python and Python-based ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow)
Demonstrated effective coding, documentation, and communication habits
Strong communication skills and ability to effectively express complicated methods and results to a broad, often non-technical, audience




Preferred

Publication(s) in top-tier journals and conferences in the ML domain
Show more
HTML:
Kensho is an Artificial Intelligence company that builds solutions to uncover insights in messy and unstructured data. They are seeking upcoming graduates to join their team of Machine Learning Engineers to develop a cutting-edge GenAI platform and LLM-powered applications.


Responsibilities

  • Work with unique proprietary unstructured data and structured datasets, applying advanced NLP techniques to extract insights and build solutions that drive business value.
  • Design, build and maintain scalable production-ready ML systems.
  • Actively participate in the ML model lifecycle, from problem framing and data exploration to model experimentation, deployment, and monitoring in production, ensuring the continuous improvement and optimization of our ML solutions.
  • Partner with our ML Operations team to deliver solutions for automating the ML model lifecycle, from technical design to implementation.
  • Work in a cross-functional team of ML engineers, Product Managers, Designers, Backend & Frontend engineers who are passionate about delivering exceptional products.


Qualification


Required

  • Bachelor's degree or higher with relevant classwork or internships in Machine Learning
  • Experience with advanced machine learning methods
  • Strong statistical knowledge, intuition, and experience modeling real data
  • Expertise in Python and Python-based ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow)
  • Demonstrated effective coding, documentation, and communication habits
  • Strong communication skills and ability to effectively express complicated methods and results to a broad, often non-technical, audience


Preferred

  • Publication(s) in top-tier journals and conferences in the ML domain

Title: Entry Level Data Science Analyst
Description:
Job_Summary:

Whole Foods Market is committed to nourishing people and the planet, seeking a Data Science Analyst to transform data into impactful narratives. In this role, you will partner with various teams to uncover trends, translate business challenges into data questions, and collaborate with data scientists to interpret large datasets.




Responsibilities:

• Partner with teams across the business—from local store leadership to national strategy—to uncover key trends and opportunities.

• Translate real-world business challenges into actionable data questions and craft thoughtful approaches to answer them.

• Collaborate with a team of data scientists and analysts to explore, model, and interpret large datasets using machine learning, data mining, and statistical tools.

• Ensure the accuracy and integrity of our data so we’re always building on a solid foundation.

• Create compelling reports and visuals that tell meaningful stories—clear, engaging, and accessible to all stakeholders.

• Bring your analytical curiosity to projects that support our mission: from merchandising and marketing to customer experience and sustainability.




Qualifications:




-Required:

• Bachelor’s degree with 2–4 years of relevant experience (or a comparable blend of education and experience)

• A strong grasp of core data science principles and a track record of applying them to real-world challenges

• Familiarity with tools like Python, R, and other data science platforms

• Comfort working with a range of data: customer behavior, product performance, and operational trends

• Ability to think critically, ask the right questions, and bring structure to ambiguity

• A strong storyteller who can translate data into insight and insight into action




-Preferred:

• A Master’s degree in a related field

Whole Foods Market is a supermarket chain owned by Amazon that exclusively sells natural and organic products. It is a sub-organization of Amazon. Whole Foods Market has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

• Bring your analytical curiosity to projects that support our mission: from merchandising and marketing to customer experience and sustainability.

Title: Data Scientist, Sr.
Description:
About The Company

Compass Pathways plc (Nasdaq: CMPS) is a pioneering biotechnology company dedicated to transforming mental health treatment through evidence-based innovation. Headquartered in London, UK, with offices in New York City and San Francisco, the company focuses on developing novel therapies to improve the lives of individuals suffering from mental health challenges who do not respond to current treatments. With a commitment to advancing mental wellbeing, Compass Pathways is at the forefront of research into psilocybin-based therapies, aiming to provide effective and accessible solutions for conditions such as treatment-resistant depression, post-traumatic stress disorder, and anorexia nervosa. The company's proprietary formulation of synthetic psilocybin has received breakthrough therapy designation from the FDA, underscoring its potential to revolutionize mental health care.

About The Role

We are seeking a motivated and highly skilled Senior Data Scientist, Real World Evidence, to join our Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR) team. In this role, you will work closely with our Principal Data Scientist to support the design, execution, and analysis of real-world evidence studies utilizing large healthcare datasets. Your expertise in programming, data analysis, and healthcare data sources will be instrumental in informing research strategies and business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in biostatistics, epidemiology, or related fields, with a passion for leveraging real-world data to generate insights that support the development and commercialization of our innovative therapies. This position offers a hybrid working model based in our New York City office or remote on the East Coast of the USA.

Qualifications


Master's degree or higher in biostatistics, epidemiology, data science, biomedical/health/clinical informatics, health economics and outcomes research, or a related quantitative field.
Significant experience programming and analyzing large healthcare datasets (e.g., Optum, Marketscan, Medicare, EHR/EMR data) within biotech, pharmaceutical, or healthcare consulting environments.
Proficiency in statistical programming languages such as R, Python, and SQL.
Experience working with healthcare coding systems including ICD, CPT, NDC, etc., and resolving data quality issues.
Knowledge of advanced analytical methods such as regression models, survival analysis, and propensity score matching is preferred.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks effectively.
Excellent communication skills, capable of translating complex analyses into actionable insights for diverse stakeholders.
Experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools like R Shiny, Tableau, or Power BI is highly desirable.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners.


Responsibilities


Partner with HEOR, medical, clinical development, and commercial teams to design and execute real-world evidence studies aligned with company research and business objectives.
Develop, validate, and maintain reproducible code for data processing, cohort identification, outcome measurement, and statistical analysis using healthcare claims and EHR data, ensuring compliance with protocols and analysis plans.
Create high-quality tables, figures, and visualizations for internal reports, regulatory submissions, presentations, and scientific publications.
Conduct rigorous quality assurance, peer code reviews, and validation of programming deliverables to ensure accuracy and reproducibility.
Perform exploratory and ad-hoc analyses to address urgent scientific or business questions, effectively communicating findings to stakeholders.
Assess the suitability and quality of various healthcare data sources for addressing specific research questions.
Develop interactive dashboards and visualizations to facilitate data-driven decision-making processes.
Stay informed about advancements in real-world data methodologies, programming tools, and therapeutic area knowledge relevant to our portfolio.
Collaborate with external partners, academic institutions, and data vendors to enhance research capabilities and data access.


Benefits


Competitive salary range of $136,000 to $184,000 USD per annum, commensurate with experience and qualifications.
Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.
Opportunities for professional development and continuous learning within a pioneering biotech environment.
Flexible working arrangements including hybrid and remote options to support work-life balance.
Participation in innovative projects that have the potential to significantly impact mental health treatment globally.
Discretionary bonuses and equity options as part of total compensation package.


Equal Opportunity

US applicants: Compass Pathways is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy and related conditions), ethnicity, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military service, genetic information, familial or marital status, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.
